original: ci ste 'dir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs sam gal te dmigs na ni rnam pa gnyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'dir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs sam gal te dmigs na ni rnam pa gnyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is perceived by itself, then there would be a cognition of two aspects.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni don gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni don gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But its nature is the nature of the object.

original: rang bzhin rjes su song ba ni rang bzhin gcig nyid yin pa des na gsal ba tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin rjes su song ba ni rang bzhin gcig nyid yin pa des na gsal ba tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If they are the same in nature, then the manifestation would not be different.

original: de ltar na yang spyi med do //
analyzed: de ltar na yang spyi med do //
translated: And in that case, there would be no universal.

original: 'on te de dag rang bzhin gcig ma yin pa de lta na'ang spyi med do //
analyzed: 'on te de dag rang bzhin gcig ma yin pa de lta na'ang spyi med do //
translated: But if they are not the same in nature, then again there would be no universal.

original: 'on te gsal ba la ba lang ba lang zhes rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba la ba lang ba lang zhes rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: But if the cognition that has the aspect of the universal cow in relation to the manifestation is the object,

original: gzhan du na 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then how could it be otherwise?

original: 'dir 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad brjod de /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa ci //
analyzed: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa ci //
translated: What is the aspect of the universal?

original: shes pa'am don cis brjod par bya //
analyzed: shes pa'am don cis brjod par bya //
translated: Is it said to be cognition or the object?

original: shes pa'o zhe na de yi don //
analyzed: shes pa'o zhe na de yi don //
translated: If it is cognition, then the object

original: 'ga' yang rjes song mthong ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang rjes song mthong ma yin //
translated: is not seen to be the same in any way.

original: gal te rjes su song ba'i rnam pa shes pa yin na don dang cir 'ong /
analyzed: gal te rjes su song ba'i rnam pa shes pa yin na don dang cir 'ong /
translated: If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?

original: don rjes su song ba nyid kyis de rjes su song ba yin no zhe na /🔽de nyid de ltar bsnyad bar bya'i //
analyzed: don rjes su song ba nyid kyis de rjes su song ba yin no zhe na / de nyid de ltar bsnyad bar bya'i //
translated: If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?

original: gzhan la bsnyad pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gzhan la bsnyad pas ci zhig bya //
translated: If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?

original: sngon po la sogs pa dag shes pa la tha snyad byas pa'i sgo nas de ltar tha snyad du nges pa ni ma yin no //🔽sngon po la sogs pa la yang de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dag shes pa la tha snyad byas pa'i sgo nas de ltar tha snyad du nges pa ni ma yin no // sngon po la sogs pa la yang de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin te /
translated: If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?

original: 'di ltar sngon po'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas na sngon po yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /🔽de ni ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas na sngon po yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na / de ni ma yin te //
translated: If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?

original: @193a * // 'jig rten na de ltar tha snyad byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @193a * // 'jig rten na de ltar tha snyad byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?🔽If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?

original: 'on kyang sngon po mthong ngo zhes sngon po dang ser po dag tha dad pa kho nar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po mthong ngo zhes sngon po dang ser po dag tha dad pa kho nar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If the aspect is consciousness, what is the difference between it and the object?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag kyang ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag kyang ste /
translated: If the

original: 'dir gang tha dad par rig pa na 'di ni 'dir rjes su song ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gang tha dad par rig pa na 'di ni 'dir rjes su song ba yin la /
translated: Here, when one cognizes something as different, it is that which is followed here.🔽

original: 'di ni gzhan du yin no zhes tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan du yin no zhes tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, when one cognizes something as different, one conventionally designates it as “this is the subsequent state of that” or “this is different from that.”

original: de ni tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But it is not a conventional designation.

original: 'o na da ji ltar yod pa'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'o na da ji ltar yod pa'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba ma yin /
translated: Well then, how can the nature of existence not be taught?

original: bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because it cannot be taught.

original: gang phyir de la rtogs pa 'di //
analyzed: gang phyir de la rtogs pa 'di //
translated: Because this cognition

original: spyir zhes bya bar rjes su 'gyur ba //🔽gang zhig rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: spyir zhes bya bar rjes su 'gyur ba // gang zhig rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: is subsequent to the general.🔽That which cannot be taught

original: bstan par nus pa yod ma yin //🔽gal te bstan par mi nus na ji ltar gzhan la bsgrub par bya ba yin /
analyzed: bstan par nus pa yod ma yin // gal te bstan par mi nus na ji ltar gzhan la bsgrub par bya ba yin /
translated: by its own nature does not exist.🔽If it cannot be taught, how can it be established for another?

original: ma grub na yang ji ltar gzhan khas len par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma grub na yang ji ltar gzhan khas len par byed par 'gyur //
translated: And if it is not established, how can another accept it?

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang ji ltar bstan pa yin //🔽de dag kyang rang gi ngo bos ni bstan par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang ji ltar bstan pa yin // de dag kyang rang gi ngo bos ni bstan par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: And how can pleasure, etc. be taught?

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: They also cannot be taught by their own nature, because they are self-cognizing direct perception.

original: ma bstan kyang skyon med de /
analyzed: ma bstan kyang skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault if it is not taught.

original: khyod la bde ba yod do zhes bstan pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: khyod la bde ba yod do zhes bstan pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of teaching, “You have pleasure”?

original: khyod mthong bas nga bde'o zhes bstan pas ni dgos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyod mthong bas nga bde'o zhes bstan pas ni dgos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The purpose is to teach, “I am happy because I see you.”

original: ma yin te 'di ni tha snyad tsam du zad de /
analyzed: ma yin te 'di ni tha snyad tsam du zad de /
translated: No, this is mere convention.

original: tshogs can ma la sogs pa dag la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs can ma la sogs pa dag la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen in the case of Tsañña and so on.

original: 'on te ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa mthong ba la rtogs na /
analyzed: 'on te ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa mthong ba la rtogs na /
translated: But if you understand from seeing the hairs standing on end and so on,

original: de lta na yang gzhan gyis bstan pas ci bya ste des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan gyis bstan pas ci bya ste des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: then what is the use of teaching by another? Therefore this is mere quibbling.

original: gang gi phyir 'di spu ldang ba la sogs pa rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba de ni bde ba la sogs pa yin no zhes rtogs pa tsam gyis chog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di spu ldang ba la sogs pa rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba de ni bde ba la sogs pa yin no zhes rtogs pa tsam gyis chog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is sufficient to understand that the many aspects such as the hairs standing on end are pleasure and so on.

original: 'dir yang gang las snam bu zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni spyi yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang gang las snam bu zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni spyi yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, too, the transformation called cloth is the universal.

original: de ltar tha dad pa'am cig shos rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyi spyi grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa'am cig shos rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyi spyi grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the establishment of a universal that is either different or not different is not tenable.

original: 'o kyang 'di ni thog ma med pa'i tha snyad kyi bag chags kyi rgyu mtshan can yin te gtso bo la sogs pa'i tha snyad bzhin no //🔽tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang nyams su myong ba med de /
analyzed: 'o kyang 'di ni thog ma med pa'i tha snyad kyi bag chags kyi rgyu mtshan can yin te gtso bo la sogs pa'i tha snyad bzhin no // tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang nyams su myong ba med de /
translated: But this is due to the causal power of beginningless latent potentialities of verbal expression, like the expressions “primordial matter” and so on.🔽Nor is there any experience of sameness or difference.

original: spyi gzhan nyid ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: spyi gzhan nyid ni yod ma yin //
translated: A universal is not different from the individual,

original: gzhan du rtogs pa med phyir ro //🔽gzhan dang gzhan min phyogs dag kyang //
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs pa med phyir ro // gzhan dang gzhan min phyogs dag kyang //
translated: because it is not perceived as different.🔽And how could the positions of sameness and difference

original: rnam gzhan med par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam gzhan med par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: be otherwise, without another?🔽In what way could it be refuted

original: 'di ltar rnam 'gas de nyid dang // gzhan gyis @193b bzlog par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam 'gas de nyid dang // gzhan gyis @193b bzlog par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: by either sameness or difference?🔽There is no perception of sameness or difference

original: de nyid gang de bzlog pa dang // gzhan du rab tu tshor ba med //
analyzed: de nyid gang de bzlog pa dang // gzhan du rab tu tshor ba med //
translated: in that which is refuted and that which is not.

original: lag gdub nyid la tha dad kyang //
analyzed: lag gdub nyid la tha dad kyang //
translated: How could a bracelet be different from gold?

original: rna rgyan ci ltar gser ma yin //
analyzed: rna rgyan ci ltar gser ma yin //
translated: How could an earring not be gold?

original: lag gdub sogs las ma gtogs par //
analyzed: lag gdub sogs las ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the bracelet and so on,

original: gser gzhan dag ni ga las yin //
analyzed: gser gzhan dag ni ga las yin //
translated: how could gold exist?

original: gal te rjes zhugs gser yin na //
analyzed: gal te rjes zhugs gser yin na //
translated: If it is gold because it is included in the class of gold,

original: rjes zhugs gzhan yod ga las yin //
analyzed: rjes zhugs gzhan yod ga las yin //
translated: how could it be included in another class?

original: rjes 'gro'i rtogs pa las she na //
analyzed: rjes 'gro'i rtogs pa las she na //
translated: If it is because of the cognition of inclusion,

original: 'dir ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dir ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid //
translated: But this has already been explained.

original: 'di ni re zhig bzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig bzhag go //
translated: So let us set this aside for the moment.

original: ci ste spyi dang tha dad pa yin na de lta na yang de'i 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste spyi dang tha dad pa yin na de lta na yang de'i 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if the universal is different from the particulars, then it is not related to them.

original: gal te de dag mtshungs pa yi //🔽dngos de de dag las gzhan nyid //
analyzed: gal te de dag mtshungs pa yi // dngos de de dag las gzhan nyid //
translated: If the universal is the same as🔽the particulars, then it is not different from them.

original: de dag gis zhes 'brel med 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes 'brel med 'gyur //
translated: If it is different from them, then it is not related to them.

original: ldog pa la ni sun dbyung med //🔽gal te de de dag las gzhan 'brel pa nyid yin na de'i tshe spyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa la ni sun dbyung med // gal te de de dag las gzhan 'brel pa nyid yin na de'i tshe spyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: There is no refutation of the reversal of the reason.

original: don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the universal is different from the particulars, then it is not a universal, because it is a different object.

original: bum pa ni snam bu'i spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa ni snam bu'i spyi ma yin no //
translated: A pot is not the universal of a cloth.

original: spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir spyir ma 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir spyir ma 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is not the nature of a universal, then it is not a universal.

original: de ni ma yin te /🔽spyi yi bdag nyid yin pas de //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / spyi yi bdag nyid yin pas de //
translated: But that is not so.🔽If it is the nature of a universal, then it is a universal.

original: spyi nyid du ni 'gyur la rag / de'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni gang zhig las ni 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: spyi nyid du ni 'gyur la rag / de'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni gang zhig las ni 'gyur ba yin /
translated: If the universal is related to the particulars, then it is related to them.

original: de dang 'brel pa rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is related to them, then it is not their nature.

original: de ni 'di 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di 'byung ba yin te /
translated: But that is not so.🔽If it is the nature of the particulars, then it is not related to them.

original: ci'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag yin //
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag yin //
translated: Why is sound impermanent?

original: mi rtag phyir na mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag phyir na mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: Because it is impermanent, it is impermanent.

original: de ltar dngos po 'ga' yang ni //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po 'ga' yang ni //
translated: Thus, no entity whatsoever

original: 'grub par mi 'gyur yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'grub par mi 'gyur yod ma yin //
translated: is established, nor does it exist.

original: 'di la 'brel pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de nyid gtan tshigs su ga la 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di la 'brel pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de nyid gtan tshigs su ga la 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Here, how could that be the reason, since the very connection is not established?

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad la thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad la thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, everything would be established for everything.

original: spyir mngon par 'dod pa la yang spyi'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni grub pa med do //
analyzed: spyir mngon par 'dod pa la yang spyi'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni grub pa med do //
translated: Moreover, in general, what is called the nature of the universal is not established in what is generally accepted.

original: 'on te 'brel pa grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa grub bo zhe na /
translated: But if the connection is established,

original: de lta na yang gsal ba mtha' dag 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gsal ba mtha' dag 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: then also the entirety of the particulars would be grasped,

original: mtha' dag dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of being connected with the entirety.

original: 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid ma rtogs par spyi gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //🔽rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid ma rtogs par spyi gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no // rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: And without realizing the very nature of the connection, the existence of another universal is not possible.🔽If it is said that it is the very similarity of aspects,

original: rnam pa mtshungs nyid ces 'brel pa nyid la de ltar tha snyad byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs nyid ces 'brel pa nyid la de ltar tha snyad byas pa yin no //
translated: the connection is indeed designated as the very similarity of aspects.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ni gsal ba la ltos nas yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ni gsal ba la ltos nas yin gyi /
translated: The similarity of the aspects is in relation to the manifestation,

original: rang gi ngo bo la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in relation to their own nature,

original: rang gi ngo bo ni thams cad du rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽gsal @194a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni thams cad du rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro // gsal @194a * //
translated: because their own nature always remains in its own nature.

original: ba la ltos nas mtshungs pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: ba la ltos nas mtshungs pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the similarity is in relation to the manifestation,

original: gsal ba ma bzung bar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ma bzung bar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not grasped without grasping the manifestation.

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i spyi la yang nyes pa 'di nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i spyi la yang nyes pa 'di nyid do zhe na /
translated: This fault also applies to the universal that is the exclusion from other.

original: ma yin te ldog pa la skyon du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te ldog pa la skyon du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no fault in the exclusion.

original: phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa dag kyang gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa la ldog pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa dag kyang gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa la ldog pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Even if they are mutually distinct, there is no contradiction in the exclusion, because they are accepted as different.

original: de don bya ba gcig byed pa'i phyir spyi'i tha snyad kyang mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de don bya ba gcig byed pa'i phyir spyi'i tha snyad kyang mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: The convention of the universal is not contradictory, because they perform the same function.

original: du ma nyid ma 'phrogs pa'i rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid gang gis zlog / mi mtshungs pa dag la ji ltar blo'i blor 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma nyid ma 'phrogs pa'i rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid gang gis zlog / mi mtshungs pa dag la ji ltar blo'i blor 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
translated: How can a cognition be the same with regard to things that are not the same?

original: de nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It cannot be, because they are not the same.

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo'i yul nyid ma rtogs pa mtshungs pa nyid gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo'i yul nyid ma rtogs pa mtshungs pa nyid gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other sameness that is not the sameness of the cognition of sameness.

original: de la mi mtshungs pa dag la ji ltar spyi'i blor 'gyur zhes brgal zhing brtags pa'i don ni 'di yin te /🔽mtshungs pa'i blo'i yul ma yin pa dag la ji ltar mtshungs pa'i blor 'gyur zhes bya ba yin na blo'i yul ma yin pa nyid ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: de la mi mtshungs pa dag la ji ltar spyi'i blor 'gyur zhes brgal zhing brtags pa'i don ni 'di yin te / mtshungs pa'i blo'i yul ma yin pa dag la ji ltar mtshungs pa'i blor 'gyur zhes bya ba yin na blo'i yul ma yin pa nyid ni ma grub bo //
translated: The point of the objection is this: How can there be a cognition of a universal with regard to things that are not the same?🔽The point is that it is not established that they are not the objects of cognition.

original: de la mtshungs pa'i blo la yul du byed par ni spyi smra ba la yang ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mtshungs pa'i blo la yul du byed par ni spyi smra ba la yang ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the proponent of universals does not accept that the universal is the object of a cognition of sameness.

original: de phyir mtshungs nyid spyi 'di la //
analyzed: de phyir mtshungs nyid spyi 'di la //
translated: Therefore, this sameness,

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: is the characteristic of nonexistence.

original: de 'bras she na du ma dang // 'jig 'gyur de yang 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: de 'bras she na du ma dang // 'jig 'gyur de yang 'dod ma yin //
translated: then it would be destroyed, and that is unacceptable.

original: 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
translated: Destruction is not just a thing,

original: rjes 'brel phyir na rtag nyid min //
analyzed: rjes 'brel phyir na rtag nyid min //
translated: and because it is related, it is not permanent.

original: rigs rnams 'bras bu min phyir na //
analyzed: rigs rnams 'bras bu min phyir na //
translated: Since the universals are not the result,

original: ma 'brel pa dang dngos med 'gyur //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa dang dngos med 'gyur //
translated: they are unrelated and would be unreal.

original: rtogs pa 'khrul pa'i rnam pa las ma rtogs pa mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid gzhan ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'khrul pa'i rnam pa las ma rtogs pa mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid gzhan ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to establish that the unreal form of the cognition is the same as the unreal form of the non-cognition.

original: 'on te mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ni ji ltar srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ni ji ltar srid pa yin te /
translated: But how is it possible that the form is the same?

original: gang na gnyis yod pa der ni gnyis kyi rnam pa yin la gang na lhag pa yod pa der ni de ltar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang na gnyis yod pa der ni gnyis kyi rnam pa yin la gang na lhag pa yod pa der ni de ltar yin no zhe na /
translated: If there are two, then the form is of two. If there is an excess, then it is like that.

original: de lta na ni 'o na gsal ba gzhan dang gzhan skyes pa ni spyi'i rnam pa 'phel bar 'gyur bas gsal ba'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyi 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gsal ba gzhan dang gzhan skyes pa ni spyi'i rnam pa 'phel bar 'gyur bas gsal ba'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyi 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: If that is so, then when other individual things are produced, the universal form increases, so the individual things would be the result of the universal, because they follow and reverse the universal.

original: de ltar gyur dang gsal ba bzhin du du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur dang gsal ba bzhin du du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, it would follow that it is manifold, like a clear crystal.

original: ngo shes pa yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ngo shes pa yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is one because it is recognized,

original: spyi la yang rnam par mtshungs pa nyid yod pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi la yang rnam par mtshungs pa nyid yod pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the same is true of a universal, so there is no end.

original: 'on te spyi la ni spyi ma rtogs pa med @194b pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi la ni spyi ma rtogs pa med @194b pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that a universal is not recognized without a universal,

original: gsal ba la yang ma yin pa'i phyir brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: gsal ba la yang ma yin pa'i phyir brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs so //
translated: then the same objection applies to a particular.

original: ngo shes pa ni spyi ma nges te spyi dag la yang ngo shes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni spyi ma nges te spyi dag la yang ngo shes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Recognition is not a universal, because recognition is seen in universals.

original: spyi zhig pas mi 'dod pa thob par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi zhig pas mi 'dod pa thob par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And if a universal is destroyed, you get what you do not want,

original: gsal ba zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a particular is destroyed.

original: dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir yang 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir yang 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: And it is destroyed because it is a thing.

original: 'jig pa ni dngos po tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no zhes 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dngos po tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no zhes 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is established that destruction is related to a thing alone.

original: spyi bskyed par bya ba ma yin na yang ma 'brel pa dang / ngo bo med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi bskyed par bya ba ma yin na yang ma 'brel pa dang / ngo bo med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not generated in each individual, then it would be unrelated and would not exist.

original: dngos po nyid ni so sor nges pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni so sor nges pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid yin la /
translated: The nature of an entity is the apprehension of a specific aspect.

original: spyi khyab pa la ni de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi khyab pa la ni de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That does not exist in a universal that is all-pervading.

original: dus kyi cha'i tshogs thams cad na gnas pa'i spyi ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus kyi cha'i tshogs thams cad na gnas pa'i spyi ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: A universal that exists in all the parts of time cannot be apprehended.

original: dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin te de med na yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin te de med na yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: It is only an object that exists, for how could it exist if it did not exist?

original: yod pa nyid dang 'brel pas yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang 'brel pas yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It exists because it is related to existence.

original: yod pa nyid kyang yod pa dang 'brel dgos pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyang yod pa dang 'brel dgos pas thug pa med do //
translated: Since existence must be related to existence, there is an infinite regress.

original: spyi ni yod pa nyid gzhan dang 'brel pas yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi ni yod pa nyid gzhan dang 'brel pas yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A universal does not exist because it is related to another existence.

original: rang gi ngo bor yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It exists in its own nature.

original: de ni dmigs pa med par dmigs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa med par dmigs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not apprehended without an object.

original: des ni spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore a universal does not exist.

original: bong bu'i rva yang rang gi ngo bo yod par ci'i phyir ma gyur //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva yang rang gi ngo bo yod par ci'i phyir ma gyur //
translated: Why does the horn of a donkey not exist in its own nature?

original: khyed la yang ci'i phyir ma gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyed la yang ci'i phyir ma gyur zhe na /
translated: Why don’t you also have that?

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause.

original: de bzhin no zhe na spyi yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin no zhe na spyi yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say, “So it is,” then a universal would not exist,

original: de la yang rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for it.

original: spyi ni rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi ni rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “A universal is a conception,”

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang rang gi blos rtogs so zhes //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang rang gi blos rtogs so zhes //
translated: then the horn of a rabbit and so on would also be conceived by the mind.

original: 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: des na de dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, those would also exist.

original: nges par brtags na ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nges par brtags na ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “They do not exist when examined,”

original: thams cad mtshungs so //
analyzed: thams cad mtshungs so //
translated: then everything is the same.

original: gzhan yang spyi 'di ni brda'i stobs kyis sgra'i blo la snang ba yin pa de ltar na yang dngos por ni mi 'gyur te /🔽'di ltar / dngos po'i stobs kyis skyes pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi 'di ni brda'i stobs kyis sgra'i blo la snang ba yin pa de ltar na yang dngos por ni mi 'gyur te / 'di ltar / dngos po'i stobs kyis skyes pa yi //
translated: Moreover, this universal appears to the mind through the power of a sign. Even so, it would not be a thing, because

original: shes pa gang de brda dag la //
analyzed: shes pa gang de brda dag la //
translated: a cognition that arises through the power of a thing🔽does not depend on a sign.

original: ltos pa ma yin spyi yin //
analyzed: ltos pa ma yin spyi yin //
translated: It is a universal.

original: blo la de ltar snang ba med /
analyzed: blo la de ltar snang ba med /
translated: It does not appear to the mind in that way.

original: brda byed pa ni nye ba tsam la dmigs nas byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brda byed pa ni nye ba tsam la dmigs nas byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A sign is not made by observing just the near side.

original: de la ltos pa'i shes pa yang sgro 'dogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i shes pa yang sgro 'dogs pa nyid do //
translated: The cognition that depends on it is also a superimposition.

original: 'di ltar / snga ma spyi mar sgro 'dogs ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / snga ma spyi mar sgro 'dogs ni //
translated: Thus, the superimposition of the prior universal

original: med par gal te brda byed na //🔽khyab pa med la tha snyad ni //
analyzed: med par gal te brda byed na // khyab pa med la tha snyad ni //
translated: If one makes a convention without it,🔽The convention will not be applicable

original: rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: To what is not pervaded by it.

original: sgra'i mthu nyid kyis tha snyad kyi dus su rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i mthu nyid kyis tha snyad kyi dus su rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is understood at the time of the convention by the power of the word itself,

original: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma'i sgro 'dogs pa med na @195a * //
analyzed: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma'i sgro 'dogs pa med na @195a * //
translated: if there were no superimposition of the prior and the subsequent,

original: rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be understood.

original: brda med par ni sgra las spyi'i blo ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: brda med par ni sgra las spyi'i blo ma mthong ngo //
translated: Without a convention, one does not see a cognition of a universal from a word.

original: sgra med par yang gsal ba gzhan mthong ba las ni 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: sgra med par yang gsal ba gzhan mthong ba las ni 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: But one does see it from seeing another individual without a word.

original: der yang de'i ngo bor tha snyad kyi dngos po la de nyid rtags yin no //
analyzed: der yang de'i ngo bor tha snyad kyi dngos po la de nyid rtags yin no //
translated: In that case, the basis of the convention is the thing itself, which is the sign of that.

original: brda smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste //🔽rtags la yang ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brda smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste // rtags la yang ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The mention of the convention is an illustration.🔽It is not dependent on the sign.

original: rtags kyang sngon mthong ba nyid sbyor bar byed kyi lhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyang sngon mthong ba nyid sbyor bar byed kyi lhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The sign is also applied to what was seen before, not to what is left over.

original: de bzhin du dbyangs la sogs pa'i rigs dang / bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs kyang brda tsam la brten pa yin gyi dngos po la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyangs la sogs pa'i rigs dang / bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs kyang brda tsam la brten pa yin gyi dngos po la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the castes such as the brahmin, and the castes such as the kṣatriya, are based on mere convention, not on reality.

original: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs la brda dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs la brda dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the castes such as the brahmin are established by direct perception that is simultaneous with the convention,

original: ma yin te dngos po'i stobs las gang skyes pa de ni brda la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te dngos po'i stobs las gang skyes pa de ni brda la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not so. What arises from the power of reality does not depend on convention.

original: brda tsam la ltos pa ni dmus long brgyud pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brda tsam la ltos pa ni dmus long brgyud pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it depended on mere convention, then the blind would see.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i mngon sum yang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i mngon sum yang yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a direct perception that is a cooperating condition,

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: we respond:

original: mngon sum gyis ni bzung zhe na //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni bzung zhe na //
translated: If it is apprehended by direct perception,

original: nye bar bstan pa don med yin //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa don med yin //
translated: the demonstration is pointless.

original: mngon sum gyis ni ma bzung na'ang //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni ma bzung na'ang //
translated: If it is not apprehended by direct perception,

original: nye bar bstan pa don med yin //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa don med yin //
translated: the demonstration is pointless.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis bzung na //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis bzung na //
translated: If it is apprehended by direct perception,

original: bstan pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pas ci bya ste /
translated: what is the use of the demonstration?

original: de nyid kyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is apprehended by that alone.

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis 'dzin par mi nus pa de lta na yang de bstan pa stong phrag gis kyang gzung bar nus par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis 'dzin par mi nus pa de lta na yang de bstan pa stong phrag gis kyang gzung bar nus par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: But if it is not capable of being apprehended by direct perception, then how could it be apprehended by thousands of demonstrations?

original: mthong ba bdag gis 'di mthong ngo zhes skyes su bye bar bstan par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba bdag gis 'di mthong ngo zhes skyes su bye bar bstan par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “I see this” is a declaration of what is seen.

original: dbang po las 'das pa bram ze nyid la sogs pa la nye bar bstan nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa bram ze nyid la sogs pa la nye bar bstan nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible to demonstrate what is beyond the senses, such as the Brahmin caste, etc.

original: de skad du yang skyes bu'i blo bskyed pa de tsam ni tshad ma can ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang skyes bu'i blo bskyed pa de tsam ni tshad ma can ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is said, “The mere arousal of a person’s mind is not a valid cognition.”

original: dngos gnyis mthong la blo 'ga' zhig /
analyzed: dngos gnyis mthong la blo 'ga' zhig /
translated: Some cognitions of the two things

original: brda med na yang tha dad med //
analyzed: brda med na yang tha dad med //
translated: are not different even without a convention.

original: rjes su 'jug pa gang yin te //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa gang yin te //
translated: That which is subsequent

original: don nye ba dang 'brel ba yin //
analyzed: don nye ba dang 'brel ba yin //
translated: is related to the object that is present.

original: ci ste yang dngos po gnyis mthong ba na /
analyzed: ci ste yang dngos po gnyis mthong ba na /
translated: But if the two things are seen,

original: brda med par rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam pa can gyi blor 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: brda med par rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam pa can gyi blor 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then even without a convention, there is a cognition that has the form of the subsequent.

original: dper na ba lang gi blo khra bo la sogs pa mthong ba tsam las 'gyur gyi der brda la ltos pa ni med pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi blo khra bo la sogs pa mthong ba tsam las 'gyur gyi der brda la ltos pa ni med pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, the cognition of an ox arises merely from seeing a multicolored ox, but it does not depend on a sign.

original: de lta na 'o na ni /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni /
translated: If that is so, then

original: de ni de ltar ma rtogs phyir //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma rtogs phyir //
translated: because it does not understand that,

original: bram ze nyid ni rigs min 'gyur //
analyzed: bram ze nyid ni rigs min 'gyur //
translated: it would not be a Brahmin.

original: ba lang nyid bzhin bram ze ni //
analyzed: ba lang nyid bzhin bram ze ni //
translated: Like an ox, a Brahmin

original: gsal bas gsal byed mthong ba yin //
analyzed: gsal bas gsal byed mthong ba yin //
translated: is seen to be a manifest thing.

original: ba lang nyid la ngag gzhan gyi //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la ngag gzhan gyi //
translated: In the case of an ox,

original: 'dir 'ga' the tshom 'gyur ram ci //
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' the tshom 'gyur ram ci //
translated: what doubt could there be?

original: bram ze 'di min zhes brjod pa'am //
analyzed: bram ze 'di min zhes brjod pa'am //
translated: One would say, “This is not a Brahmin,”

original: bram @195b zi nyid la the tshom 'gyur //
analyzed: bram @195b zi nyid la the tshom 'gyur //
translated: or one would doubt whether he is a Brahmin.

original: gzhan gyis skyed par thos pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyis skyed par thos pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is heard that he is produced by another,

original: bya las der ni nges pa med //🔽bstan pa med par gsal byed la //
analyzed: bya las der ni nges pa med // bstan pa med par gsal byed la //
translated: there is no certainty in that.🔽Without being taught,

original: sogs pa'i rigs ni gsal ma yin //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rigs ni gsal ma yin //
translated: the class of manifest things is not manifest.

original: gal te de la de med pa //
analyzed: gal te de la de med pa //
translated: If it does not exist in that,

original: ba lang sogs la ci ste 'dod //
analyzed: ba lang sogs la ci ste 'dod //
translated: why is it asserted in an ox and so on?

original: ci ltar dbyangs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: ci ltar dbyangs la sogs pa la //
translated: Just as in the case of vowels and so on,

original: sgra gcig brjod bya rigs su rtogs //
analyzed: sgra gcig brjod bya rigs su rtogs //
translated: one sound is cognized as the class of expressible things,

original: de bzhin ngang pa la sogs la //
analyzed: de bzhin ngang pa la sogs la //
translated: in the same way, in the case of a swan and so on,

original: sgra gcig brjod bya cis mi 'dod //
analyzed: sgra gcig brjod bya cis mi 'dod //
translated: Why not accept that a single sound is the referent?

original: ba lang nyid med mtha' yas pa'i //
analyzed: ba lang nyid med mtha' yas pa'i //
translated: The cow itself is not infinite,

original: gsal ba der ni ci ltar brjod //🔽der yang gsal ba'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: gsal ba der ni ci ltar brjod // der yang gsal ba'i dbye ba yis //
translated: so why is it said to be so in that case?🔽And in that case, why not say that

original: mtha' yas pa nyid ci ste med //🔽gong du spor sogs dbye ba ni //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa nyid ci ste med // gong du spor sogs dbye ba ni //
translated: it is infinite due to the divisions of the manifestation?

original: mtha' yas sgrub par byed min min ;
analyzed: mtha' yas sgrub par byed min min ;
translated: The divisions of the sound, such as the high-pitched, are not established as infinite.

original: / ngo shes pa las gcig nyid ni //
analyzed: / ngo shes pa las gcig nyid ni //
translated: The oneness is due to recognition,

original: gnyi ga la yang yod pa yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang yod pa yin //
translated: and that exists for both.

original: gong du spor ba dang nga ro rtsub pa la sogs pa de mtha' yas pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yi ge ha la sogs pa la yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gong du spor ba dang nga ro rtsub pa la sogs pa de mtha' yas pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yi ge ha la sogs pa la yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: The reason for the high-pitched, low-pitched, and so on is also present in the letters such as “ha.”

original: nga ro rtsub pa la sogs pas tha dad kyang ngo shes pa las gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni ngang pa la sogs pa la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: nga ro rtsub pa la sogs pas tha dad kyang ngo shes pa las gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni ngang pa la sogs pa la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Even though there is a difference due to the high-pitched, low-pitched, and so on, the oneness is due to recognition. This is the same for geese and so on.

original: de'i phyir ba lang nyid la sogs pa yang ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid las gzhan pa'i ba lang med pas na sgra gcig gis brjod bya nyid dam gcig tu 'dzin pa skyed pas don nye ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang nyid la sogs pa yang ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid las gzhan pa'i ba lang med pas na sgra gcig gis brjod bya nyid dam gcig tu 'dzin pa skyed pas don nye ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, since there is no cow apart from the expression of the word “cow,” etc., the word produces the apprehension of the cow as the object of expression or as one thing, and thus the word is the proximate cause of the cow.

original: 'gar yang rigs zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gar yang rigs zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the universal, called “cow,” does not exist anywhere.

original: ci ste yang spyi med na sgra gcig ni brjod par bya ba dang / 'dzin pa gcig skyed pa de nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang spyi med na sgra gcig ni brjod par bya ba dang / 'dzin pa gcig skyed pa de nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if there is no universal, then the word cannot produce the apprehension of one thing in the object of expression.

original: de ni ma yin te /🔽ji ltar rigs med shes pa yi //🔽'bras can mig sogs de 'dod bzhin //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / ji ltar rigs med shes pa yi // 'bras can mig sogs de 'dod bzhin //
translated: That is not so.🔽Just as you accept that the eye, etc.,

original: gang gis rnam par phye ba yi //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par phye ba yi //
translated: have a single effect even though they are not of the same type,

original: rigs kyang rjes su 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: rigs kyang rjes su 'gro ba yin //
translated: so too the universal is inferred🔽from the fact that it produces a single effect.

original: mig dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams la rigs med par 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nye ba mi srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams la rigs med par 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nye ba mi srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not impossible for the eye, light, and mental activity to have a single effect even though they are not of the same type.

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams la srid pa nyid do zhe na dngos po gnyis mthong ba la yang lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis blo gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams la srid pa nyid do zhe na dngos po gnyis mthong ba la yang lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis blo gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is the existence of the co-operating causes, then when two things are seen, there would be a single cognition by reason of the co-operation.

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid med do zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no such thing as a single aspect,

original: ma yin te gzhal bya mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ni dngos po gnyis las tha dad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir blo bskyed pa nyid nus pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te gzhal bya mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ni dngos po gnyis las tha dad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir blo bskyed pa nyid nus pa yin no //
translated: no, because the single aspect of the cognized object is not seen as different from the two things.

original: de ni mig la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni mig la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The same applies to the eye, etc.

original: de dag la yang rtogs pa de gcig skyed pa nyid kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la yang rtogs pa de gcig skyed pa nyid kho na'o zhe na /
translated: In their case also, there is only the production of a single understanding.

original: khra bo la sogs pa la yang 'dzin pa gcig bskyed pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir @196a * //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa la yang 'dzin pa gcig bskyed pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir @196a * //
translated: In the case of a multicolored object, there is no other than the production of a single apprehension.

original: mtshungs par thal lo //
analyzed: mtshungs par thal lo //
translated: It follows that the case is the same.

original: gal te de nyid dngos por gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid dngos por gyur pa yin te /
translated: If you say that it is a real entity,

original: de lta ma yin na de dag nyid rtogs pa de skyed kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag nyid rtogs pa de skyed kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las yin zhe na /
translated: If that were not so, then how could you make the distinction that “only they generate the realization of that, not others”?

original: 'o na rigs kyang khra bo la sogs pa las yin gyi gzhan las ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: 'o na rigs kyang khra bo la sogs pa las yin gyi gzhan las ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: Well then, how could you make the distinction that “the class of cattle is generated from a multicolored animal and so on, not from others”?

original: de la rnam par 'byed pa'i spyi gzhan dgos la de la yang rnam par phye nas 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yod dgos pas na thug par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par 'byed pa'i spyi gzhan dgos la de la yang rnam par phye nas 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yod dgos pas na thug par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since you must assert another general class that distinguishes them and that must have another reason to engage in distinguishing them, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te khra bo la sogs pa de dag nyid ba lang nyid kyi gsal byed dam de'i rten du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa de dag gi rgyu nyid de 'dra bar 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khra bo la sogs pa de dag nyid ba lang nyid kyi gsal byed dam de'i rten du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa de dag gi rgyu nyid de 'dra bar 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that those multicolored animals and so on are the manifestors of cowness or its basis, then they would be the cause of that.

original: de ltar na 'o na rigs med par rang gi rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las der 'dzin pa bskyed pa yin pas rigs med na khar chad pa ci yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na rigs med par rang gi rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las der 'dzin pa bskyed pa yin pas rigs med na khar chad pa ci yod de /
translated: If that were so, then since the apprehension of cowness is generated from its own cause, the nature of cowness, what is the point of asserting cowness if it does not exist?

original: des na rigs su 'dzin pa 'or cig / mig la sogs pa la yang spyi yod pa ni ma yin te /🔽rnam pa 'gas kyang rnam shes la //
analyzed: des na rigs su 'dzin pa 'or cig / mig la sogs pa la yang spyi yod pa ni ma yin te / rnam pa 'gas kyang rnam shes la //
translated: A universal does not exist in the eye, etc.🔽because it is not perceived in any way

original: de dngos snang ba med phyir ro //🔽gzugs can yin phyir dbang rnams la //
analyzed: de dngos snang ba med phyir ro // gzugs can yin phyir dbang rnams la //
translated: in the consciousness of that object.

original: gal te lta ba po yod na //
analyzed: gal te lta ba po yod na //
translated: If the eye, etc.🔽were the universal of visibility, etc.,

original: de lus snang 'gyur rigs rnams ni //
analyzed: de lus snang 'gyur rigs rnams ni //
translated: the body would not be visible, etc.,

original: ma yin yan 'gar mthong min phyir //
analyzed: ma yin yan 'gar mthong min phyir //
translated: because it is not seen in any way.🔽Even when the eye, etc. are clearly perceived,

original: gsal 'dzin tshe yang de sgra dang // ngo bo las gzhan snang ba med //
analyzed: gsal 'dzin tshe yang de sgra dang // ngo bo las gzhan snang ba med //
translated: there is no perception of anything other than their own nature and sound.

original: mig la sogs pa la ni spyi ci ltar yang snang ba med de 'bras bu'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la ni spyi ci ltar yang snang ba med de 'bras bu'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: A universal does not appear in any way in the eye, etc. It is understood by way of effect.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa na yang 'bras bu de gcig byed pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa na yang 'bras bu de gcig byed pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is understood by way of effect, the effect is understood to be a single activity.

original: de lta yin na de dag 'bras bu gcig gis 'brel te zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na de dag 'bras bu gcig gis 'brel te zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, they would be related by a single effect, but not by a universal.

original: 'brel pa yang thams cad du spyi gcig pa nyid yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang thams cad du spyi gcig pa nyid yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: And the relation is the same in all cases.

original: 'brel pa yang ji lta bur yang mi snang ba'i phyir de'i de ma thag tu 'bras bu dmigs pa nyid de dang 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan ni dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang ji lta bur yang mi snang ba'i phyir de'i de ma thag tu 'bras bu dmigs pa nyid de dang 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan ni dmigs pa med de /
translated: But that is not so, because the relation is not perceived in any way. The effect is perceived immediately after the cause, and that is the relation. There is no other relation.🔽And it has already been explained:

original: 'bras bu rag las med pa yang //
analyzed: 'bras bu rag las med pa yang //
translated: The effect is not dependent on the cause,

original: rtogs pa yis ni 'brel par byed //🔽ces bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtogs pa yis ni 'brel par byed // ces bshad zin to //
translated: but is related to it by the cognition.

original: 'on te thams cad la nus pa gcig nyid do zhe na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad la nus pa gcig nyid do zhe na ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that all effects have the same potency, that is not so,

original: nus pa ni nus pa can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: nus pa ni nus pa can las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because potency is not different from the potent.

original: nus pa yang snang ba med do //
analyzed: nus pa yang snang ba med do //
translated: And potency is not perceived.

original: mi snang yang nus pa dbang po la sogs pa ltar ci ste mi rtag ce na de mi rung ste //
analyzed: mi snang yang nus pa dbang po la sogs pa ltar ci ste mi rtag ce na de mi rung ste //
translated: If you say that potency is impermanent, like the sense faculties, even though it is not perceived, that is not correct.

original: de la ni dbang po las 'das par khas blangs pa'i phyir bdag cag lta bus mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de la ni dbang po las 'das par khas blangs pa'i phyir bdag cag lta bus mi dmigs te /
translated: Because it is accepted that the self is beyond the senses, we do not perceive it.

original: zi ra'i me tog lta bu'o zhes bya ba la @196b sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zi ra'i me tog lta bu'o zhes bya ba la @196b sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is like the flower of the sky, and so on.

original: spyi ni lung gcig pus rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni lung gcig pus rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: A universal is not to be understood by a single scriptural passage.

original: 'bras bu ldog pas ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu ci zhig cig yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /🔽de ci mig 'bras kyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pas ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu ci zhig cig yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi / de ci mig 'bras kyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa'am /
translated: By the cessation of the effect, one understands that there is a cause of the appearance of form, and so on.

original: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes 'dir rnam par 'byed pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes 'dir rnam par 'byed pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: But one does not analyze whether that cause is different from the nature of the eye sense faculty or not.🔽Thus,

original: /'di ltar / ldog las khyad par can 'ga' yod //
analyzed: /'di ltar / ldog las khyad par can 'ga' yod //
translated: There is a difference due to cessation.

original: mig 'bras de bzhin yang na ni //🔽bag chags khyad par lugs kyi ni //
analyzed: mig 'bras de bzhin yang na ni // bag chags khyad par lugs kyi ni //
translated: The eye sense faculty is like that.

original: dbye bas rnam pa so sor 'gyur //
analyzed: dbye bas rnam pa so sor 'gyur //
translated: The difference is due to the division of the special habitual tendencies.

original: gang zhig 'bras bu ldog pas phyi'i don mi 'grub par de'i ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa las mig la sogs pa rnams la ldog pa'i rjes su dpag pa bzod par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: gang zhig 'bras bu ldog pas phyi'i don mi 'grub par de'i ltar na 'bras bu ldog pa las mig la sogs pa rnams la ldog pa'i rjes su dpag pa bzod par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: If you do not establish external objects by the cessation of the effect, then how can you accept the inference of cessation in regard to the eye sense faculty and so on?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar gnas pa med par rjes su dpog pa'i gzhal bya yin pa des na de'i sgo nas ni glags thod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar gnas pa med par rjes su dpog pa'i gzhal bya yin pa des na de'i sgo nas ni glags thod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this is an object of inference that is established in some way without existing, it is not a suitable example.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa nyid ni lung yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa nyid ni lung yin te /
translated: The existence of form is stated in the scriptures.

original: de ltar yin na /🔽gal te de dag lta ba po //
analyzed: de ltar yin na / gal te de dag lta ba po //
translated: If that is so,🔽if the seer exists,

original: yod na mig sogs mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yod na mig sogs mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: then the eyes and so on would see.

original: dbang po las 'das khas blangs la //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das khas blangs la //
translated: You accept that it is beyond the sense faculties,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rten yod min //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rten yod min //
translated: and there is no other basis for it.

original: gzugs ldan nyid du khas blangs pas //
analyzed: gzugs ldan nyid du khas blangs pas //
translated: Since you accept that it has form,

original: 'di nyid dbang po 'das pa'i rten //
analyzed: 'di nyid dbang po 'das pa'i rten //
translated: it is the basis of the sense faculties.

original: spyi ni de lta ma yin te //
analyzed: spyi ni de lta ma yin te //
translated: But a universal is not like that,

original: 'ba' zhig pa mi mthong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa mi mthong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that it is not seen alone.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pas spyi yan 'gar mthong na ni spyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pas spyi yan 'gar mthong na ni spyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a yogi sees a universal somewhere, it would not be a universal.

original: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba de'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar rnal 'byor bas mthong na de ltar na spyi tshad mas grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba de'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar rnal 'byor bas mthong na de ltar na spyi tshad mas grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the yogi sees that the reason for the arising of a cognition with a universal aspect is this, then in that case the universal is not established by a valid cognition.

original: bdag cag gis ni spyi tha dad par ma mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni spyi tha dad par ma mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: We simply do not see a separate universal.

original: gal te spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that because the universal is manifested by the particulars, it is not apprehended alone,

original: snang ba ma bzung bar gzugs mi 'dzin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba ma bzung bar gzugs mi 'dzin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a form is not apprehended without apprehending the light,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is also not correct.

original: gzugs ni reg pa dang 'khrul pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs ni reg pa dang 'khrul pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because form is not mistaken with respect to touch,

original: snang ba med kyang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin to //
analyzed: snang ba med kyang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin to //
translated: it is apprehended by inference even without light.

original: gal te mi 'dzin pa ni snang ba las tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dzin pa ni snang ba las tha dad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: If it is not apprehended, it would not be different from the light.

original: ldog par rab tu ma grub pa ni ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'os so //
analyzed: ldog par rab tu ma grub pa ni ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'os so //
translated: It is not tenable to say that something that is not well established as being absent is associated with absence.

original: spyi ni 'ba' zhig nas yang dmigs pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi ni 'ba' zhig nas yang dmigs pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The universal would not be the object of apprehension even from alone.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin la rjes su zhugs na ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin la rjes su zhugs na ni med pa nyid de /
translated: If it is the case that the nature of clarity is the object, then it is nonexistent.

original: ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'i ming tsam zhig tu zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'i ming tsam zhig tu zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be just the mere name “cow.”

original: 'on te yul mtshungs pa'i phyir tha dad par mi dmigs na /
analyzed: 'on te yul mtshungs pa'i phyir tha dad par mi dmigs na /
translated: But if it is the case that it is not perceived as distinct because the object is the same,

original: gzugs dang ro @197a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro @197a * //
translated: then how is it that form, taste, and so on

original: la sogs pa ji ltar de rnams ni dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad par rtogs na /
analyzed: la sogs pa ji ltar de rnams ni dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad par rtogs na /
translated: are perceived as distinct because they are apprehended by different sense faculties?

original: 'dir ni shin tu 'dres pas na rnam par dbye ba med par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ni shin tu 'dres pas na rnam par dbye ba med par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But here, because they are completely mixed, they are perceived as undifferentiated.🔽What is this complete mixing?

original: shin tu 'dres pa 'di ci zhig / ci ga rang bzhin 'dres gyur tam //
analyzed: shin tu 'dres pa 'di ci zhig / ci ga rang bzhin 'dres gyur tam //
translated: Is it the mixing of the nature?

original: de yi rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin gang yin pa //
translated: If it is the nature of that,

original: 'di nyid yin pas dbyer med 'gyur //🔽rang bzhin gzhan phyir yul gcig kyang //🔽tha dad par ni cis mi 'dzin //
analyzed: 'di nyid yin pas dbyer med 'gyur // rang bzhin gzhan phyir yul gcig kyang // tha dad par ni cis mi 'dzin //
translated: then it would be undifferentiated.🔽But because of the difference in nature,

original: rang bzhin las ni gzhan 'gyur bar //
analyzed: rang bzhin las ni gzhan 'gyur bar //
translated: why is the same object not apprehended as distinct?

original: yul zhes bya ba rtogs pa med //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba rtogs pa med //
translated: There is no apprehension of an object🔽that is different from the nature.

original: dngos po las tha dad pa'i yul gzhan na yod de /
analyzed: dngos po las tha dad pa'i yul gzhan na yod de /
translated: An object that is different from an entity does not exist.

original: gal te dngos po tha dad pa yin na yul yang tha dad pa yin pas ji ltar yul tha mi dad /
analyzed: gal te dngos po tha dad pa yin na yul yang tha dad pa yin pas ji ltar yul tha mi dad /
translated: If they are different entities, then since the object is also different, how could the object be nondifferent?

original: gal te yul dbyes tha dad na //
analyzed: gal te yul dbyes tha dad na //
translated: If the object is different by way of division,

original: de yi dbye ba ga las yin //🔽yul gzhan nyid las de yin pa //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba ga las yin // yul gzhan nyid las de yin pa //
translated: then how could it be divided?

original: de ltar yin na thug pa med //
analyzed: de ltar yin na thug pa med //
translated: If it were like that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gang gi phyir bong bu'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bor snang ba med pa /🔽de phyir de ni shes tsam gyis //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bong bu'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bor snang ba med pa / de phyir de ni shes tsam gyis //
translated: Because it does not appear as its own entity, like the horn of an ass,🔽therefore it is not suitable to be an object

original: don byed par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don byed par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: that performs a function by mere cognition.

original: de mi rung phyir rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de mi rung phyir rang bzhin med //
translated: Because that is not suitable, it is essenceless.

original: de ni dngos med mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: de ni dngos med mtshan nyid yin //
translated: That is the definition of nonentity.

original: gang dang gang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang ba'i gzungs bar mngon par 'dod pa de ni rang gi rnam pa gtod par nus pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang ba'i gzungs bar mngon par 'dod pa de ni rang gi rnam pa gtod par nus pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not perceived by way of its own entity, like a vase, is not a condition of the object of observation because it is not able to cast its aspect.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the eyes and so forth.

original: bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a dominant condition,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no invariable concomitance between them.

original: ci skad bshad las bzlog gang yin //
analyzed: ci skad bshad las bzlog gang yin //
translated: What is the opposite of what has been said

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dod //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dod //
translated: is accepted as the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: gang zhig rang gi rnam par snang ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang bzlog pa dag gis nus pa nges pa de ni don dam par yod pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /🔽rang gi rang bzhin du mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi rnam par snang ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang bzlog pa dag gis nus pa nges pa de ni don dam par yod pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin te / rang gi rang bzhin du mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: That which is ascertained to be capable of appearing in a specific form and of invariable concomitance and reversal is the ultimate existent, the characteristic of the ultimate.🔽Because it is characterized as its own nature,

original: 'dir rang bzhin mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because its nature is its characteristic.

original: gal te rang gi rang bzhin la ji ltar mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rang bzhin la ji ltar mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it can be the characterized and the characteristic in regard to its own nature,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not so.

original: mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi dngos po ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi dngos po ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the relationship of characterized and characteristic is imputed.

original: bya dang byed pa'i rnam gzhag ni //
analyzed: bya dang byed pa'i rnam gzhag ni //
translated: The presentation of agent and action

original: thams cad de lta'i rnam pa can //
analyzed: thams cad de lta'i rnam pa can //
translated: is of that kind in all cases.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid du rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid du rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Its own nature is the definition, not another,

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyis don dam par mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyis don dam par mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another cannot ultimately be defined by another.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos mtshon pa ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin nyid sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos mtshon pa ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin nyid sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: The definition by another nature is the superimposition of another’s nature,

original: de rang gi ngo bo mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but that is not the definition of its own nature.

original: 'o na ji ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Well then, how is it a universal,

original: @197b gzhan gsal ba ma khyab pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: @197b gzhan gsal ba ma khyab pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because another manifestation is not pervaded by it?

original: bden te spyi zhes bya ba don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden te spyi zhes bya ba don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is true, but what is called a universal does not ultimately exist.

original: rang gi ngo bo de yang shes pa'i tha snyad du de ltar brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo de yang shes pa'i tha snyad du de ltar brjod pa nyid de /
translated: That own nature is said to be so in the convention of consciousness,

original: gsal ba du ma'i rang bzhin la sgro btags pas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de las skyes pa yang yin pas so //
analyzed: gsal ba du ma'i rang bzhin la sgro btags pas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de las skyes pa yang yin pas so //
translated: because it engages by superimposing on the nature of many manifestations and because it arises from that.

original: dngos po med pa nyid yin na mi dmigs pa rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid yin na mi dmigs pa rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is a nonentity, how could nonapprehension be a different kind of reason, either by nature or by effect?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni yul gyi dbye ba las tha dad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni yul gyi dbye ba las tha dad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Perception and inference are different on the basis of the division of their objects.

original: mi dmigs pa la sogs pa la ni yul gyi dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la sogs pa la ni yul gyi dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But non-apprehension and so on do not have a division of objects.

original: rtags kyi dbye ba las tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: rtags kyi dbye ba las tha dad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are different on the basis of the division of their evidence,

original: brgal ba gang yin pa de nyid lan yin pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar yin /
analyzed: brgal ba gang yin pa de nyid lan yin pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar yin /
translated: then how is it that the very objection is the answer?

original: 'di ltar rtags kyi dbye ba nyid mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtags kyi dbye ba nyid mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: In this way, is it not the case that the division of evidence is not tenable?

original: de ste mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de ste mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is seen,

original: 'o na rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: then there are six types.

original: 'on te gnyis ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin la gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin la gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that two are proofs of positive entities and one is a proof of a negative,

original: spyi dngos po ma yin na ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: spyi dngos po ma yin na ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then if a universal is not a positive entity, how could it be divided into positive and negative?

original: 'di la lan bshad pa /🔽dngos dang dngos med gnyi ga la //
analyzed: 'di la lan bshad pa / dngos dang dngos med gnyi ga la //
translated: The answer to this is:🔽Because it is the basis of both positive and negative entities,

original: rten phyir spyi ste rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: rten phyir spyi ste rnam pa gsum //
translated: a universal is threefold.

original: don dam par ni dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, there is no division.

original: thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all are unreal.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga la brten pa'i sgro nas 'bras bu shes pa tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni dbye ba nyid kyis tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga la brten pa'i sgro nas 'bras bu shes pa tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni dbye ba nyid kyis tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The reason is that the result of the inference is different, depending on whether the reason is based on an existent, a non-existent, or both.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las ni dngos po nye bar len pa can gyi rnam par rtogs pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las ni dngos po nye bar len pa can gyi rnam par rtogs pa skye ba'o //
translated: Thus, from a reason based on essence, a conceptual cognition arises that is characterized by the apprehension of an existent.

original: mi dmigs pa las ni dngos po med pa'i nye bar len pa can /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las ni dngos po med pa'i nye bar len pa can /
translated: From a reason based on non-apprehension, a conceptual cognition arises that is characterized by the apprehension of a non-existent.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags las ni gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags las ni gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can yin no //
translated: From a reason based on effect, a conceptual cognition arises that is characterized by the apprehension of both.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: A reason based on effect proves a difference.

original: tha dad pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med ba dag las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med ba dag las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And a difference is possible only between an existent and a non-existent.

original: bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa yang rgyu yin no //
translated: A difference in the probandum is also a cause.

original: yang na dngos po med kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa can nyid kyis na nye bar len pa can tha dad pa las nye bar len pa tha dad pa la brten nas yul tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na dngos po med kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa can nyid kyis na nye bar len pa can tha dad pa las nye bar len pa tha dad pa la brten nas yul tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Or else, even though the thing does not exist, the appropriator is different from the different appropriations, because of being a thing and a non-thing.

original: dngos po nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: A thing is of two kinds: different and non-different.

original: des na yul gyi dbye bas gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: des na yul gyi dbye bas gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Therefore, the division of the reason is threefold, by the division of the object.

original: des na gnyis ka'i nye bar len pa'i khyad par ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyis ka'i nye bar len pa'i khyad par ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Thus, the difference of the appropriator of both is the object of non-perception of non-appearance.

original: gal te dngos rten dngos 'brel phyir//
analyzed: gal te dngos rten dngos 'brel phyir//
translated: If you say: “Because the thing is related to the thing that is its basis,

original: @198a * // dngos po shes 'gyur zhe na min //
analyzed: @198a * // dngos po shes 'gyur zhe na min //
translated: the thing is cognized,” no.

original: lan btab phyir dang 'das sogs la //
analyzed: lan btab phyir dang 'das sogs la //
translated: Because of the reply, and because the past, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan du mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mthong phyir ro //
translated: are seen in another way.
