original: shes pa dngos po la brten pa //
analyzed: shes pa dngos po la brten pa //
translated: Cognition is based on the thing.

original: zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni dngos po la 'gyur ba ma yin te dngos po'i yul can nyid ni dngos po'i yul can rang bzhin 'dzin pa las yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni dngos po la 'gyur ba ma yin te dngos po'i yul can nyid ni dngos po'i yul can rang bzhin 'dzin pa las yin no //
translated: It is not the case that a thing is not changed by the mere statement “It is.” The object of a thing is the grasping of the nature of a thing.

original: spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: A conceptual thought that has a universal as its object does not grasp a nature.

original: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it would be pointless for a group of sense faculties to exist.

original: 'on te dngos po yod pa zhes bya bar brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po yod pa zhes bya bar brjod na /
translated: But if you say that the object of a thing exists,

original: de ni ma grub ste 'das pa la sogs pa dngos po med kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma grub ste 'das pa la sogs pa dngos po med kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not established, because even though a thing does not exist, such as the past, it is seen.

original: gal te shes pa de spyi la yin nam khyad par la yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: gal te shes pa de spyi la yin nam khyad par la yin yang bla ste /
translated: It does not matter whether a consciousness is one that has a universal as its object or one that has a particular as its object.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa ni yul nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa ni yul nyid ma yin te /
translated: The past, etc., are not objects.

original: rang ni ngo bo nyid gzung bzhin pa'i dngos po ni 'das pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang ni ngo bo nyid gzung bzhin pa'i dngos po ni 'das pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that a thing that is being grasped as its own nature is past.

original: 'di la 'jig rten dngos po'i yul nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la 'jig rten dngos po'i yul nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, the world does not understand that a thing is an object.

original: dngos po med pa dang shes pa rang gi ngo bor mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang shes pa rang gi ngo bor mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Because it does not conceive of the nature of non-entity and consciousness, it is merely an error.

original: lan gdab phyir dang zhes bya bas ni bzlog pa la tshad ma 'jug par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: lan gdab phyir dang zhes bya bas ni bzlog pa la tshad ma 'jug par bstan pa yin la /
translated: The phrase “in order to respond” indicates that a valid cognition engages in the reversal of that error.

original: 'das sogs pa rnams la rnam pa gzhan du mthong phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das sogs pa rnams la rnam pa gzhan du mthong phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “because the past, etc., are seen in another way” indicates that the reason that the opponent asserts is indeterminate.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa dngos po la yang mthong la dngos po med par yang mthong na de ltar ni 'o na ni de'i tshe dngos po'i chos nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa dngos po la yang mthong la dngos po med par yang mthong na de ltar ni 'o na ni de'i tshe dngos po'i chos nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If a conceptual cognition sees both an entity and a non-entity, then at that time the entity’s property would be lost.

original: de lta na gnyis ka'i chos nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gnyis ka'i chos nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In that case, it would be the reality of both.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the response is:

original: gal te dngos chos nyid nyams na //
analyzed: gal te dngos chos nyid nyams na //
translated: If the entity’s property is lost,

original: dngos por 'dzin pa sngon 'gro can //🔽de shes yin phyir nyes 'di med //
analyzed: dngos por 'dzin pa sngon 'gro can // de shes yin phyir nyes 'di med //
translated: then the apprehension of the entity is prior.🔽Because it is known, this fault does not exist.

original: de ni shes pa yin te ;
analyzed: de ni shes pa yin te ;
translated: That is known.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no such object of cognition,

original: spyi lkog tu gyur pa ni gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi lkog tu gyur pa ni gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a universal, which is hidden, is not an object of cognition.

original: 'di ltar spyi ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this way, a universal is hidden.

original: de yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin pas ji ltar gzhal bya yin /
analyzed: de yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin pas ji ltar gzhal bya yin /
translated: And since it is not cognized by its own nature, how can it be an object of cognition?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya //
translated: Only an individual characteristic is an object of cognition.

original: spyi zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An object of cognition called “universal” does not exist,

original: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable as it is imagined.

original: don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid kho na gzhal bya yin te /
analyzed: don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid kho na gzhal bya yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, only an individual characteristic is an object of cognition,

original: de nyid yod pa dang med par rtogs pa dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid yod pa dang med par rtogs pa dgos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is necessary to understand its existence or nonexistence.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what is that so?

original: yod med nyid du dpyod rnams kyis //
analyzed: yod med nyid du dpyod rnams kyis //
translated: Because those who analyze existence and nonexistence

original: don bya de la grub phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya de la grub phyir ro //
translated: are established in that object of cognition.

original: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po @198b ni yod pa dang med pa dag gis rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams don du gnyer ro //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po @198b ni yod pa dang med pa dag gis rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams don du gnyer ro //
translated: Those who are endowed with the idea that an entity performs the function of an object of cognition seek it in both existence and nonexistence.

original: tshad mas rnges su tshol ba yang de rtogs pa'i don du yin te /
analyzed: tshad mas rnges su tshol ba yang de rtogs pa'i don du yin te /
translated: Also, the subsequent search by a valid cognition is for the sake of understanding that object.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma rtogs pa mngon du byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma rtogs pa mngon du byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the understanding of the valid cognition would not be manifest.

original: de'i phyir don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i yul du byed nus pa'i tshad ma ni don dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i yul du byed nus pa'i tshad ma ni don dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a valid cognition that is able to take as its object an existent or nonexistent thing that performs a function has a purpose.

original: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yul du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yul du bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, both perception and inference take only intrinsic identity as their object,

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise they would not be valid cognitions.

original: gal te gnyis kas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yul du byed na yul gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gnyis kas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yul du byed na yul gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If both perception and inference take only intrinsic identity as their object, then it follows that there is only one valid cognition, because there is only one object.

original: 'on te yul gcig yin yang tshogs pa'i dbye bas tshad ma tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yul gcig yin yang tshogs pa'i dbye bas tshad ma tha dad pa yin no //
translated: But if there is only one object, then there is only one valid cognition, because there is only one object.

original: de lta yin na gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: If that were so, it would contradict the statement, “Because there are two objects.”

original: slob dpon gyis kyang gang gi phyir mtshan nyid gnyis ni gzhal bya yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang gang gi phyir mtshan nyid gnyis ni gzhal bya yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The master [Dignāga] also says, “Because the two characteristics are objects of comprehension.”

original: tshogs pa'i dbye bas tshad ma tha dad pa yin na ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i dbye bas tshad ma tha dad pa yin na ni /
translated: If valid knowledge is different due to the difference of the collection,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang tshogs pa las tha dad pa'i phyir de snyed kyi tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang tshogs pa las tha dad pa'i phyir de snyed kyi tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness would be valid knowledge because of being different from the collection.

original: gzhal bya'i dbye bas tha dad pa la yang sngon po la sogs pa gzhal bya du ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma mtha' yas par thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gzhal bya'i dbye bas tha dad pa la yang sngon po la sogs pa gzhal bya du ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma mtha' yas par thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If there is a difference due to the difference of the object of comprehension, then since there are many objects of comprehension such as blue, does it not follow that there are infinitely many valid knowledges?

original: ma yin te thams cad kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i yul can gyi tshad ma ni gcig nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin te thams cad kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i yul can gyi tshad ma ni gcig nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: No, because all of them are the intrinsic identity.

original: yul gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The valid knowledge that has that as its object would be just one because of being one object.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa yin yang dbang pos skyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad tshad ma ci ste ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa yin yang dbang pos skyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad tshad ma ci ste ma yin zhe na /
translated: Even if the collection is different, why is it not all valid knowledge because it is just produced by the sense faculty?

original: ma yin te dbang pos skyed pa nyid mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te dbang pos skyed pa nyid mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the production of the object by the sense faculty is not the definition of the object.

original: de ltar yang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de'i phyir gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis yin pa nyid las rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis yin pa nyid las rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: Therefore, the objects are of two kinds because there are two kinds of objects.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma mtha' yas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma mtha' yas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an infinite number of valid cognitions.

original: ji ltar gzhal bya mtha' yas pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhal bya mtha' yas pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is not an infinite number of objects?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, because

original: sngon po nyid la sogs pa mtha' yas pa yin yang gzhal bya gnyis nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: sngon po nyid la sogs pa mtha' yas pa yin yang gzhal bya gnyis nyid kho na yin te /
translated: even though blue, etc., are infinite, there are only two kinds of objects.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / de ni rang gzhan ngo bo yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ni rang gzhan ngo bo yis //
translated: Because it is cognized by itself and by another,

original: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'dod //
translated: the object is asserted to be of two kinds.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye bas mtha' yas pa yin yang rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye bas mtha' yas pa yin yang rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
translated: Even though blue, etc., are infinite, they are only of the nature of the particular because they appear as their own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bos mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are particular because they are characterized by their own nature.

original: gal te rtogs pa'i dbye ba tha @199a * //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i dbye ba tha @199a * //
translated: If the object were to be cognized by another cognition,

original: dad pa yin na rang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa par mi 'gyur ba yin nam rtogs pa de med cing rtogs pa gzhan mngon du 'gyur na /
analyzed: dad pa yin na rang gi mtshan nyid don dam pa par mi 'gyur ba yin nam rtogs pa de med cing rtogs pa gzhan mngon du 'gyur na /
translated: If it is faith, is it not ultimate in terms of its own characteristic?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the realization of that, and if another realization is manifested, it is not its own characteristic.

original: de bzhin du gcig po de nyid gcig la ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig po de nyid gcig la ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: In the same way, that very one thing would be the characteristic of one,

original: gzhan la ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur na ;
analyzed: gzhan la ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur na ;
translated: but not of another.

original: rtogs pa po so so la gzhal bya tha dad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po so so la gzhal bya tha dad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the object of comprehension is different for each individual cognizer.

original: ltos pas byas pa'i tha dad pa ni rtogs pas skyed pa yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ltos pas byas pa'i tha dad pa ni rtogs pas skyed pa yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the difference made by dependence is produced by the cognizer, it is not ultimate.

original: gcig nyid rang gi mtshan nyid dang gzhang nyid yin na ni de gnyi ga'i rang gzhal bya gzhan yin pa'i phyir de la tshad ma gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid rang gi mtshan nyid dang gzhang nyid yin na ni de gnyi ga'i rang gzhal bya gzhan yin pa'i phyir de la tshad ma gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the very one thing is the characteristic of itself and the other, then since the object of comprehension is different for each of those two, a different valid cognition would arise for each of them.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore this is not tenable.

original: don dam gzhal bya nyid yin na //
analyzed: don dam gzhal bya nyid yin na //
translated: If the ultimate were the object of comprehension,

original: gzhal bya nyid ni mtha' yas 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid ni mtha' yas 'gyur /
translated: the objects of comprehension would be limitless.

original: don dam nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam nyid yin no //
translated: It is the ultimate itself.

original: 'gyur // 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'gyur // 'di la bshad pa /
translated: The Response

original: dmigs pa yis ni mtshon pa gang //
analyzed: dmigs pa yis ni mtshon pa gang //
translated: Whatever is characterized by an object

original: de ni don dam nyid yin no//🔽dmigs pa yis ni dngos rnams kyi //
analyzed: de ni don dam nyid yin no// dmigs pa yis ni dngos rnams kyi //
translated: Is the ultimate itself.🔽The ultimate of things

original: dam pa'i don ni yod pa yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni yod pa yin //
translated: Exists due to an object.

original: dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa la ma brten par ni yod par bdag gir byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa la ma brten par ni yod par bdag gir byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Things are not accepted as existing without depending on being observed by the mind.

original: gal te dmigs pa yod pas shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa yod pas shes pa yin gyi /
translated: If you say that consciousness exists because of the existence of objects,

original: de nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /🔽ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma dmigs pa ni med pa yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa las dmigs pa ni yod pa yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma dmigs pa ni med pa yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa las dmigs pa ni yod pa yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
translated: but those objects do not exist,🔽then the horns of a rabbit and so on are not observed, and because they do not exist, the opposite, that is, the observation of something, does not exist.

original: gal te de la yang med pas ma dmigs pa nyid ni med pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de la yang med pas ma dmigs pa nyid ni med pa ma yin na /
translated: If you say that the horns of a rabbit and so on do not exist because they are not observed, but nonobservation itself does not exist,

original: ma dmigs pa las med pa nyid gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa las med pa nyid gzhan ni med do //
translated: then apart from nonobservation, there is no other nonexistence.

original: mi dmigs pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that what is understood from nonobservation does not exist,

original: mi dmigs pa 'di ci zhig dmigs pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di ci zhig dmigs pa med pa yin nam /
translated: what is this nonobservation? Is it the nonexistence of observation?

original: 'on te gzhan dmigs pa yin nam ci ste ma dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dmigs pa yin nam ci ste ma dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin /
translated: Or is it a conception that thinks, “I do not observe any other object”?

original: gal te dmigs pa med pa ma dmigs pa yin na de las ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa med pa ma dmigs pa yin na de las ci ltar rtogs /
translated: If the non-observation of an object is the non-observation of something, how can it be conceived?

original: dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: A non-entity is not a conception.

original: dmigs pa med pa de yang dmigs pa med pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya dgos pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa de yang dmigs pa med pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya dgos pas thug pa med do //
translated: Moreover, since that non-observation of an object must be conceived by another non-observation of an object, there is an infinite regress.

original: gal te shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa la dmigs pa gzhan med pas na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa la dmigs pa gzhan med pas na /
translated: If you say that since consciousness is hidden, there is no other object of consciousness that observes the object,

original: gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur ba /
translated: then by what means is there an infinite regress?

original: de ni dmigs pa med pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa med pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is to be conceived by the non-observation of an object,

original: gal te shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na ji ltar de yod par rtogs /
analyzed: gal te shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na ji ltar de yod par rtogs /
translated: if consciousness is hidden, how can it be conceived to exist?

original: ji ltar don la ma @199b dmigs pa las med par rtogs pa de bzhin du shes pa la yang 'gyur ba shin tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar don la ma @199b dmigs pa las med par rtogs pa de bzhin du shes pa la yang 'gyur ba shin tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as you conceive the nonexistence of an object due to the non-observation of an object, in the same way, it would be very unreasonable to conceive the existence of consciousness.

original: 'on te don lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on te don lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you say that it is not hidden,

original: de la don gyi go ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la don gyi go ba yod pa yin te /
translated: But the meaning is understood.

original: des na tshad ma lnga yang med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na tshad ma lnga yang med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the five means of valid knowledge do not not exist.

original: don gyi go ba yang blo nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: don gyi go ba yang blo nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is the meaning understood not also cognition?

original: des blo gzhan gyis blo rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des blo gzhan gyis blo rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is cognition that causes the understanding of cognition.

original: de'i phyir de las don yid go ba gzhan med pa'i phyir tshad ma lnga med pas don gyis go ba'i bla med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las don yid go ba gzhan med pa'i phyir tshad ma lnga med pas don gyis go ba'i bla med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is no other cognition that understands the meaning, the five means of valid knowledge do not exist.

original: 'on te de la gzhal bya rtogs pa yod pas don gyis go ba yin na ni thug pa med pa'i phyir mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de la gzhal bya rtogs pa yod pas don gyis go ba yin na ni thug pa med pa'i phyir mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the object is understood by it, then there is an infinite regress, and it is not understood.

original: gal te rtogs pa mthong ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na ;🔽gal te mthong ba tsam la brten na ni don gyis go bas ci bya /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa mthong ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na ; gal te mthong ba tsam la brten na ni don gyis go bas ci bya /
translated: But isn’t the object understood by seeing?🔽If it is seen, then what is the use of understanding the meaning?

original: ji ltar mthong ba de lta yin du zad mod don gyis go bas blo brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba de lta yin du zad mod don gyis go bas blo brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is seen, then it is just seen. What is the use of the mind investigating the meaning?

original: don gyis go ba skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis go ba skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But the meaning is understood.

original: gal te de lta na thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med par nges pa yang 'gyur ba nyid pas ji ltar de ji ltar mi 'dod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med par nges pa yang 'gyur ba nyid pas ji ltar de ji ltar mi 'dod /
translated: If that is so, then there would be an infinite regress, and it would be certain that there would be no ascertainment.

original: gang gi phyir blo dmigs par bya ba nyid dam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo dmigs par bya ba nyid dam /
translated: If the mind is the object of apprehension,

original: lkog tu gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe ni de med par rtogs pa thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe ni de med par rtogs pa thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be an infinite regress of the ascertainment of the absence of that object.

original: 'on te don mi dmigs pa nyid dmigs pa mi dmigs pa yin na de ltar yin dmigs pa dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te don mi dmigs pa nyid dmigs pa mi dmigs pa yin na de ltar yin dmigs pa dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the non-apprehension of an object is the non-apprehension of apprehension, then it would follow that there is an apprehension that is not an object of apprehension.

original: de nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the absence of that,

original: gang te mi dmigs pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gang te mi dmigs pa med pa yin na /
translated: then if the non-apprehension is the absence of that,

original: dmigs pa yang yod pa yin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yang yod pa yin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow that the apprehension is existent.

original: 'on te gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the apprehension of another is the non-apprehension,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also illogical.

original: gal te gzhan dmigs pa la ming btags pa yin du zad mod gzhan med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dmigs pa la ming btags pa yin du zad mod gzhan med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is merely designated as the apprehension of another, how could it be that another does not exist?

original: de dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it does not have an object.

original: 'di la lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di la lan btab zin to //
translated: We have already answered this.

original: gzhan dmigs pa de nyid gzhan la mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa de nyid gzhan la mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the very same object that is perceived by one consciousness is not perceived by another.

original: de las gan mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las gan mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not perceived by that other consciousness.

original: gal te gzhan la mi 'jug mod //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la mi 'jug mod //
translated: Even if it is not perceived by the other,

original: de lta na yang de med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang de med do //
translated: it still exists.

original: zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: How do you know that?

original: 'on te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa ni med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa ni med pa kho na ste /
translated: If you say that the non-perception of an object that has the characteristics of an object is itself non-existence,

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: then it follows that

original: de la yang 'jug pa nyid de de yang de bzhin du dmigs par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'jug pa nyid de de yang de bzhin du dmigs par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would be perceived by that other consciousness, because it would have the characteristics of an object.

original: dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not an object,

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid can te mi dmigs pa gang gis rtogs zhes thug pa med pa de nyid do //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid can te mi dmigs pa gang gis rtogs zhes thug pa med pa de nyid do //
translated: then by what means do you know that it has the characteristic of non-existence?
It is the same as before.

original: sor nges pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sor nges pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the specific aspects are perceived.

original: ci 'di don gyis go ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'di don gyis go ba yin nam /
translated: Do you understand the meaning?

original: de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that you do,

original: thug pa med par brjod zin to //
analyzed: thug pa med par brjod zin to //
translated: then we have already shown that this leads to an infinite regress.

original: so sor nges pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa nyid gzhan dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa nyid gzhan dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the aspect of the object that is determined is not the other object.

original: de lta na ni 'o na gzhan yod pa las ma rtogs pa dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gzhan yod pa las ma rtogs pa dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then there is no non-apprehension of the absence of an object that is other than the existence of another object.

original: des na gzhan gyi dngos po nyid gzhan la ltos nas dngos po med pa yin la rang la ltos nas dngos po yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi dngos po nyid gzhan la ltos nas dngos po med pa yin la rang la ltos nas dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, the otherness of another object is an absence in relation to another object, and it is an entity in relation to itself.

original: so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin de yang dmigs pa nyid las yin pa des na dmigs pa yod par brjod do //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin de yang dmigs pa nyid las yin pa des na dmigs pa yod par brjod do //
translated: And that nature of determination is in relation to the object itself. Therefore, the object is said to exist.

original: gal te so sor nges pa nyid yin na dmigs pa so sor nges par 'gyur gyi de nyid ni so sor nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te so sor nges pa nyid yin na dmigs pa so sor nges par 'gyur gyi de nyid ni so sor nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that the object is determined, then the object is determined. But it is not determined in itself.

original: gal te mi dmigs na da ltar so sor nges pa zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs na da ltar so sor nges pa zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not apprehended, then the cognition called “determined” would not occur.

original: dmigs pa'i rig bya nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig bya nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that it is due to the object to be cognized?

original: des na dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object itself exists.

original: 'on te ma dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin na /🔽de yang ma yin te ma dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin na /🔽bzhin no // lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na ji ltar de nyid kyi lkog tu nyid don dam par yod nyid yin na 'o na 'ga' la yang rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽de ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te ma dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin na / de yang ma yin te ma dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin na / bzhin no // lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na ji ltar de nyid kyi lkog tu nyid don dam par yod nyid yin na 'o na 'ga' la yang rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhe na / de ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: But if the non-apprehension itself is the thought “I do not apprehend,”🔽then that is not so, because the thought “I do not apprehend” follows after the non-apprehension itself.🔽Since it is hidden, how can it be hidden? If it exists ultimately, then it would not change into anything else.🔽But it does not change into anything else.🔽

original: skyes bu gzhan la ltos nas kyang de ni de lta bu kho na yin te /🔽sngon po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na ji ltar de nyid kyi tshe de rtogs pa yin zhe na /🔽de nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis de lkog tu gyur par rtogs so //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan la ltos nas kyang de ni de lta bu kho na yin te /🔽sngon po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na ji ltar de nyid kyi tshe de rtogs pa yin zhe na /🔽de nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis de lkog tu gyur par rtogs so //

non-apprehension of the object of the non-apprehension of

original: gal te 'gas kyang de ltar ma rtogs pa'am rtogs par mi 'gyur ba yin na de rjes su dpog pa don med do //
analyzed: gal te 'gas kyang de ltar ma rtogs pa'am rtogs par mi 'gyur ba yin na de rjes su dpog pa don med do //
translated: If no one has understood it in that way, or will understand it in that way, then it is pointless to infer it.

original: de'i tshe ma rtogs pa de ji ltar de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma rtogs pa de ji ltar de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If at that time it is not understood in that way, how can it be so?

original: de'i tshe de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba yang ga las ma dmigs pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba yang ga las ma dmigs pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “At that time it is not so,” then how can it be so?

original: 'o na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir med pa kho na'o //
translated: If you say, “It is not so because it is not observed,” then it is nonexistent because it is not observed.

original: yod kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur gyi med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yod kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur gyi med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it exists, it would be observed. How can it be nonexistent?

original: yod pa la tshad ma yod pa ma yin na de skad brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: yod pa la tshad ma yod pa ma yin na de skad brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If there is no valid cognition of an existent thing, then how can it be said to exist?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yod do zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say, “There is the valid cognition of inference,”

original: de yang mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: de yang mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: then that also follows from the nature of perception.

original: phyis mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyis mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is seen later.

original: sngar @200b blta bar bya ba nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: sngar @200b blta bar bya ba nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be an object of seeing previously?

original: gal te blta bar bya ba nyid med na /
analyzed: gal te blta bar bya ba nyid med na /
translated: If it is not an object of seeing,

original: yod pa nyid ji ltar yin /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ji ltar yin /
translated: how can it be existent?

original: phyis dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyis dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is perceived later.

original: phyis nyid yod par 'gyur mod sngar ji ltar /
analyzed: phyis nyid yod par 'gyur mod sngar ji ltar /
translated: It is true that it exists later, but how is it so previously?

original: gal te sngar med na phyis ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngar med na phyis ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it did not exist previously, how could it be perceived later?

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is recognized as the object of perception.

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid du rtogs pa ni dmigs pa yin la de lta ma yin na ni gzhan du yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid du rtogs pa ni dmigs pa yin la de lta ma yin na ni gzhan du yin no zhe na /
translated: The object of perception is perception, and if it were not so, it would be something else.

original: gzhan gyi tshe yang de'i rang bzhin nyid du nges pa'i phyir gzhan du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe yang de'i rang bzhin nyid du nges pa'i phyir gzhan du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But even if it were something else, it would not exist as something else, because it is ascertained as just the nature of that.

original: gzhan du rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it cannot be understood as something else.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma yin no zhes kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma yin no zhes kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Inference is also shown to be a valid means of knowledge in regard to what will occur.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzhal bya gzhan yin zhe na /🔽de nyid gzhan gyi ngo bos rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzhal bya gzhan yin zhe na / de nyid gzhan gyi ngo bos rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But how can it be a different object of knowledge?🔽Because it is understood by the nature of something else.

original: dpe dang thun mong ba'i rang bzhin gyis de ltar rtogs pa nyid gzhal bya gzhan yin no //
analyzed: dpe dang thun mong ba'i rang bzhin gyis de ltar rtogs pa nyid gzhal bya gzhan yin no //
translated: The object of knowledge is understood in that way by the nature common to the example.

original: de nyid rtogs pa'i dbye bas de'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir gzhal bya gzhan yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid rtogs pa'i dbye bas de'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir gzhal bya gzhan yin gyi /
translated: because it is superimposed on the nature of that which is to be realized.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not ultimately.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ltos pas byas pa'i phyir don dam pa yang ma yin no zhe na bden te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ltos pas byas pa'i phyir don dam pa yang ma yin no zhe na bden te /
translated: If that is so, then since it is created by dependence, it is not even ultimate.

original: spyi ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: spyi ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bstan pa nyid de /
translated: It is taught that the universal is a non-entity.

original: 'di snga na med pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snga na med pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is said to be non-existent prior to that.

original: dngos po la mi slu ba'i sgo nas tha dad pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i tha snyad pa dag gis /
analyzed: dngos po la mi slu ba'i sgo nas tha dad pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i tha snyad pa dag gis /
translated: Since it is not understood to be different from the entity by those who are conventional, who do not understand it to be different from the entity in terms of non-deceptiveness,

original: dngos po zhes tha snyad du bye pa de sna de la ltos nas gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis zhes de skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po zhes tha snyad du bye pa de sna de la ltos nas gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis zhes de skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: that which is conventionally called an entity is said to be the two kinds of objects of comprehension in dependence on that.

original: 'on te gnyis ka'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gcig 'dzin pa tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ka'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gcig 'dzin pa tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: But if it is asserted that it becomes another valid cognition that apprehends one because it has the nature of both,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: tshad ma gcig gis gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gcig gis gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one valid cognition cannot realize the nature of both.

original: rtogs na yang de tshad ma gnyis yin te ;
analyzed: rtogs na yang de tshad ma gnyis yin te ;
translated: Even if it were realized, it would be two valid cognitions,

original: rtogs pa'i dbye ba nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dbye ba nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different due to the difference in realization.

original: yang na rtogs pa'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du thal ba med do //
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du thal ba med do //
translated: Or, because it is a difference in realization, it is not the characteristic of the ultimate, so the consequence of being the nature of both does not arise.

original: sngon po nyid la sogs pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin la de ni ltos pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po nyid la sogs pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin la de ni ltos pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Blue, etc. are the nature of the ultimate, but it is not different by the division of dependence.

original: 'o na ji ltar don dam pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar don dam pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how can it be a valid cognition because the object of comprehension of the ultimate does not exist?

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this, it is said:

original: tha dad btags pa'i rang bzhin phyir //
analyzed: tha dad btags pa'i rang bzhin phyir //
translated: Because it is the nature of the designation of difference,

original: de nyid don dam ma yin gyi //
analyzed: de nyid don dam ma yin gyi //
translated: that is not the ultimate itself.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin thob bya gang //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin thob bya gang //
translated: That which is to be attained as the nature of things

original: de ni don dam las gzhan min //
analyzed: de ni don dam las gzhan min //
translated: is not different from the ultimate.

original: 'o na don dam pa yul du byed pa'i phyir tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur te /🔽rang gi @201a * //
analyzed: 'o na don dam pa yul du byed pa'i phyir tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur te / rang gi @201a * //
translated: But then, how could it be different, since the ultimate is taken as an object?

original: ngo bo dngos su byed na ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo dngos su byed na ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to make its own nature directly present, it would be direct perception.

original: de la ma reg na ji ltar de yul du yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ma reg na ji ltar de yul du yin zhe na /
translated: If it does not touch that, how can it be the object?

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: ji bzhin mngon zhen min pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji bzhin mngon zhen min pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not just as it is,

original: gnyis pa 'khrul pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'khrul pa yin par 'dod //
translated: the second is considered to be mistaken.

original: ji ltar don de de ltar de na rgyu'i dbye bas tha dad pa de ltar de mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji bzhin ma yin par mngon par zhen pas na 'khrul pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar don de de ltar de na rgyu'i dbye bas tha dad pa de ltar de mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji bzhin ma yin par mngon par zhen pas na 'khrul pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because it is not just as it is, it is mistaken, since it is conceived of as it is not, due to non-apprehension of that object in that way.

original: sngar mthong ba'i don gyis skyed pa'i bag chags sad pa'i stobs las 'byung ba yin pas na /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i don gyis skyed pa'i bag chags sad pa'i stobs las 'byung ba yin pas na /
translated: Because it arises from the power of the arousing of the latent impressions produced by previously seen objects,

original: dngos po ma reg kyang der lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma reg kyang der lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: even though it does not touch the thing, it is conceived of as that.

original: gal te dngos po la reg pa med na 'o na tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po la reg pa med na 'o na tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not touch the thing, then it will not be valid cognition.

original: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
translated: It is valid cognition because it is non-deceptive.

original: gzhan rtogs pa na gzhan thob pa'i phyir mi slu bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs pa na gzhan thob pa'i phyir mi slu bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that when one thing is realized, another is obtained, then it would be nondeceptive.

original: de nyid smras pa ni /🔽gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos ni //
analyzed: de nyid smras pa ni / gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos ni //
translated: The response to that is:🔽If it is the case that one thing is realized

original: rtogs na 'khrul pa tshad ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs na 'khrul pa tshad ma yin //
translated: through the nature of another, then error would be valid knowledge.

original: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos rtogs na ji ltar de rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos rtogs na ji ltar de rtogs pa yin /
translated: If it is the case that one thing is realized through the nature of another, how could it be realized?

original: de ni gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: It would be the realization of the nature of another.

original: de la gzhan thob pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin la 'khrul pa yang tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzhan thob pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin la 'khrul pa yang tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the obtaining of another is error itself, and error is not valid knowledge, then what is the response?

original: lan du / bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
analyzed: lan du / bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
translated: The response is:

original: 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma nyid //
translated: Even though there is error, it is valid knowledge🔽because there is no deception in the thought.

original: rnam gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa mthong //
analyzed: rnam gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa mthong //
translated: We see that there is realization through another mode.

original: phyogs 'di la ni lan btab zin //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni lan btab zin //
translated: This position has already been responded to.

original: gzhan du yang don ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par zhen par ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na bsam pa la slu ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang don ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par zhen par ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na bsam pa la slu ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Even in another case, how can one understand the ascertainment of the object as it is? Because there is no deception in the thought.

original: de ni 'di la yang yod pa'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par zhen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di la yang yod pa'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par zhen pa ma yin no //
translated: But since this is also the case here, it is not the case that there is no adherence to the literal meaning.

original: 'di ni bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di tha snyad pas rig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di tha snyad pas rig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This arises from the power of latent impressions, and the difference in the appearance is due to the difference in the latent impressions.

original: 'di ni 'chad par byed pa rnams kyis don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chad par byed pa rnams kyis don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: This is not known by the conventional, but it is known by the expounders who understand the meaning.

original: gzhan mthong ba'i phyir bsam pa de nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba'i phyir bsam pa de nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can that intention be the same, since another is seen?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it cannot be,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni dngos po so sor nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni dngos po so sor nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conceptual thoughts are not restricted to individual things.

original: 'di ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu yin no //
translated: This is the power of beginningless latent impressions.

original: des na ji ltar de kho na nyid du yongs su ma bcad par de la 'jug ces bya ba 'di brtsad par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar de kho na nyid du yongs su ma bcad par de la 'jug ces bya ba 'di brtsad par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not at all to be disputed that, without determining reality, one engages in it.

original: mthong ba la ni mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: There is no inconsistency in seeing this.

original: mngon sum la yang 'jug par byed pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum la yang 'jug par byed pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be that direct perception engages its object?

original: de la yang thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa ni med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la yang thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa ni med pa kho na ste /
translated: For, in that case, it would not at all ascertain the nature of the object to be obtained,

original: nye bar gnas pa tsam yongs su gcod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa tsam yongs su gcod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would ascertain only the mere presence of the object.

original: gnyis @201b na mngon sum nyid 'jug par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis @201b na mngon sum nyid 'jug par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that both direct perception and inference engage their objects,

original: nye bar gnas pa tsam ni mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa tsam ni mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere presence of the object is not obtained.

original: der yang de dag gcig tu lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: der yang de dag gcig tu lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: In that case, they engage their objects by way of the superimposition of a single nature,

original: des na rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa yang de lta bu nyid yin pas ci ltar mtshungs pa nyid du ma mthong /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa yang de lta bu nyid yin pas ci ltar mtshungs pa nyid du ma mthong /
translated: so why do you not see that inference is just like direct perception?

original: 'on te mngon sum ni gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum ni gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: But direct perception does not have a nature that is a single superimposition,

original: nye bar gnas pa yongs su gcod pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa yongs su gcod pa tsam nyid do //
translated: because it only ascertains the mere presence of the object.

original: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa ni de'i dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi rnam par rtog pas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa ni de'i dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi rnam par rtog pas yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is a later thought that conceives of it as one.

original: de ni mi rung ste /🔽rjes su dpag pas shin tu ni //
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste / rjes su dpag pas shin tu ni //
translated: This is not correct.

original: rang gi ngo bo gzung ba'i phyir //🔽nye bar gnas pas gzung ba la //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gzung ba'i phyir // nye bar gnas pas gzung ba la //
translated: Because of the apprehension of its own nature,🔽the subsequent cognition is very much

original: rnam rtog gzhan ni gnas par 'gyur //🔽ji ltar nye bar gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa'i mngon sum rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis gcig tu lhag par zhen par gyur na 'jug par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag ba rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa nyid
analyzed: rnam rtog gzhan ni gnas par 'gyur // ji ltar nye bar gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa'i mngon sum rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis gcig tu lhag par zhen par gyur na 'jug par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag ba rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa nyid
translated: like inference.

original: du lhag par gsal ba 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du lhag par gsal ba 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as direct perception, which apprehends only the form, etc., that is present, is engaged when there is the conception of one thing by another thought, in the same way, the subsequent cognition is engaged when there is the conception of one thing by another thought, because it apprehends the presence of the very nature of inference.

original: der yang lhag par zhen pa las 'jug par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der yang lhag par zhen pa las 'jug par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is another thought that engages it through the conception of one thing.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, if you maintain that inference is by nature the conception of one thing because of its own nature,

original: 'jug par byed pa nyid dang dngos po la reg pa med pa nyid yin pas na tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa nyid dang dngos po la reg pa med pa nyid yin pas na tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not a producer and does not contact the thing, it is not a valid cognition.

original: mngon sum ni dngos po la reg pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ni dngos po la reg pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But direct perception is a valid cognition because it contacts the thing.

original: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not tenable.🔽Because direct perception does not engage

original: dngos la reg pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: dngos la reg pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: merely through contact with the thing.

original: mngon sum 'jug par byed pa min //
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug par byed pa min //
translated: If direct perception does not exist

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gcig nyid du //🔽zhen pa mngon sum yod min na //🔽rang bzhin gang gi dngos po la reg pa'i rang bzhin des ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gcig nyid du // zhen pa mngon sum yod min na // rang bzhin gang gi dngos po la reg pa'i rang bzhin des ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: as the apprehender of a single thing,

original: 'jug par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on te rang bzhin de nyid rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa la 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro // 'on te rang bzhin de nyid rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa la 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The nature of a valid cognition that contacts a thing is not a valid cognition because it is not a producer.

original: gang gis de'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yod dam /
analyzed: gang gis de'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yod dam /
translated: But if that very nature that produces the conception of the thing is the producer of the conception, then by what means does direct perception engage?

original: de rang nyid 'jug par byed pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de rang nyid 'jug par byed pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is direct perception itself that engages,🔽then direct perception would not be a valid cognition.

original: 'o na ni 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul 'di ci yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul 'di ci yin /
translated: But what is the meaning of the expression “it causes engagement”?

original: gal te rnam rtog 'jug byed na //
analyzed: gal te rnam rtog 'jug byed na //
translated: If it causes engagement by generating a conception,

original: dngos 'dzin min par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos 'dzin min par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it not apprehend an entity?

original: de lta yin yang 'jug byed na //
analyzed: de lta yin yang 'jug byed na //
translated: If it causes engagement in that way,

original: rjes dpag la 'di cis mi 'dod //
analyzed: rjes dpag la 'di cis mi 'dod //
translated: why not accept that it is a form of inference?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yin na /🔽'o na ni 'jug par @202a * //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed pa nyid yin na / 'o na ni 'jug par @202a * //
translated: If it causes engagement of direct perception by generating a conception,

original: byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it causes engagement, that conception would be a valid form of knowledge.

original: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa la bzlog pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa la bzlog pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: If that were the case, then it would be impossible to refute the claim that inference is a valid form of knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: You may say, “Inference is not a valid form of knowledge because it does not apprehend an entity,

original: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it does not cause engagement.”

original: 'o na mngon sum gyi dus phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ci ltar yin /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum gyi dus phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ci ltar yin /
translated: Well then, what about the conception that occurs after the time of direct perception?

original: der yang mngon sum gyis dngos po gzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: der yang mngon sum gyis dngos po gzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And in that case, it is because direct perception apprehends the thing.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: rnam par brtags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba la de mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba la de mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not engage the thing that is the object of the investigation.

original: de'i rgyun la zhugs pa'i phyir zhugs pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyun la zhugs pa'i phyir zhugs pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it engages it because it engages its continuum, then it would engage it only as a continuum.

original: ji ltar dang po'i skad cig rgyun yin /
analyzed: ji ltar dang po'i skad cig rgyun yin /
translated: How could the first moment be a continuum?

original: gzhan la zhugs pas ni gzhan la zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la zhugs pas ni gzhan la zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it engages another because it engages another, then it would not engage the first.

original: de ltar yin no zhe na rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi ngo bo la zhugs pas don la yang zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin no zhe na rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi ngo bo la zhugs pas don la yang zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is like that, then inference would also engage the object because it engages its own nature.

original: de ni nye bar btags pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de ni nye bar btags pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: It is just a mere designation,🔽but not ultimately.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang lan ma yin te mngon sum gzhan la zhugs pa yang nye bar btags pa las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang lan ma yin te mngon sum gzhan la zhugs pa yang nye bar btags pa las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not a response, because another direct perception that engages another is not different from the mere designation.

original: mngon sum ni de'i rigs pa la zhugs la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni de'i rigs pa la zhugs la /
translated: Direct perception engages the type of that object,🔽but inference does not even engage that.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni de la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni de la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal te /
translated: This is contradictory.

original: mngon sum gyi dus phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa de'i rigs la zhugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dus phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa de'i rigs la zhugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not engage the type of conception that occurs after the time of perception.

original: de la mngon sum zhugs so zhes bya ba lan yin na /
analyzed: de la mngon sum zhugs so zhes bya ba lan yin na /
translated: If you say that the response is that perception engages its object,

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang yin pas 'dir mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang yin pas 'dir mtshungs te /
translated: then that is also the case with inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul de'i rigs can la mngon sum zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul de'i rigs can la mngon sum zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because perception engages the type of object that is the object of inference.

original: tshang bang gi rgyu me la ni mngon sum zhugs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: tshang bang gi rgyu me la ni mngon sum zhugs pa kho na'o //
translated: In the case of the cause of a fire, perception alone engages it.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la de med do zhe na thams cad mtshungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la de med do zhe na thams cad mtshungs so //
translated: But in the case of the object of inference, it does not exist.🔽In this way,

original: 'di ltar / ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yi //
translated: just as perception does not engage🔽the object of inference,

original: yul la mngon sum 'jug med na //🔽de bzhin mngon sum phyis 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: yul la mngon sum 'jug med na // de bzhin mngon sum phyis 'byung ba'i //
translated: why is it not the case that conception does not engage

original: rnam rtog yul la min nam ci //
analyzed: rnam rtog yul la min nam ci //
translated: the object of subsequent perception?

original: gal te rjes dpag skyed pa yi //
analyzed: gal te rjes dpag skyed pa yi //
translated: If the perception that generates inference

original: mngon sum gsal gzhan la zhugs na //
analyzed: mngon sum gsal gzhan la zhugs na //
translated: engages a different clear object,

original: rnam rtog de bskyed mngon sum ci //
analyzed: rnam rtog de bskyed mngon sum ci //
translated: why is it not the case that the perception that generates conception

original: rang bzhin gzhan la zhugs min nam //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan la zhugs min nam //
translated: engages a different object by nature?

original: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa ni //🔽gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa nyid //
analyzed: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa ni // gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa nyid //
translated: The attachment to the one is the same as the attachment to the two.

original: spyi ni gnyi gar yang 'dzin cing //
analyzed: spyi ni gnyi gar yang 'dzin cing //
translated: The universal is apprehended in both.

original: der ni me sogs thob bya yi //
analyzed: der ni me sogs thob bya yi //
translated: The fire, etc. are obtained in that way.

original: dngos po rnam par brtag bya ba //
analyzed: dngos po rnam par brtag bya ba //
translated: The entity is to be imagined.

original: dbang po yi ni spyod yul yin //
analyzed: dbang po yi ni spyod yul yin //
translated: It is the object of the sense faculties.

original: gzhan gzung ba na gzhan gzung ba //
analyzed: gzhan gzung ba na gzhan gzung ba //
translated: When the other is apprehended, the other is not apprehended.

original: min zhes dpyad zin ma yin nam //
analyzed: min zhes dpyad zin ma yin nam //
translated: Has this not already been analyzed?

original: de dang 'brel pa gzung ba na //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa gzung ba na //
translated: If the connection with that is apprehended,

original: gal te de bzung bar 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te de bzung bar 'dod na //
translated: if it is asserted that it is apprehended,

original: rjes dpag la yang @202b thams cad du //
analyzed: rjes dpag la yang @202b thams cad du //
translated: then in all cases of inference,

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa mtshungs pa yin //
translated: the apprehension of the connection is the same.

original: rnam rtog la ni rgyu mthong zhing //
analyzed: rnam rtog la ni rgyu mthong zhing //
translated: In conceptual cognition, the cause is seen,

original: rjes su dpag pa'ang 'bras bu mthong //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'ang 'bras bu mthong //
translated: and in inference, the effect is seen.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyi phyis 'byung ba'i yul la mngon sum ma zhugs kyang de'i rgyu la zhugs pas rnam par rtog pa 'jug par byed pa'i tshad mar grub pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma zhugs kyang de'i 'bras bu la zhugs pas rjes
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyi phyis 'byung ba'i yul la mngon sum ma zhugs kyang de'i rgyu la zhugs pas rnam par rtog pa 'jug par byed pa'i tshad mar grub pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma zhugs kyang de'i 'bras bu la zhugs pas rjes
translated: Just as after direct perception, although the object that arises later is not engaged by direct perception, since it is engaged by its cause, it is established as a valid cognition that engages conceptual cognition, in the same way, although the object of inference is not engaged, since its effect is engaged, the subsequent cognition is a valid cognition that engages inference.

original: su dpag pa la yang tshad mar 'grub ste /
analyzed: su dpag pa la yang tshad mar 'grub ste /
translated: It is established as a valid cognition for anyone who infers.

original: 'brel pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the relation.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa gnyis ka la mtshungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa gnyis ka la mtshungs so //
translated: Both the relation of cause and effect and the relation of nature and nature possessor are the same.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu rtogs par ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu rtogs par ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the effect is not ascertained to be known from the cause.

original: nyams na mngon sum nyid tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyams na mngon sum nyid tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is impaired, direct perception itself would not be a valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not inference.

original: 'on te mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa brjod par mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa brjod par mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because it is direct perception, it is not tenable to say that it is not ascertained,

original: mngon sum nyid ni nye bar gnas pa tsam la yin pas de las ma nges pa brjod par ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ni nye bar gnas pa tsam la yin pas de las ma nges pa brjod par ma yin gyi /
translated: direct perception is merely present, so it is not said to be not ascertained from that.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ni de mngon sum nyid 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ni de mngon sum nyid 'di ma yin no //
translated: But it is not direct perception of what will occur.

original: de'i rigs la mngon sum yin pas de la yang mngon sum yin no zhes bya bar yang rtsod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs la mngon sum yin pas de la yang mngon sum yin no zhes bya bar yang rtsod par mi bya'o //
translated: And it should not be argued that it is direct perception because it is of that type.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang de'i rigs nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang de'i rigs nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
translated: In the object of inference, that type itself is the object of direct perception.

original: der cir mngon sum zhugs la 'di la ni 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: der cir mngon sum zhugs la 'di la ni 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The difference is that in the former case, the cognition is of something else, while in the latter case, it is of the same thing.

original: der ni gsal ba gzhan la zhugs la 'dir ni de nyid la yin pas mngon sum spyi'i yul can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: der ni gsal ba gzhan la zhugs la 'dir ni de nyid la yin pas mngon sum spyi'i yul can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But in the former case, the cognition is of another manifest thing, while in the latter case, it is of the same thing. Thus, perception is not the cognition of a universal.

original: ma yin te 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gcig nyid med pa'i phyir dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid du mtshungs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma yin te 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gcig nyid med pa'i phyir dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid du mtshungs pa kho na'o //
translated: No, because the manifest thing and the thing to be manifested are not the same, and because the latter is not manifest, they are the same in being the objects of a cognition of a universal.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang mthong ba rigs gcig par yang ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang mthong ba rigs gcig par yang ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How do you know that the thing to be manifested and the thing seen are of the same kind?

original: gzhan du de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is seen to be so in other cases.

original: 'o na ni thams cad du gsal ba gzhan dang thun mong ba nyid kyi rtogs pa yin pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'o na ni thams cad du gsal ba gzhan dang thun mong ba nyid kyi rtogs pa yin pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis khyad par med do //
translated: But then, since the cognition is shared with other manifest things, there is no difference between perception and inference.

original: 'on te 'byung bar 'gyur ba gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin pas des na ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'byung bar 'gyur ba gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin pas des na ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the thing to be manifested will certainly be manifested, so it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: gang na rgyu yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gang na rgyu yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If there is a cause, then there is an effect, without a doubt.

original: gang 'bras bu yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba shin tu yang gsal lo //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba shin tu yang gsal lo //
translated: If there is an effect, then there is a cause, without a doubt.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been shown that the effect that will occur is the cause.

original: des na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jug par bya ba la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par med do //🔽'on te mngon sum ni re zhig dngos po la reg pa yin pa des na tshad ma @203a * //
analyzed: des na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jug par bya ba la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par med do // 'on te mngon sum ni re zhig dngos po la reg pa yin pa des na tshad ma @203a * //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between perception and inference with regard to the engagement of what will occur.

original: yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But perception is valid knowledge because it is in contact with an object, but inference is not.

original: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not right,

original: thob par bya ba'i yul med na /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i yul med na /
translated: because if there is no object to be attained,

original: 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa khyad par med do //
translated: then there is no difference between error and non-error.

original: don yod pa dang med pa dag gi khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: don yod pa dang med pa dag gi khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: But there is a difference between the existence and non-existence of an object.

original: ma yin te mi slu ba med par don yod pa dang gzhan de nyid rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te mi slu ba med par don yod pa dang gzhan de nyid rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because without non-deception, the existence of an object cannot be known in any other way.

original: 'on te mngon sum la mi gzhan gyis mi slu ba nyid yod pas mi slu ba nyid med kyang dngos po'i yul can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum la mi gzhan gyis mi slu ba nyid yod pas mi slu ba nyid med kyang dngos po'i yul can yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that perception is nondeceptive because it is nondeceptive with respect to other persons, then it is not nondeceptive with respect to the object, but it is nondeceptive with respect to the person.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba nyid yin pas na khyad par med do //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba nyid yin pas na khyad par med do //
translated: But that is also to be understood through inference, so there is no difference.

original: de'i phyir bsam pa la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ni nye bar mkho ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam pa la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ni nye bar mkho ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition because it is nondeceptive with respect to the thought, but it is not necessary that it apprehend an object.

original: de lta ma yin na mngon sum tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were necessary, then perception would not be a valid cognition.

original: de la 'di ltar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, we say the following:

original: rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa mthong ste /
translated: It is seen that there is understanding in a different aspect.

original: 'khrul pas kyang rtogs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pas kyang rtogs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is seen that there is understanding through error.

original: yang na gal te 'jug pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na gal te 'jug pa'i don te /
translated: Or, if you say that the object of engagement is the object of perception,

original: de las rnam pa gzhan du gzhan gyi ngo bos shes pa la yang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de las rnam pa gzhan du gzhan gyi ngo bos shes pa la yang mthong ba yin no //
translated: then it is seen that there is understanding in a different aspect, through the nature of another object.

original: ji ltar thob ce na don yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar thob ce na don yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it obtained? Because the object exists.

original: yod pa gang yin pa de ni thob par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa de ni thob par bya ba yin no //
translated: Whatever exists is to be obtained.

original: 'di ltar mun par lag pas btsal ba las kyang thob pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mun par lag pas btsal ba las kyang thob pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: We see that the hand is obtained in the darkness by groping.

original: nges pa ji ltar zhe na 'brel pa'i stobs nyid las so //
analyzed: nges pa ji ltar zhe na 'brel pa'i stobs nyid las so //
translated: How is the certainty obtained? By the power of the relation.

original: yod pa nyid kyang 'brel pa can yod pa nyid las so //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyang 'brel pa can yod pa nyid las so //
translated: The existence of the relation is due to the existence of the related things.

original: ji ltar 'brel pa can nyid rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa can nyid rtogs she na /
translated: How is the relation itself known?

original: mngon sum la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang 'brel pa ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: mngon sum la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang 'brel pa ji ltar rtogs /
translated: In the case of perception, how is the relation of the object with the past and future known?

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is seen in that way.

original: gnyi gar yang mtshungs pa'i phyir rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang mtshungs pa'i phyir rtsod pa med do //
translated: The same argument applies to the case of inference.

original: 'on te der ni mngon sum de nyid tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te der ni mngon sum de nyid tshad ma yin te /
