translated: If you say that in the case of inference, the perception itself is the valid cognition,

original: rnam par rtog pa de bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it produces the conceptual cognition,

original: rjes su dpag pa skyed pa'i phyir yang sngar gyi mngon sum de nyid tshad mar ci ste mi 'dod de 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa skyed pa'i phyir yang sngar gyi mngon sum de nyid tshad mar ci ste mi 'dod de 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: why do you not accept that the same perception is the valid cognition in the production of inference, because it is the past perception?

original: rtogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang mngon sum 'das pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang mngon sum 'das pa kho na'o //
translated: Even at the time of the production of the conceptual cognition, the perception is past.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dus mnyam pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dus mnyam pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Cause and effect are not simultaneous.

original: 'on te rnam par rtog pa'i dus na yang mngon sum rgyun chags par yod pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par rtog pa'i dus na yang mngon sum rgyun chags par yod pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is a difference because the continuum of direct perception exists even at the time of conceptual thought,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phyi ma'i mngon sum gyi skad cig ma rnams ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mngon sum gyi skad cig ma rnams ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the later moments of direct perception are not the former moments.

original: 'on te phyi ma rnams kyang tshad ma nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te phyi ma rnams kyang tshad ma nyid de /
translated: But if you say that the later moments are valid cognitions,

original: de lta ma yin na rgyun chags par 'byung ba mi nges pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyun chags par 'byung ba mi nges pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: because otherwise it is not certain that they occur in a continuum,

original: 'o na thams cad tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na thams cad tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then all would be valid cognitions,

original: thob par bya ba'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object to be obtained.

original: snga ma dag nyid kyi nges pa skyed na ni phyi @203b ma rnams tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dag nyid kyi nges pa skyed na ni phyi @203b ma rnams tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the former ones generate ascertainment, the later ones are not valid cognitions.

original: the tshom za na ni nges pa ma yin la des na yang the tshom za ba ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za na ni nges pa ma yin la des na yang the tshom za ba ma yin te /
translated: If there is doubt, there is no ascertainment, and therefore there is no doubt.

original: nges pa dang gzhan pa dag yul gcig la mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa dang gzhan pa dag yul gcig la mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ascertainment and doubt are not asserted to have the same object.

original: 'on te snga ma rnams tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma rnams tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the former are not valid cognitions,

original: de lta yin na 'jug pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'jug pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: then, since there would be no engagement,

original: 'ga' yang tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: nothing would be a valid cognition.

original: re zhig mthong ste /
analyzed: re zhig mthong ste /
translated: But you do see it.

original: ci 'di la thob pa yod dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya bas 'jug na de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: ci 'di la thob pa yod dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya bas 'jug na de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: If you say that you engage in it by asking whether it is obtained or not, then that is the same for inference.

original: mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i rtogs pa yang rnam pa gzhan du gzhan gyi rang bzhin du mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i rtogs pa yang rnam pa gzhan du gzhan gyi rang bzhin du mthong ba yin te /
translated: And even the understanding that is accepted as direct perception sees the nature of something else in a different way.

original: 'jug pa'i yul rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no understanding of the object of engagement by way of its own nature.

original: gzhan dngos po'i ngo bo 'am rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa ni gnyi ga la yang yod pas na 'byung ba'i dngos po la khyad ci yod /
analyzed: gzhan dngos po'i ngo bo 'am rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa ni gnyi ga la yang yod pas na 'byung ba'i dngos po la khyad ci yod /
translated: But both do understand the nature of something else, either as an entity or as its own nature. So what is the difference between the two?

original: 'o na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag yul tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag yul tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, then, how can direct perception and inference have different objects?

original: gsal ba la mi gsal bar sgro btags pa dang / mi gsal ba la gsal bar sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba la mi gsal bar sgro btags pa dang / mi gsal ba la gsal bar sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The superimposition of the non-manifest upon the manifest, and the superimposition of the manifest upon the non-manifest.

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan du yin te /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan du yin te /
translated: Or else, in another way:

original: gang du 'byung 'gyur rtogs pa der //
analyzed: gang du 'byung 'gyur rtogs pa der //
translated: Where there is a possibility of error,

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'dod //🔽de ltar gtso bor gyur pas ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'dod // de ltar gtso bor gyur pas ni //
translated: inference is accepted as valid knowledge.🔽But where there is no possibility of error,

original: 'jug la mngon sum tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: 'jug la mngon sum tshad ma nyid //
translated: direct perception is the valid knowledge.

original: gang la shin tu goms pa las rnam par mi rtog bzhin du 'jug pa der ni mngon sum tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la shin tu goms pa las rnam par mi rtog bzhin du 'jug pa der ni mngon sum tshad ma yin te /
translated: Where one engages in an object through familiarity with it, without conceptualization, there direct perception is the valid knowledge.

original: de lta ma yin te gang la rnam par rtog pa yod pa de nyid la mngon sum 'jug par byed pa dang tshad ma yin na rnam par rtog pa tshad ma gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gang la rnam par rtog pa yod pa de nyid la mngon sum 'jug par byed pa dang tshad ma yin na rnam par rtog pa tshad ma gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, if direct perception engaged where there is conceptualization, then conceptualization would be the valid knowledge.

original: 'on te der mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te der mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if direct perception itself is the valid knowledge there, and not conceptualization,

original: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it apprehends what has already been apprehended,

original: ji ltar bzung zin pa 'dzin pa ma yin te de ltar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar bzung zin pa 'dzin pa ma yin te de ltar dpyad zin to //
translated: how is it that what has already been apprehended is not apprehended? This has already been analyzed.

original: yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this should be stated:

original: 'di ltar / gal te rnam rtog 'jug pa la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te rnam rtog 'jug pa la //
translated: Thus, if conceptual thought does not engage

original: nyer mkho med na des ci bya //
analyzed: nyer mkho med na des ci bya //
translated: without a need, what does it do?

original: 'jug la nye bar mkho zhe na //
analyzed: 'jug la nye bar mkho zhe na //
translated: If it is needed for engagement,

original: rnam rtog ji ltar tshad ma min //
analyzed: rnam rtog ji ltar tshad ma min //
translated: how can conceptual thought be a valid cognition?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa nye bar mkho ba med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa nye bar mkho ba med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If conceptual thought is not needed,

original: ji ltar 'di mngon sum gyis lhan cig nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mngon sum gyis lhan cig nyid du 'dod /
translated: how is it that it is asserted to be simultaneous with direct perception?

original: nye bar mkho ba med pa ni rnal 'byor pa dang ni ldan du zin kyang lhan cig pa nyid du su yang don du mi gnyer ro //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba med pa ni rnal 'byor pa dang ni ldan du zin kyang lhan cig pa nyid du su yang don du mi gnyer ro //
translated: That which is not needed is not sought after by anyone, even if the yogi is engaged in it.

original: 'on te de med par mi 'jug na mngon sum tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de med par mi 'jug na mngon sum tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does not engage without it, then direct perception would not be a valid cognition.

original: de ni med na yang mi 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: de ni med na yang mi 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it does not engage without it,

original: 'o na gnyi ga tshad mar thal lo //
analyzed: 'o na gnyi ga tshad mar thal lo //
translated: then it follows that both are valid cognitions.

original: 'on te rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma ma yin te dngos po'i rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i phyir ro zhe na /🔽'o na @204a * //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma ma yin te dngos po'i rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i phyir ro zhe na / 'o na @204a * //
translated: But if conceptual thought is not a valid cognition because it does not touch the nature of things,

original: mngon sum yang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: then direct perception is also not a valid cognition.

original: thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin la //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin la //
translated: because it does not touch the nature of the object to be attained.

original: ma reg pa'i phyir ro zhes da lta kho na bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ma reg pa'i phyir ro zhes da lta kho na bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained in the present verse.

original: de'i phyir / rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //🔽gal te rnam rtog 'jug pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni // gal te rnam rtog 'jug pa la //
translated: Therefore,🔽If the conceptual thought does not

original: rgyu nyid min na de yi tshe //
analyzed: rgyu nyid min na de yi tshe //
translated: enter into the cause,

original: tshad ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽mngon sum 'og rol 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur // mngon sum 'og rol 'jug pa yi //
translated: then it is valid knowledge.🔽If the conceptual thought that enters

original: rnam rtog gal te 'jug pa la //
analyzed: rnam rtog gal te 'jug pa la //
translated: after the perception

original: nus yod ce na mchod pas na //
analyzed: nus yod ce na mchod pas na //
translated: has the ability, then perception

original: mngon sum tshad ma nyid min 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma nyid min 'gyur //
translated: would not be valid knowledge.

original: ci ste tshad kyang tshad ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: ci ste tshad kyang tshad ma nyid yin na /
translated: If a valid cognition is itself a valid cognition,

original: de lta na mig la sogs pa rnams kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid kyis tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na mig la sogs pa rnams kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid kyis tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the eye and so on would also be valid cognitions because they engage their objects.

original: shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is not because it is not a consciousness,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the immediately preceding condition.

original: de ni yul gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni yul gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is not because it has a different object,

original: yul mtshungs pa nyid na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul mtshungs pa nyid na 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be when the object is the same.

original: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say it would be,🔽then it would be the same as the eye and so on.

original: ma yin te de la 'jug par bya ba shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de la 'jug par bya ba shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no cognition of the object of engagement.

original: skad cig snga ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum la ni 'jug pa'i yul can nyid med do //
analyzed: skad cig snga ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum la ni 'jug pa'i yul can nyid med do //
translated: The direct perception that apprehends the previous moment does not have the object of engagement as its object.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa nyid de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa nyid de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is conceptual because it is immediately subsequent, and thus it is valid knowledge.

original: 'on te yang mngon sum snang ba tsam gyis 'jug pa'i yul la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yang mngon sum snang ba tsam gyis 'jug pa'i yul la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Or, if direct perception engages its object through mere appearance,

original: de lta yang rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: then conceptual cognition would also be valid knowledge.

original: bzung zin pa 'dzin pas ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bzung zin pa 'dzin pas ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be valid knowledge if it apprehends what has already been apprehended?

original: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir dper na rang bzhin gyi rtags kyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir dper na rang bzhin gyi rtags kyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it engages, like inference from essential nature.

original: snang ba tsam gyis ni mngon sum tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba tsam gyis ni mngon sum tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception is not valid knowledge through mere appearance.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyang mngon sum gyis gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyang mngon sum gyis gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Momentariness would also be apprehended by direct perception.

original: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say it definitely is,

original: skad cig ma 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur te bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur te bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Inference is not a means of valid cognition because it grasps what has already been grasped.

original: 'on te tha snyad bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a means of valid cognition because it establishes a convention,

original: rnam par rtog pa yang de ltar yin pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang de ltar yin pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then conceptual cognition would be a means of valid cognition because it is like that.

original: de'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la 'jug par byed pa yin yang gsal ba dang ma gsal ba'i dbye bas tshad ma gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la 'jug par byed pa yin yang gsal ba dang ma gsal ba'i dbye bas tshad ma gnyis kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, although it engages objects that are hidden, there are only two means of valid cognition because of the distinction between clear and unclear.

original: des na gzhan gyi ngo bos rtogs kyang mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi ngo bos rtogs kyang mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, even though it cognizes by means of another nature, it is a means of valid cognition because it is nondeceptive.

original: ji ltar mi slu ba yin yang dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ma yin pa de ltar na bstan zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mi slu ba yin yang dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ma yin pa de ltar na bstan zin pa kho na'o //
translated: Just as it is nondeceptive but does not grasp the nature of things, that has already been explained.

original: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin yang 'khrul pa nyid yin par ston pa ni /🔽nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin yang 'khrul pa nyid yin par ston pa ni / nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la //
translated: To show that even though it is a means of valid cognition because it is nondeceptive, it is still mistaken, he says:🔽The mind that thinks it is a jewel

original: nor bu'i blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
analyzed: nor bu'i blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
translated: rushes forth to the light of a gem.

original: log pa'i shes par khyad med kyang //
analyzed: log pa'i shes par khyad med kyang //
translated: But there is no difference between them in regard to the falsity of their object.

original: ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
analyzed: ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
translated: But there is a difference between them in regard to the capacity to produce an effect.

original: de ltar ji bzhin don min na //
analyzed: de ltar ji bzhin don min na //
translated: If the object is not as it appears,🔽then inference and the appearance of that🔽are established as valid cognitions

original: rjes @204b dpag dang ni de snang dag / don byed dang ni rjes 'brel pa //
analyzed: rjes @204b dpag dang ni de snang dag / don byed dang ni rjes 'brel pa //
translated: in regard to the capacity to produce an effect and the connection with that.

original: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag / sgo gseb kyi bu ga na gnas pa'i nor bu'i dbyibs kyi khyad par can nor bu'i khyad par la brten pa ma yin pa'i nor bu'i 'od dang / sgron ma'i 'od dag la padma r'a ga ru 'khrul pa dag phan tshun khyad par med mod kyi de lta na yang nor bu thob pas byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag / sgo gseb kyi bu ga na gnas pa'i nor bu'i dbyibs kyi khyad par can nor bu'i khyad par la brten pa ma yin pa'i nor bu'i 'od dang / sgron ma'i 'od dag la padma r'a ga ru 'khrul pa dag phan tshun khyad par med mod kyi de lta na yang nor bu thob pas byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: The light of a jewel, which has a special shape located in the hole of a jewel, is not based on a special jewel, and the light of a lamp are both mistaken for a ruby. Although there is no difference between them in regard to each other, still there is a difference produced by the attainment of the jewel.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba'i yang yin pa des na tshad ma dang cig shos dag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba'i yang yin pa des na tshad ma dang cig shos dag yin no //
translated: In the same way, although there is no difference between inference and an inference-like appearance in regard to the falsity of their object, still there is a difference between them in regard to the capacity to produce an effect. Therefore, they are valid cognitions and otherwise.

original: nor bu ma mthong yang sgron ma'i 'od la nor bur lhag par zhen pas 'jug pa ni mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: nor bu ma mthong yang sgron ma'i 'od la nor bur lhag par zhen pas 'jug pa ni mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Even though the jewel is not seen, the light of the lamp is engaged in, i.e., is taken to be, the jewel, because of the strong conviction in the jewel.

original: 'khrul lo cog ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul lo cog ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: But the error is not the same,

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a difference in the collection.

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'khrul pa'am gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'khrul pa'am gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And not all cognitions are erroneous or deceptive, because of the existence of valid cognitions.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa yin yang tshogs pa khyad par dang ldan pa ni mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no //🔽'brel pa'i don las skyes pa ni 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa yin yang tshogs pa khyad par dang ldan pa ni mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no // 'brel pa'i don las skyes pa ni 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan /
translated: Therefore, even though there is error, a collection with a special property is a valid cognition, because it is non-deceptive.

original: mngon par 'dod pa thob pa'i rgyu ru 'gyur ba yin te mngon sum skye ba'i rgyu mtshan rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa thob pa'i rgyu ru 'gyur ba yin te mngon sum skye ba'i rgyu mtshan rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Even though there is error, it is the cause of the arising of a valid cognition, because it is the cause of the attainment of the desired object, like the reason for the arising of perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum skye ba med na tshad ma ma yin pa la mngon sum yang rjes su dpag pa skye ba med par ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum skye ba med na tshad ma ma yin pa la mngon sum yang rjes su dpag pa skye ba med par ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that if direct perception does not arise, inference is not a valid means of knowledge.🔽As it is said:

original: 'di ltar / rjes dpag med par mngon sum ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rjes dpag med par mngon sum ni //
translated: Without inference, direct perception

original: dang po 'jug par byed pa med //
analyzed: dang po 'jug par byed pa med //
translated: Does not engage at first.🔽And:

original: de bzhin rjes dpag mngon sum ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rjes dpag mngon sum ni //
translated: Without direct perception, inference

original: med par min zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: med par min zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Does not exist.

original: la lar dang por la lar phyis //
analyzed: la lar dang por la lar phyis //
translated: In some cases, first; in some cases, later.

original: 'di nyid 'dir ni khyad par yin //🔽rjes dpag las 'og mngon sum min //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dir ni khyad par yin // rjes dpag las 'og mngon sum min //
translated: This alone is the distinction here.🔽Inference is not direct perception;

original: mngon sum las dpog sngar mthong med //
analyzed: mngon sum las dpog sngar mthong med //
translated: Direct perception is not seen before inference.

original: ci ste mngon sum med par ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum med par ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: If you say that without direct perception, inference does not engage,

original: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa med par yang yin pas khyad par yod pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa mngon sum dang mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa med par yang yin pas khyad par yod pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa mngon sum dang mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and direct perception is also without inference, then there is a distinction, and inference is not the same as direct perception.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That is also incorrect.

original: rjes dpag med par mngon sum ni //
analyzed: rjes dpag med par mngon sum ni //
translated: Without inference, direct perception

original: rang rig pa la tshad ma yin //
analyzed: rang rig pa la tshad ma yin //
translated: But it is not a valid cognition with respect to itself.

original: de ltar tha snyad yod min pas ;
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad yod min pas ;
translated: Since it does not exist in this way,

original: / tshad yin na yang ci zhig bya //
analyzed: / tshad yin na yang ci zhig bya //
translated: what is the use of its being a valid cognition?

original: mngon sum rang rig tsam nyid ni //
analyzed: mngon sum rang rig tsam nyid ni //
translated: Direct perception is merely reflexive awareness,

original: don dang tha dad mi 'grub phyir //
analyzed: don dang tha dad mi 'grub phyir //
translated: because it is not established as being different from the object.

original: ci yang 'gyur ba ma yin te //
analyzed: ci yang 'gyur ba ma yin te //
translated: It is not anything at all,

original: gnyis su med par lus par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis su med par lus par 'gyur //
translated: and it remains without duality.

original: des na rjes dpag med par ni //🔽mngon sum don dang tha dad kyi //
analyzed: des na rjes dpag med par ni // mngon sum don dang tha dad kyi //
translated: Therefore, without inference,

original: sgrub byed mi 'gyur de yi phyir //
analyzed: sgrub byed mi 'gyur de yi phyir //
translated: direct perception is not established as being different from the object.

original: rjes dpag med par de @205a * //
analyzed: rjes dpag med par de @205a * //
translated: Thus, without inference, it is not a valid cognition.

original: tshad min // mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa nyid tha dad pa dang / don la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad min // mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa nyid tha dad pa dang / don la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Direct perception is dependent on inference, and it engages with the object.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum med par yang yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum med par yang yin no //
translated: Inference does not depend on direct perception.

original: 'di ltar dus phyis 'byung ba'i mngon sum la ma ltos pa kho na du ba las me rjes su dpog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dus phyis 'byung ba'i mngon sum la ma ltos pa kho na du ba las me rjes su dpog pa yin te /
translated: Thus, without direct perception, one infers fire from smoke.

original: de nyid las don de thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid las don de thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because one obtains the object from that alone.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mngon sum med na khyad par gyis //
analyzed: mngon sum med na khyad par gyis //
translated: Without direct perception,

original: yul can nyid ni rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: yul can nyid ni rtogs ma yin //
translated: The subject itself is not cognized.

original: rjes su dpag pas yul gyi ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yul gyi ni //
translated: By inference, the object

original: khyad par med par mi rig 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par med par mi rig 'gyur //
translated: is not cognized without distinction.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa'i me ni rjes su dpag pas so sor nges pa'i yul can du rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa'i me ni rjes su dpag pas so sor nges pa'i yul can du rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Fire that is obstructed by a wall, etc., cannot be cognized by inference as having a distinct object.

original: rtsig pa'i pha rol gyi yul 'ga' zhig na /
analyzed: rtsig pa'i pha rol gyi yul 'ga' zhig na /
translated: In some place on the other side of the wall,

original: me yod do zhes spyi rjes su dpog pa na /
analyzed: me yod do zhes spyi rjes su dpog pa na /
translated: inferring the existence of fire in general,

original: mngon sum gyis so sor nges pa'i yul 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis so sor nges pa'i yul 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: the object is grasped by direct perception as distinct.

original: yul so sor nges pa med par mi skye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa med par mi skye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not that it does not arise without a distinct object.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa la yang so sor nges pa'i yul ma bzung ba nyid skyon du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa la yang so sor nges pa'i yul ma bzung ba nyid skyon du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Even in the case of the cognition of a gem in the light of a gem, the fault lies in not grasping the distinct object.

original: the tshom za ba dang phyin ci log dag ni so sor nges pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa ma yin pa khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba dang phyin ci log dag ni so sor nges pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa ma yin pa khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Doubt and error do not have the distinction of not producing a distinct thing.

original: 'on te yang phyin ci log gi shes pa ni gzhan du 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yang phyin ci log gi shes pa ni gzhan du 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But if you think that a mistaken cognition is not a means of valid knowledge because it engages its object in a distorted way,🔽doubt is not a means of valid knowledge for the same reason.

original: the tshom ni res 'ga' der yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: the tshom ni res 'ga' der yang mi rung ste /
translated: Doubt does not engage its object in a distorted way,

original: gnyi ga'i cha la brten pas na //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha la brten pas na //
translated: because it is based on both aspects.

original: the tshom 'jug par byed pa min //
analyzed: the tshom 'jug par byed pa min //
translated: But it does not engage its object in an undistorted way,

original: phyin ci log ni bzlog pa'i phyir //🔽lus can rnams ni 'jug par byed //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni bzlog pa'i phyir // lus can rnams ni 'jug par byed //
translated: because it is mistaken.

original: the tshom ni phyin ci log pas thu ba yin te /
analyzed: the tshom ni phyin ci log pas thu ba yin te /
translated: Doubt is more mistaken than a mistaken cognition,

original: gnyi ga'i cha la brten pas sems cha phyed pa med pa can ji ltar 'jug par byed pa yin /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha la brten pas sems cha phyed pa med pa can ji ltar 'jug par byed pa yin /
translated: because it is based on both aspects. How can it engage its object when the mind is not focused?

original: des na cha phyed pa med pa de mngon sum gyis sel ba yin no //
analyzed: des na cha phyed pa med pa de mngon sum gyis sel ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a means of valid knowledge because it is eliminated by direct perception.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyin ci log kyang phyis 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa las yin pa'i phyir nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan las tshad ma nyid du khyad par med do //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyin ci log kyang phyis 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa las yin pa'i phyir nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan las tshad ma nyid du khyad par med do //
translated: The mistaken cognition that takes the light of a gem to be a gem is also eliminated by a subsequent inference. Therefore, the cognition that takes the light of a gem to be a gem is not a means of valid knowledge, just like the other inference.

original: de tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the means of valid knowledge of that?

original: de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid do //
translated: It is direct perception itself.

original: ji ltar 'khrul te de 'dra nyid //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul te de 'dra nyid //
translated: How is it mistaken?

original: mi slu bas na tshad ma nyid ;
analyzed: mi slu bas na tshad ma nyid ;
translated: It is a means of valid knowledge because it is non-deceptive.

original: /'khrul dang ma 'khrul gang du dgos //
analyzed: /'khrul dang ma 'khrul gang du dgos //
translated: Where is there a need for it to be mistaken or non-mistaken?

original: tshad ma ni mi slu ba can gyi shes pa'o zhes spyir mtshan nyid yin gyi de 'khrul par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: tshad ma ni mi slu ba can gyi shes pa'o zhes spyir mtshan nyid yin gyi de 'khrul par gyur pa'am /
translated: In general, a means of valid knowledge is a consciousness that is non-deceptive.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba gang du dgos pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba gang du dgos pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Where is there a need for it to be either mistaken or non-mistaken?

original: gal te mi slu ba yang ma 'khrul pa yin na 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te mi slu ba yang ma 'khrul pa yin na 'gyur gyi /
translated: If non-deceptive means non-mistaken, then it is so,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not otherwise.

original: de yang bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not true.

original: @205b yul dang dus dang mi gzhan la //🔽mi slu ba la 'khrul med yin //
analyzed: @205b yul dang dus dang mi gzhan la // mi slu ba la 'khrul med yin //
translated: Non-deceptive in regard to place, time, and other things🔽is non-mistaken.

original: ma 'khrul ba las mi slu ba //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba las mi slu ba //
translated: Non-deceptive does not arise from non-mistaken,

original: ma yin ma 'khrul ma grub phyir //
analyzed: ma yin ma 'khrul ma grub phyir //
translated: because non-mistaken is not established.

original: mi slu ba med pa 'di ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba med pa 'di ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: This non-deceptive is mistaken.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not like that.

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ma 'khrul ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ma 'khrul ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is not impaired, it is non-mistaken.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: mi slu ba nyid la de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid la de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-deceptiveness is called that.

original: mi slu ba ma yin na ni gnod pa med pa yin yang thams cad 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi slu ba ma yin na ni gnod pa med pa yin yang thams cad 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: If it is not non-deceptive, then even if it is not impaired, it is still mistaken.

original: de nyid gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that impairment itself is non-deceptive,

original: 'o na ni gnod pa med pa nyid de mi slu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: 'o na ni gnod pa med pa nyid de mi slu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: then because non-deceptiveness is non-impairment, it is established that non-deceptiveness is non-mistaken.

original: rjes su dpag pa mi slu ba yin yang 'khrul pa nyid do zhes bya ba yang dpyod pa'i gzhung ma yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa mi slu ba yin yang 'khrul pa nyid do zhes bya ba yang dpyod pa'i gzhung ma yin la /
translated: It is not a matter for analysis to say that even though inference is non-deceptive, it is still mistaken.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the assertion of the Lokayatas,

original: 'khrul pa mtha' dag tshad ma ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mtha' dag tshad ma ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they accept that all mistakes are not valid cognitions.

original: gal te 'khrul kyang mngon sum tshad ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul kyang mngon sum tshad ma nyid yin na /
translated: If even though mistaken, it is still a valid direct perception,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par yod ce na snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par yod ce na snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro /
translated: If you ask, “Is there a difference between perception and inference?” we will explain: because of the difference in appearance.

original: 'khrul pa nyid kyang so sor snang ba tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid kyang so sor snang ba tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Even error is a difference in the appearance of individual things.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i snang ba dang rab rib can gyi shes pa bzhin no //🔽shes pa mtha' dag ma 'khrul nyid //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i snang ba dang rab rib can gyi shes pa bzhin no // shes pa mtha' dag ma 'khrul nyid //
translated: It is like the appearance of inference and the cognition of one with cataracts.🔽All cognitions are non-erroneous.

original: tshad ma 'khrul pa ma yin no //🔽'khrul pa dang ni ma 'khrul ba //
analyzed: tshad ma 'khrul pa ma yin no // 'khrul pa dang ni ma 'khrul ba //
translated: Valid cognition is non-erroneous.🔽How can one know

original: khyad par 'di ni gang gis shes //
analyzed: khyad par 'di ni gang gis shes //
translated: the difference between error and non-error?

original: 'khrul pa ni rang gi ngo bo lam reg pa 'di yin pa la de ni tshad ma thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni rang gi ngo bo lam reg pa 'di yin pa la de ni tshad ma thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Error is the non-contact with the nature of things, and that is the same for all valid cognitions.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin la reg pa ma yin pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin la reg pa ma yin pa de bzhin du //
translated: Just as inference does not contact the nature of what is to be established,

original: mngon sum yang yin pas khyad par med do //
analyzed: mngon sum yang yin pas khyad par med do //
translated: perception also does not, so there is no difference.

original: de'i phyir nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa yang mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa yang mngon sum nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of a jewel in the light of a jewel is also perception.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the inference of what will occur is valid knowledge,

original: 'di ni mngon sum gzhan la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gzhan la yang mtshungs so //
translated: then this is the same for other direct perceptions.

original: der ni tshad ma gzhan nyid du mngon par rlom pa med la nor bur shes pa la ni yod pa kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: der ni tshad ma gzhan nyid du mngon par rlom pa med la nor bur shes pa la ni yod pa kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that there is no assumption of another valid knowledge in that case, but there is in the case of the cognition of a jewel, that is not so.

original: shin tu goms pa las nor bur shes pa la yang /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las nor bur shes pa la yang /
translated: Because even in the cognition of a jewel through great familiarity,

original: tshad ma gzhan du mngon par rlom pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan du mngon par rlom pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: there is no assumption of another valid knowledge, so it is the same.

original: gal te 'od la nor bur shes pa la ni 'khrul par mngon par rlom pa yod kyi ka ba la sogs pa shes pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'od la nor bur shes pa la ni 'khrul par mngon par rlom pa yod kyi ka ba la sogs pa shes pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that in the cognition of a jewel there is the assumption of error, but not in the cognition of a pillar, etc.,

original: 'di la brjod pa /🔽don dam du ni mtshungs pas na //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa / don dam du ni mtshungs pas na //
translated: then we reply:🔽Because they are the same ultimately,

original: mngon rlom tshad ma min pa las //
analyzed: mngon rlom tshad ma min pa las //
translated: the assumption of validity is not valid.

original: khyad par bden pa ma yin te //
analyzed: khyad par bden pa ma yin te //
translated: The difference is not true.

original: de ni gnyi ga tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga tshad ma nyid //
translated: Both are valid knowledge.

original: thams cad du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la tshad @206a * //
analyzed: thams cad du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la tshad @206a * //
translated: In all cases, direct perception and inference are valid knowledge.

original: ma gzhan ni yod pa mngon par rlom pa ni med pa na de tsam gyi dngos po tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma gzhan ni yod pa mngon par rlom pa ni med pa na de tsam gyi dngos po tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But when one is conceited about the existence of something that does not exist, that thing is not a different entity from the mere nonexistence.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa'i mngon par rlom pa ni ji ltar 'byung bar rung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir de yod pa dang med ba dag la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa'i mngon par rlom pa ni ji ltar 'byung bar rung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir de yod pa dang med ba dag la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And when one is conceited about the nonexistence of something that does exist, that thing is not a different entity from the mere existence.

original: de'i phyir nor bu'i 'od la ni ;
analyzed: de'i phyir nor bu'i 'od la ni ;
translated: Therefore, the light of the gem

original: / nor bur shes pa'i shes pa de //🔽de nyid du na mngon sum mam //
analyzed: / nor bur shes pa'i shes pa de // de nyid du na mngon sum mam //
translated: is the cognition that conceives the gem.🔽It is ascertained that it is either

original: yang na rjes dpag nyid ces nges //
analyzed: yang na rjes dpag nyid ces nges //
translated: perception or inference.

original: 'on te nor bu'i rang bzhin ma bzung bar ji ltar mngon sum nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te nor bu'i rang bzhin ma bzung bar ji ltar mngon sum nyid yin /
translated: But if the nature of the gem is not apprehended, how can it be perception?

original: ka ba la sogs pa la ni gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni ma bzung ba de ltar na yang de'i dus su byung ba de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa la ni gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni ma bzung ba de ltar na yang de'i dus su byung ba de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If the nature of the pillar, etc., which will occur is not apprehended, then at that time, the apprehension of its nature does occur.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / 'byung 'gyur rang bzhin ma bzung na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'byung 'gyur rang bzhin ma bzung na //
translated: If the nature of the future is not apprehended,

original: shes dang shes bya gzhan 'dzin te //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya gzhan 'dzin te //
translated: The cognition is different from the object of cognition.

original: mtshungs nyid gnyi ga lta na yang //
analyzed: mtshungs nyid gnyi ga lta na yang //
translated: When there is a similarity between the two,

original: thob pa 'brel pa las yin no //
analyzed: thob pa 'brel pa las yin no //
translated: the attainment is due to the connection.

original: gal te thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzung ba med na de las gzhan rang gi ngo bo gzung ngam gzhan gyi ngo bo gzung yang sla ste khyad par med do //
analyzed: gal te thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzung ba med na de las gzhan rang gi ngo bo gzung ngam gzhan gyi ngo bo gzung yang sla ste khyad par med do //
translated: If the nature of the object to be attained is not apprehended, then it is easy to apprehend its other nature, whether it is its own nature or another's nature, because there is no difference.

original: nor bur snang ba'i nor bu nyid dang nor bu'i 'od las mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: nor bur snang ba'i nor bu nyid dang nor bu'i 'od las mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The similarity is between the jewel and the light of the jewel, which appears as the jewel.

original: de la la lar ni yul 'khrul pa /
analyzed: de la la lar ni yul 'khrul pa /
translated: In some cases, there is error regarding the object.

original: la lar ni rang gi ngo bo la 'khrul pa /
analyzed: la lar ni rang gi ngo bo la 'khrul pa /
translated: In some cases, there is error regarding one's own nature.

original: la lar ni gnyis ka la 'khrul pa /
analyzed: la lar ni gnyis ka la 'khrul pa /
translated: In some cases, there is error regarding both.

original: la lar ni gnyi ga ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: la lar ni gnyi ga ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: In some cases, there is error regarding neither.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni yul la 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni yul la 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the jewel regarding the light of the jewel is error regarding the object.

original: nor bu nyid la nor bur shes pa ni thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin la 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu nyid la nor bur shes pa ni thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin la 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the jewel regarding the jewel itself is error regarding the nature of the object to be attained.

original: spyi rjes su dpag pa ni gnyis ka la'o //
analyzed: spyi rjes su dpag pa ni gnyis ka la'o //
translated: The inference of the universal is regarding both.

original: rang rig pa ni gnyis ka ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni gnyis ka ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: Self-awareness is neither of these two. This is the analysis.

original: des na ji skad du gang zhig rtogs pa de ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas te dper na mngon sum gyi rtogs pa bzhin no //🔽gang zhig tshad ma yin pa de ni 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na ji skad du gang zhig rtogs pa de ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas te dper na mngon sum gyi rtogs pa bzhin no // gang zhig tshad ma yin pa de ni 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable to say that what is realized is so by virtue of its own nature, as in the case of the realization of direct perception.

original: dper na mngon sum bzhin no zhes smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mngon sum bzhin no zhes smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable to say that what is a valid cognition is non-erroneous, as in the case of direct perception.

original: mngon sum yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin la ma 'khrul pa yang mngon sum la yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin la ma 'khrul pa yang mngon sum la yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: For, although direct perception is not realized by virtue of its own nature, it is not the case that non-erroneous direct perception exists.

original: rang gi ngo bo la ni ji ltar mngon sum 'khrul pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang yin la 'khrul par 'dod pa'i shes pa gzhan yang yin pas na de ltar ma 'khrul bar bsgrubs pa yin pas 'ga' yang nye bar mkho ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la ni ji ltar mngon sum 'khrul pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang yin la 'khrul par 'dod pa'i shes pa gzhan yang yin pas na de ltar ma 'khrul bar bsgrubs pa yin pas 'ga' yang nye bar mkho ba med do //
translated: Just as direct perception is erroneous by virtue of its own nature, so too is inference, and so too is any other type of consciousness that is asserted to be erroneous. Thus, since it is established that they are erroneous, there is no need to prove that they are erroneous in any other way.

original: de lta na 'o na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad ce na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad ce na /
translated: In that case, how are direct perception and inference different in their characteristics?

original: 'di la gsal ba dang cig shos snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad @206b zin to //
analyzed: 'di la gsal ba dang cig shos snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad @206b zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is because they appear to be different, as clear or unclear.

original: de ltar snang ba tha dad pa de nyid ga las 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba tha dad pa de nyid ga las 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is it that they appear to be different?

original: gang zhig rang dbang du gzung ba //
analyzed: gang zhig rang dbang du gzung ba //
translated: That which is apprehended as independent

original: der ni gsal bar snang 'gyur la //
analyzed: der ni gsal bar snang 'gyur la //
translated: appears as clear.

original: gang zhig de lta min de ni //
analyzed: gang zhig de lta min de ni //
translated: That which is not like that

original: mi gsal bar snang dbang po 'das //
analyzed: mi gsal bar snang dbang po 'das //
translated: appears as unclear and beyond the senses.

original: lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means “concealed.”

original: gang gis de skad brjod pa de nyid ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhi na ;
analyzed: gang gis de skad brjod pa de nyid ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhi na ;
translated: How is it that it is said to be like that?

original: bshad pa / gang la don gyi nus pa las //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang la don gyi nus pa las //
translated: It is said:

original: rjes 'gro ldog pa can gyi blo //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog pa can gyi blo //
translated: The mind that follows and reverses🔽from the capacity of the object

original: de la 'dzin pa rang dbang can //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa rang dbang can //
translated: apprehends it as independent.

original: de las gzhan dngos dbang po 'das //
analyzed: de las gzhan dngos dbang po 'das //
translated: The object that is different from that is beyond the senses.

original: gang zhig dngos su snang ba'i don de nyid dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos su snang ba'i don de nyid dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The object that appears directly is the particular itself, not beyond the senses.

original: dngos su snang ba yang rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i blo de'i rnam pa can du skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su snang ba yang rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i blo de'i rnam pa can du skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the direct appearance also produces the cognition that conforms to the positive and negative concomitances, and it is the aspect of that.

original: gang la sngon mthong bas skyed pa'i bag chags sad pa las snang ba'i yul sngon mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par nges pa de ni de las gzhan dbang po las 'das pa yin no //🔽de la ni dbang po'i byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang la sngon mthong bas skyed pa'i bag chags sad pa las snang ba'i yul sngon mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par nges pa de ni de las gzhan dbang po las 'das pa yin no // de la ni dbang po'i byed pa'am /
translated: The object that appears from the arousing of the latent potentialities by previous seeing is ascertained as the nature of the object seen previously. That is not beyond the senses.🔽In that case, the function of the sense faculty

original: de las byung ba dngos su byed pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba dngos su byed pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: or the aspect that directly performs the function arising from that does not exist.

original: gal te rnam pa 'di dngos nyid du rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'di dngos nyid du rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If this aspect is not realized as a real entity,

original: de'i rnam pa las tha dad pa gzhan ni de las rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa las tha dad pa gzhan ni de las rtogs pa med do //
translated: then there is no realization of anything else that is different from that aspect.

original: des na rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos kho nar yin la /
analyzed: des na rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos kho nar yin la /
translated: Therefore, whatever is realized is realized as a real entity.

original: gang zhig dngos su ma yin pa de ni rtogs pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos su ma yin pa de ni rtogs pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: That which is not directly perceived is not at all perceived.

original: 'on te dbang po dang 'brel pa med pas lkog tu 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po dang 'brel pa med pas lkog tu 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: But if it is hidden because it is not related to the sense faculty,

original: 'o na dbang po byed pa med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na dbang po byed pa med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since the sense faculty is not operative, the perception itself, which is by nature direct, would be hidden.

original: de ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not what you maintain.

original: gang zhig lkog gyur yul can gyi //🔽rtogs pa gal te dngos mthong min //
analyzed: gang zhig lkog gyur yul can gyi // rtogs pa gal te dngos mthong min //
translated: If the perception of a hidden object🔽is not a perception of a real thing,

original: rtogs pa lkog gyur ma yin phyir //
analyzed: rtogs pa lkog gyur ma yin phyir //
translated: then the perception is not hidden,

original: ji ltar lkog gyur yul can yin //
analyzed: ji ltar lkog gyur yul can yin //
translated: so how can it be a perception of a hidden object?

original: gal te rtogs na lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te rtogs na lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If it is a perception, it is not hidden.

original: dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa nyid dngos po'i yul can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa nyid dngos po'i yul can yang ma yin no //
translated: And if it does not touch the real thing, it is not an object of a real thing.

original: 'o na spyi'i yul can yin na ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid yin /
analyzed: 'o na spyi'i yul can yin na ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid yin /
translated: But if it has a universal as its object, how can it be a perception of a hidden object?

original: de la spyi ni mngon du byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la spyi ni mngon du byas pa nyid do //
translated: In this case, the universal is manifest.

original: dngos po la yang reg pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar spyi'i shes pa'i lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin par 'gyur ;
analyzed: dngos po la yang reg pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar spyi'i shes pa'i lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin par 'gyur ;
translated: And since it does not contact the thing, how can it be the subject of a cognition of a universal that is hidden from it?

original: mtshon par byas pas mtshon pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mtshon par byas pas mtshon pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because the particular is indicated by the universal,

original: khyad par rang bzhin gang gis rtogs //
analyzed: khyad par rang bzhin gang gis rtogs //
translated: then by what nature is it understood?

original: gal te khyad par gyis yin na //
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyis yin na //
translated: If by the particular,

original: sgra nyid las de rtogs la rag mod bar ma do'i lhag pa'i spyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: sgra nyid las de rtogs la rag mod bar ma do'i lhag pa'i spyis ci zhig bya /
translated: then it is understood from the word itself; what is the use of an intermediate universal?

original: spyi'i rang bzhin du mtshon na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //🔽khyab @207a * //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin du mtshon na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no // khyab @207a * //
translated: If it is indicated as having the nature of a universal, there is an infinite regress.

original: par gyi rang bzhin gyis mtshon na dbang po'i tshogs don med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par gyi rang bzhin gyis mtshon na dbang po'i tshogs don med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is indicated as having the nature of a pervader, then the collection of sense faculties would be useless.

original: 'on te ci 'ba' zhig snang la khyad par ni lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ci 'ba' zhig snang la khyad par ni lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: Or, if it is only the universal that appears and the particular is hidden,

original: mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it does not appear.

original: 'dir yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba rang gi rnam pa nyid dngos su snang ba yin la don ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba rang gi rnam pa nyid dngos su snang ba yin la don ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: Here too, the appearance of its own aspect that arises from the power of latent propensities is direct, but the object is hidden.

original: ji ltar de ni yul nyid yin //
analyzed: ji ltar de ni yul nyid yin //
translated: How can it be the object?

original: de la 'jug pa yin phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa yin phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the engagement of the mind.

original: ma rtogs pa la ji ltar 'jug / thams cad du ma rtogs pa nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la ji ltar 'jug / thams cad du ma rtogs pa nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: How can it be the cause of engagement when it is not understood? It has been explained that it is the cause of engagement when it is not understood.

original: lha sbyin gyis rang bzhin ma rtogs par yang mchod sbyin mtshungs pa mthong ba las 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis rang bzhin ma rtogs par yang mchod sbyin mtshungs pa mthong ba las 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, Yajnadatta, without understanding the nature of the reflection, engages in it when he sees the reflection of a woman.

original: de la ni slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la ni slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But in that case, there is deception.

original: ma yin te 'brel pa las mi slu ba yin no zhes mi slu ba'i rgyu 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'brel pa las mi slu ba yin no zhes mi slu ba'i rgyu 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the connection is not deceptive. The cause of non-deception is explained.

original: gal te bag chags kyi stobs las 'khrul pa yin na /🔽'o na bag chags nyid la 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir don nges pa'am /
analyzed: gal te bag chags kyi stobs las 'khrul pa yin na / 'o na bag chags nyid la 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir don nges pa'am /
translated: If error arises from the power of latent impressions,

original: thob par ji ltar 'gyur ba yin te bag chags sad par byed pa yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par ji ltar 'gyur ba yin te bag chags sad par byed pa yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then how can there be ascertainment or attainment of the object, because the latent impressions themselves are the cause of engagement?

original: don de dang 'brel pas yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: don de dang 'brel pas yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Because it is connected with that object, there is no fault.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: ma mthong bdag nyid ngo bo de //
analyzed: ma mthong bdag nyid ngo bo de //
translated: The meaning that is not seen is the nature of the self.

original: rtogs pa'i rten ni don gzhan yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rten ni don gzhan yin //
translated: The basis of the cognition is a different object.

original: gal te de rten dang 'brel can //
analyzed: gal te de rten dang 'brel can //
translated: If it is related to the basis,

original: yin na de tshe go byed nyid //
analyzed: yin na de tshe go byed nyid //
translated: then it is the communicator.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba'i don ni 'brel pa gzhan las rtogs te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba'i don ni 'brel pa gzhan las rtogs te /
translated: The meaning that is not seen in its own nature is understood from another relation.

original: gzhan tsam las rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan tsam las rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it were understood from mere otherness, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: rang nyid rtogs na yang thams cad kyis thams cad mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang nyid rtogs na yang thams cad kyis thams cad mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were understood by itself, everyone would see everything,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference.

original: gal te rten de dang gzhan de 'brel pa yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rten de dang gzhan de 'brel pa yod pa yin na /
translated: If the basis and the other are related,

original: de'i tshe go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: then it is the communicator.

original: 'di ji ltar /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar /
translated: How is this?

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen in that way.

original: 'brel ba las dran pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'brel ba las dran pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t memory itself produced from a relation?

original: de ni 'dra ba las kyang yin pas ha cang thal ba de nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni 'dra ba las kyang yin pas ha cang thal ba de nyid do zhe na /
translated: Since that is also from a similar object, there is the same absurd consequence.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las skyes pa'i dran pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las skyes pa'i dran pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Memory that arises from effort and so on is different.

original: rtsol sogs pa las ni dran pa de //
analyzed: rtsol sogs pa las ni dran pa de //
translated: Memory that arises from effort and so on

original: yul la sogs pa rnams gnas min //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa rnams gnas min //
translated: is not a basis for the object and so on.

original: de rten dang ni 'brel pa las //
analyzed: de rten dang ni 'brel pa las //
translated: From the connection with the support of that,

original: yul dus la sogs khyad par can //
analyzed: yul dus la sogs khyad par can //
translated: the object, time, and so on are distinguished.

original: chos can dang bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa'i dngos po mthong ba las ni yul dang / dus nges pa thob par nus pa'i dngos po rtogs kyis 'bad rtsol la sogs las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can dang bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa'i dngos po mthong ba las ni yul dang / dus nges pa thob par nus pa'i dngos po rtogs kyis 'bad rtsol la sogs las ni ma yin no //
translated: From seeing the thing that is connected with the subject and the probandum, one can understand the thing that has the capacity to attain the determination of the object and time, but not from effort and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'bad rtsol ni bdag gis ci mthong zhes rtsol ba lhur len pa'i yid kyi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bad rtsol ni bdag gis ci mthong zhes rtsol ba lhur len pa'i yid kyi byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, effort is the mental activity of one who is intent on the inquiry, “What did I see?”

original: de yod pas ni de lta bur gyur pa'i yul @207b dang dus kyi dngos po nyid dran gyi byed pa bla lhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: de yod pas ni de lta bur gyur pa'i yul @207b dang dus kyi dngos po nyid dran gyi byed pa bla lhag pa ni med do //
translated: By its existence, one remembers the object and time that have become such, but there is no superior activity.

original: des na de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'dra ba gzung ba las 'di ni de dang 'dra'o zhes de tsam zhig rtogs la 'dra ba nyid ni yul dang dus kyi khyad par can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzung ba las 'di ni de dang 'dra'o zhes de tsam zhig rtogs la 'dra ba nyid ni yul dang dus kyi khyad par can ma yin te /
translated: The cognition this is similar to that is a cognition of similarity, but similarity is not qualified by a particular place or time,

original: nam yang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always similar.

original: du ma ni 'dra ba'am gzhan no zhes so sor nges par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir na de tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma ni 'dra ba'am gzhan no zhes so sor nges par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir na de tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Since the cognition of many is a cognition of similarity or difference, it is not a valid cognition.

original: de dang 'dra ba des byas pa gang yin pa de ni byas pa yin pa'i phyir de la mngon sum tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba des byas pa gang yin pa de ni byas pa yin pa'i phyir de la mngon sum tshad ma nyid do //
translated: That which is similar to that and is produced by it is produced, and therefore direct perception is a valid cognition with regard to that.

original: de lta ma yin na mngon sum las mi 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa nyid las kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum las mi 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa nyid las kyang mi brjod do //
translated: Otherwise, because it does not operate through direct perception, it is not a valid cognition. This has already been explained, so it will not be stated again.

original: 'brel pa las kyang de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshad ma yin no //🔽'di ltar / 'bras sogs rtags ni de yi ni //
analyzed: 'brel pa las kyang de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshad ma yin no // 'di ltar / 'bras sogs rtags ni de yi ni //
translated: Also, the cognition of that kind through relation is a valid cognition with the nature of inference.

original: tshad ma nyid kyis go byed 'dod //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyis go byed 'dod //
translated: Thus: The reason such as effect is understood by the valid cognition of that.

original: de yi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa //
analyzed: de yi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa //
translated: The definition of that is different from that.

original: rtags kyi mtshan nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: rtags kyi mtshan nyid yod ma yin //
translated: The definition of a logical reason does not exist.

original: shing gi don bya ba byed pa'i sha pa'am me la sogs pa las skye ba'i du ba la sogs pa de ni 'di yin no zhes der yang rgyu nyid dam 'bras bu nyid du mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: shing gi don bya ba byed pa'i sha pa'am me la sogs pa las skye ba'i du ba la sogs pa de ni 'di yin no zhes der yang rgyu nyid dam 'bras bu nyid du mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: In the case of smoke, for example, which is produced from the fire that performs the function of wood, etc., it is understood that it is the same as the cause or the effect, and that it is this.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dang bral ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid de ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dang bral ba nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid de ni 'di yin te /
translated: The nature of impermanence, which is devoid of prior and subsequent, is this existence.

original: gzhan gyis mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa mtha' dag ni 'di lta bur gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa mtha' dag ni 'di lta bur gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of impermanence is not different from that. All understanding through inference is just like this.

original: khyad par 'ga' zhig gis nye bar mtshon pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin ni rgyu nye bar gnas pa can yin la /
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' zhig gis nye bar mtshon pa'i du ba'i rang bzhin ni rgyu nye bar gnas pa can yin la /
translated: The nature of smoke, which is illustrated by some particularity, has a cause that is present.

original: thal ba la sogs pa'i ni rgyu nye bar gnas pa can ma yin pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang ji ltar rigs par go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thal ba la sogs pa'i ni rgyu nye bar gnas pa can ma yin pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang ji ltar rigs par go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Since the nature of ash, etc., does not have a cause that is present, both are understood in the appropriate way.

original: 'di ltar / dngos gang lhan cig ji ltar mthong //🔽de ni gzhan tshe de lta bur //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos gang lhan cig ji ltar mthong // de ni gzhan tshe de lta bur //
translated: The thing that is seen together with it🔽Is remembered in that way at another time.

original: dran pa sad rgyu de ltar na //
analyzed: dran pa sad rgyu de ltar na //
translated: Thus, in accordance with the situation,

original: ci rigs par ni 'jug byed nyid //
analyzed: ci rigs par ni 'jug byed nyid //
translated: It is the cause of the engagement.

original: gzhan du gang tshe sngon gyi ni //
analyzed: gzhan du gang tshe sngon gyi ni //
translated: But when, at another time,

original: mthong las g-yos te dran gyur pa //
analyzed: mthong las g-yos te dran gyur pa //
translated: Memory is aroused from the previous seeing,

original: de la 'jug pa yin na yang //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa yin na yang //
translated: Even though it is the engagement,

original: mi slu ba dang 'brel ma yin //🔽mngon sum slu ba med pa can //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang 'brel ma yin // mngon sum slu ba med pa can //
translated: It is not related to nondeception.🔽The memory that has as its basis

original: dran pa de la brten pas yin //
analyzed: dran pa de la brten pas yin //
translated: The nondeceptive perception

original: gal te bdag gis dran no zhes //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis dran no zhes //
translated: If one says, “I remember,”

original: ji bzhin dran na de tshad min //
analyzed: ji bzhin dran na de tshad min //
translated: It is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te mthong ba 'khrul pas na //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba 'khrul pas na //
translated: If, because the seeing is mistaken,

original: de bzhin yin yang tshad min na //
analyzed: de bzhin yin yang tshad min na //
translated: It is not valid even though it is so,

original: mthong ba 'khrul pa de yang ni //
analyzed: mthong ba 'khrul pa de yang ni //
translated: Then that mistaken seeing

original: rnam pa gzhan du dran las yin //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du dran las yin //
translated: Is from memory in another way.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba dmigs med la //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba dmigs med la //
translated: Thus, the seeing that is without an object

original: de ni dmigs dang bcas nyid du //
analyzed: de ni dmigs dang bcas nyid du //
translated: Is one that has an object

original: rnam pa gzhan du dran yin la //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du dran yin la //
translated: In another way, it is memory,

original: de lta na de tshad min gyur //
analyzed: de lta na de tshad min gyur //
translated: And in that case it is not valid.

original: dran pas gzhan @208a * //
analyzed: dran pas gzhan @208a * //
translated: Memory is not a valid cognition.

original: du rtogs pas mthong ba tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir mthong ba rang gis nyes pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dran pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: du rtogs pas mthong ba tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir mthong ba rang gis nyes pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dran pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault is not in the seeing, but in the memory.

original: dran pa de yang 'dra ba las rnam pa gzhan du skye ba ni dran pa gsal ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de phyir de nyid du dmigs pa'i //
analyzed: dran pa de yang 'dra ba las rnam pa gzhan du skye ba ni dran pa gsal ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de phyir de nyid du dmigs pa'i //
translated: And that memory is not clear, because it arises in a different form from the similar one.

original: 'bras bu rang bzhin dag las ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang bzhin dag las ni //
translated: Therefore, the result of the perception of reality

original: don bcas dran pa skye 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: don bcas dran pa skye 'gyur gyi //
translated: arises from the essence of the object and the memory,🔽but not otherwise,

original: gzhan du dran pa 'khrul par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du dran pa 'khrul par 'gyur //
translated: because the memory would be confused.

original: des na thams cad du slu ba ni dran pa 'khrul pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na thams cad du slu ba ni dran pa 'khrul pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the confusion in all cases is produced by the confusion of memory.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa las mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin lkog tu gyur pa'i yul dran pa nyid tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa las mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin lkog tu gyur pa'i yul dran pa nyid tshad ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the memory of the object that is hidden from the view by the connection is itself the valid cognition.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is inference alone, not anything else.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /🔽de'i tshe go byed rjes 'gro ba //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa / de'i tshe go byed rjes 'gro ba //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽Then, the understanding of the essence by the universal,

original: spyi yis ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: spyi yis ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
translated: which is the follower of that, is understood.

original: des na lkog gyur don thams cad //
analyzed: des na lkog gyur don thams cad //
translated: Therefore, all hidden objects

original: khyad par du ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par du ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: are not understood in particular.

original: go bar bya ba rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: go bar bya ba rtogs pa ni //
translated: The understanding of the object to be understood

original: go bar byed pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa yin no //
translated: is dependent on the means of understanding.

original: go bar byed pa de yang spyi'i ngo bos yin gyi khyad par gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: go bar byed pa de yang spyi'i ngo bos yin gyi khyad par gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: And that means of understanding is by way of a universal, not by way of a particular,

original: de rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to understand that.

original: ma rtogs pa'i ngo bos kyang go bar byed pa nyid yin na ni rnam pa thams cad dang rgyu gzhan dang gzhan thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i ngo bos kyang go bar byed pa nyid yin na ni rnam pa thams cad dang rgyu gzhan dang gzhan thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the means of understanding by way of a non-understood entity, it would follow that all aspects and all other causes would be understood.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i spyi de yang me la sogs pa thams cad la mthong ba de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyis na de las khyad par spyi mi rtogs so //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i spyi de yang me la sogs pa thams cad la mthong ba de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyis na de las khyad par spyi mi rtogs so //
translated: And that universal of smoke, etc. is seen in all fires, etc. Therefore, because of its uncertainty, a particular is not understood from that.

original: khyad par nye bar mtshon pa yin na rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par nye bar mtshon pa yin na rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If it is the particular that is indicated, it is understood.

original: ma yin te nang tshan gyi khyad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te nang tshan gyi khyad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the particular is not able to indicate the particular.

original: 'ga' zhig khyad par mtshon par 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig khyad par mtshon par 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Some say: It is just the special property that is indicated.

original: shin tu khyad par du gyur pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu khyad par du gyur pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it is not possible to indicate a special property.

original: khyad par nye bar mtshon pa ni der ltos pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par nye bar mtshon pa ni der ltos pas byas pa yin te /
translated: The indication of a special property is made in dependence on that,

original: gang ci srid pa tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang ci srid pa tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is just whatever exists.

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is the understanding of all aspects is the actualization,

original: de mngon sum kho na'o zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de mngon sum kho na'o zhes bstan zin to //
translated: and therefore it is taught that it is direct perception alone.

original: khyad par mthong ba las khyad par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba las khyad par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that one understands a special property from seeing a special property,

original: ma yin te der yang spyi rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin te der yang spyi rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: that is not so, because it is taught that even there one understands a universal.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /🔽'brel pa can gyis chos las ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni / 'brel pa can gyis chos las ni //
translated: This is explained:🔽From a related property🔽the understanding of a property possessor arises.

original: chos can la rtogs skye ba dag / de ni rjes dpag lkog gyur gyi //
