analyzed: chos can la rtogs skye ba dag / de ni rjes dpag lkog gyur gyi //
translated: That is the proof of an inference that is a hidden object.

original: sgrub byed gcig tu nges pa yin //
analyzed: sgrub byed gcig tu nges pa yin //
translated: It is ascertained as a single fact.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gyi tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan ma yin @208b no ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gyi tshad ma ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan ma yin @208b no ;
translated: Because there is no other definition, and because there is a definition of inference, valid knowledge of a hidden object is not different from inference.

original: / gal te gzhal bya gzhan gyi yul can tshad ma gzhan yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho nar zad pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te gzhal bya gzhan gyi yul can tshad ma gzhan yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho nar zad pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because valid knowledge has a different object, a different object of comprehension, valid knowledge is not just two,

original: 'di la lan du /🔽mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa las //
analyzed: 'di la lan du / mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa las //
translated: we reply:🔽There is no other object of comprehension

original: gzhal bya gzhan ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan ni yod ma yin //
translated: apart from the manifest and the hidden.

original: de phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis //
analyzed: de phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, because there are two objects of comprehension,🔽there are two types of valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma gnyis su 'dod pa dang // gal te tshad ma gnyis nyid kyis gzhal bya gnyis nyid do zhes rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis su 'dod pa dang // gal te tshad ma gnyis nyid kyis gzhal bya gnyis nyid do zhes rigs pa yin te /
translated: If you say that it is logical that there are two types of valid knowledge because there are two objects of comprehension,

original: yod par sgrub par byed pa ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yod par sgrub par byed pa ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because that which establishes existence is valid knowledge,🔽we reply:

original: de ltar ni ma yin te tshad mas ni gzhal bya sgrub la /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te tshad mas ni gzhal bya sgrub la /
translated: That is not so, because valid knowledge establishes the object of comprehension.

original: tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo ni rang rig pa'i rnam pa grub pa las so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo ni rang rig pa'i rnam pa grub pa las so //
translated: The nature of valid knowledge is established from the aspect of reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa ni shes pa'i rnam pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni shes pa'i rnam pa nyid de /
translated: Self-awareness is the aspect of consciousness itself.

original: rang dang spyi nyid du dmigs pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang dang spyi nyid du dmigs pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is the object of direct perception and inference in terms of its own particular and universal characteristics.

original: gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there are two objects of comprehension means because there are two kinds of objects of comprehension.

original: rang gi rnam pa gnyis myong ba na gcig go zhes bya bar ni mi rigs la /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa gnyis myong ba na gcig go zhes bya bar ni mi rigs la /
translated: When the two aspects are experienced, it is illogical to say that there is one,

original: gsum la sogs par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum la sogs par yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is there a third, etc.

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because there are two objects of comprehension,

original: gsum gcig ngas ni gsal ba yin //
analyzed: gsum gcig ngas ni gsal ba yin //
translated: The one valid cognition is clearly manifest.

original: gzhal bya gnyis las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan med do zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan med do zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: Because there is no object of comprehension other than the two objects of comprehension, there is no other valid cognition.🔽This is the explanation.

original: da ltar ni gzhal bya gnyis pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar ni gzhal bya gnyis pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, because there are two objects of comprehension,

original: tshad ma gcig ma yin la gsum la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: tshad ma gcig ma yin la gsum la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: there is not one valid cognition, nor are there three, etc.

original: gzhal bya gnyis yod na tshad ma gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis yod na tshad ma gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If there were two objects of comprehension, there would be one valid cognition.

original: gzhal bya gnyis pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a valid cognition that has a second kind of object.

original: tshad ma gcig gis ni gnyis pa yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma gcig gis ni gnyis pa yang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that one valid cognition has two kinds of objects.

original: 'on te spyi dang khyad par gyi yul can gzhal bya gcig nyid yin pa la /🔽gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te spyi dang khyad par gyi yul can gzhal bya gcig nyid yin pa la / gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the object of a cognition that has a universal or a particular is a single object,🔽then there is no second kind of object.

original: gzhal bya gnyis ma grub bo zhe na /🔽bshad pa / med pas gzhal bya ma yin phyir //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ma grub bo zhe na / bshad pa / med pas gzhal bya ma yin phyir //
translated: Therefore, the second kind of object does not exist.

original: gcig nyid ce na kho bo'ang 'dod //
analyzed: gcig nyid ce na kho bo'ang 'dod //
translated: We reply: If you say that it is a single object because it is not an object that does not exist,🔽we agree.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa nyid yin te //
translated: This is precisely what we accept.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ni med pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ni med pa yin la /
translated: There is no object that is other than a particular.

original: de yang gzhal bya ma yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gcig nyid gzhal bya yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzhal bya ma yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gcig nyid gzhal bya yin no //
translated: And that is not an object. A single particular is an object.

original: de nyid rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is a universal and a particular because it is understood in terms of its own nature and in terms of something else.

original: gzhan yang / med pa nges phyir gzhal bya ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / med pa nges phyir gzhal bya ni //
translated: Moreover: Because it is ascertained that it does not exist,

original: min la ma nges pa nyid dam //
analyzed: min la ma nges pa nyid dam //
translated: But it is not so, and it is not ascertained.

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa yang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir med par gzhal bya ma yin no zhes bya ba ji @209a * //🔽ltar khyab pa yin /
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa yang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir med par gzhal bya ma yin no zhes bya ba ji @209a * // ltar khyab pa yin /
translated: And because the non-existent is also an object of comprehension, since it is characterized by non-existence prior to, etc., how can it be pervaded by the statement, “The non-existent is not an object of comprehension”?

original: khyab pa med pa yang ji ltar gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa med pa yang ji ltar gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: And how can there be a logical reason when there is no pervasion?

original: ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: It is not ascertained.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / snga na med sogs rigs med na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / snga na med sogs rigs med na //
translated: If there is no non-existence prior to, etc.,

original: thams cad rtag pa nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: thams cad rtag pa nyid 'gyur te //
translated: all would be permanent.

original: 'bras med rgyu yang med pa nyid //
analyzed: 'bras med rgyu yang med pa nyid //
translated: There would be no cause without an effect.

original: de ltar yang ni ston par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar yang ni ston par 'gyur //
translated: And it would be taught in this way.

original: gcig la gcig med pa med na ni /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa med na ni /
translated: If there were no non-existence of one in the other,

original: rdzas rnams 'dre bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na mtha' dag gnyis med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas rnams 'dre bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na mtha' dag gnyis med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because substances would merge, all would be non-dual.

original: de nges tshad ma gnyis pa nyid //
analyzed: de nges tshad ma gnyis pa nyid //
translated: And that is a second valid cognition.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / med la dbang skyes blo min te //
analyzed: 'di ltar / med la dbang skyes blo min te //
translated: The cognition arisen from the sense faculties is not of the non-existent,

original: don gyi stobs las skyes pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don gyi stobs las skyes pa'i phyir //
translated: because it arises from the power of the object.

original: don gyi dus la ltos med na //
analyzed: don gyi dus la ltos med na //
translated: If it did not depend on the time of the object,

original: bar chod la sogs yod na yang //
analyzed: bar chod la sogs yod na yang //
translated: even if there were an obstruction, etc.,

original: dbang skyes blo ni skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The cognition born of the sense faculty is born.

original: med pa ni dbang po'i spyod yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ni dbang po'i spyod yul yang ma yin te /
translated: The non-existent is not the domain of the sense faculty.

original: de la ni sgra la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni sgra la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in that case, the intrinsic nature of sound, etc. would appear.

original: de 'di na med do zhes bya bar de'i rang bzhin med par ni dbang po'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'di na med do zhes bya bar de'i rang bzhin med par ni dbang po'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the domain of the sense faculty is the non-existence of the intrinsic nature of that.

original: bar chod kyang de med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chod kyang de med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the obstruction is also established as the non-existence of that.

original: 'o na te phyogs dben pa dmigs pa nyid las de ltar nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na te phyogs dben pa dmigs pa nyid las de ltar nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is ascertained in that way from the mere observation of the absence of something in a particular place,

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig gis /
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig gis /
translated: what is this so-called absence?

original: gal te sa phyogs pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: gal te sa phyogs pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If it is the intrinsic nature of the place,

original: de dmigs pas gzhan med do zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: de dmigs pas gzhan med do zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: how can it be said that the other does not exist from the observation of that?

original: de ni de med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni de med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because that is the nature of the non-existence of that.

original: ji ltar gzhan med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan med pa yin /
translated: How can it be the absence of the other?

original: de dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
translated: Because it is related to that.

original: ma 'brel ba ga las lhan cig rig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'brel ba ga las lhan cig rig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: How can there be a non-relation? Because there is no awareness of them together.

original: 'o na rig pa med pa las med par rig par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'o na rig pa med pa las med par rig par gzhag go //
translated: Well then, non-awareness is posited as the awareness of non-existence.

original: de las gzhan rig pa nyid de rig pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan rig pa nyid de rig pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is different from that, it is awareness itself, and not non-awareness.

original: de ma rig na de las gzhan nyid du ji ltar 'dzin //
analyzed: de ma rig na de las gzhan nyid du ji ltar 'dzin //
translated: If it is not aware of that, how can it be apprehended as different from that?

original: de sngar rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de sngar rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is reasonable that it is prior to that.

original: de nyid kyi tshe yin mod /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe yin mod /
translated: It is just at that time.

original: rig pa med do zhes med par ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: rig pa med do zhes med par ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How can it be known that there is no awareness?

original: de'i phyir med par nges pa'i di ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med par nges pa'i di ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this ascertainment of non-existence is not produced from the sense faculties.

original: des na 'di ni mngon sum ma yin no //🔽ci ste yang mngon sum nyid ldog pa na dngos po med par nges pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na 'di ni mngon sum ma yin no // ci ste yang mngon sum nyid ldog pa na dngos po med par nges pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, it is not perception.

original: gal te mngon sum nyid ldog las //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum nyid ldog las //
translated: But if it is said that when perception itself is withdrawn, it is the cause of ascertaining non-existence, that is not correct.

original: med par nges pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: med par nges pa yin zhe na //
translated: If non-existence is ascertained🔽from the withdrawal of perception itself,

original: 'gal ba'am de nyid ldog pa dang // rjes 'gro can gyi rtags yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'am de nyid ldog pa dang // rjes 'gro can gyi rtags yin no //
translated: it is a contradictory reason or one that is inconclusive.

original: mngon sum nyid ldog pa las dngos po med pa nges par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ldog pa las dngos po med pa nges par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the non-existence of a thing is ascertained from the cessation of perception,

original: med med bar yang yin la de la des rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: med med bar yang yin la de la des rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: then it is contradictory to say that it is non-existent and that it is ascertained by that.

original: mngon sum ni myong ba'i bdag nyid kyis na gang du zhugs pa de nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni myong ba'i bdag nyid kyis na gang du zhugs pa de nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: Perception, by the nature of its experience, ascertains that which it engages.

original: nyams su @209b myong ba la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su @209b myong ba la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the certainty of experience.

original: nyams su ma myong na go ji ltar nges /
analyzed: nyams su ma myong na go ji ltar nges /
translated: If there is no experience, how can there be certainty?

original: 'di ltar smra ba po dag ci gzhan yod dam 'on te med ces mi shes te /
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba po dag ci gzhan yod dam 'on te med ces mi shes te /
translated: In this way, the speaker does not know whether another exists or not.

original: der bdag la myong ba med do zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der bdag la myong ba med do zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that there is no experience of that for oneself.

original: nges pa med pa'i rgyu rig pa med pa las ji ltar nges /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i rgyu rig pa med pa las ji ltar nges /
translated: How can there be certainty from the cause of non-certainty, which is the absence of knowledge?

original: 'on te dmigs par rung ba ma dmigs pa ni don med pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'on te dmigs par rung ba ma dmigs pa ni don med pa yin te ;
translated: If it is said that the non-existence of an object is due to the non-perception of what is perceptible,

original: des na dngos po med par nges so zhe na /
analyzed: des na dngos po med par nges so zhe na /
translated: then it is ascertained that there is no thing.

original: 'o na ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa dngos po med par nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa dngos po med par nges pa med do //
translated: But then it is not ascertained that the other world and so on, which are beyond the senses, are non-existent.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa dngos po yod pa las ldog pa yin pa de'i tshe de las ldog pas khyab pa yin na go bar byed par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa dngos po yod pa las ldog pa yin pa de'i tshe de las ldog pas khyab pa yin na go bar byed par 'gyur bas na /
translated: If non-apprehension is the opposite of the existence of a thing, then it would be pervasion by the opposite.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rtags yin pas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gzhan grub ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rtags yin pas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gzhan grub ste /
translated: But since it is a logical mark that has concomitance and the nature of the opposite, inference is established as a separate valid cognition,

original: rtags las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced from a logical mark.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang de'i khongs su 'dus pa mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang de'i khongs su 'dus pa mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa yin no //
translated: This explains the logical mark of essential nature and the logical mark of non-apprehension, which is included in that.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the logical mark of effect:

original: gzhan sems dag ni rtogs phyir yang //
analyzed: gzhan sems dag ni rtogs phyir yang //
translated: Also, for the understanding of other minds,

original: tshad ma gnyis ni grub pa yin //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis ni grub pa yin //
translated: the two valid cognitions are established.

original: smra sogs la ni 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: smra sogs la ni 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of engagement in speech and so on,

original: de yi ngo bo'ang nges par 'grub //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo'ang nges par 'grub //
translated: its nature is also ascertained.

original: gzhan gyi sems pa ni bdag nyid kyi bzhin du mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems pa ni bdag nyid kyi bzhin du mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Other minds are not established by direct perception, like one's own mind.

original: de'i rnam par snang ba nyid las ni gzhan sems pa yod pas yin nam 'on te med pa yin zhes shes pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par snang ba nyid las ni gzhan sems pa yod pas yin nam 'on te med pa yin zhes shes pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one does not know whether the appearance itself is other than mind, whether it exists or does not exist.

original: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no such understanding.

original: sdang ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis nges pa yin no //
analyzed: sdang ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis nges pa yin no //
translated: The difference of aversion, etc. is ascertained by the difference of effect.

original: gal te rnam pa ci zhig ltar nges pa 'dir 'gyur mod de tshad ma ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa ci zhig ltar nges pa 'dir 'gyur mod de tshad ma ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says: “In what way is there ascertainment here? That is not a valid cognition.”

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: rjod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees the convention that is in conformity with the characteristics of expression, etc.

original: ji ltar rung bar tshad ma med pa can nyid 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rung bar tshad ma med pa can nyid 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says: “How is it that the engagement is without a valid cognition?”

original: ma yin te dpyad nas 'dor bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te dpyad nas 'dor bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it would follow that it is rejected after analysis.

original: thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir rten med pas mi 'dor ro zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir rten med pas mi 'dor ro zhe na /
translated: If one says: “It is not rejected because it is without a basis, since there is no other method,”

original: thabs gzhan med do zhes nges ba 'di yang tshad ma nyid yin la de la'ang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs gzhan med do zhes nges ba 'di yang tshad ma nyid yin la de la'ang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This certainty that there is no other means is itself a valid cognition, and it is also said to be an inference.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pas de skad brjod pa des na skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pas de skad brjod pa des na skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is stated by the opponent's acceptance, then there is no fault.

original: ma yin te gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the opponent's acceptance is engaged in inference for the sake of others.

original: bdag nyid gzhan gyis khas blangs pas rtogs par byed pa ni su yang med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan gyis khas blangs pas rtogs par byed pa ni su yang med do //
translated: No one is making a case by their own acceptance of something else.

original: re zhig rten gzhan ma rtogs pas des na bdag 'jug pa yin no zhe na /🔽'o @210a * //
analyzed: re zhig rten gzhan ma rtogs pas des na bdag 'jug pa yin no zhe na / 'o @210a * //
translated: If you say that the other's engagement is due to not understanding the basis,🔽then

original: na 'jig rten pha rol yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na 'jig rten pha rol yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the other world would be understood.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med kyang der yang 'tsho bar nus pa des na der yang sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med kyang der yang 'tsho bar nus pa des na der yang sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if the other world does not exist, if one is able to live there, then it is not established there.

original: de ltar 'tsho bar nus so zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
analyzed: de ltar 'tsho bar nus so zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
translated: If you say that it is able to live like that, then where is that?

original: 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba yang ci 'das pa'i 'tsho ba don du gnyer ram /
analyzed: 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba yang ci 'das pa'i 'tsho ba don du gnyer ram /
translated: Also, if you strive for livelihood, is it for past livelihood,🔽

original: 'on te da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba don du gnyer /
analyzed: 'on te da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba don du gnyer /
translated: Moreover, if you seek life, do you seek past life, or do you seek present or future life?

original: de la 'das pa ni don du gnyer ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'das pa ni don du gnyer ba ma yin te /
translated: Past life is not sought,

original: 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is past.

original: da ltar byung ba'i don du gnyer ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i don du gnyer ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is present life sought,

original: de ni thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is already obtained.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i don du gnyer ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i don du gnyer ro zhe na /
translated: But future life is sought.

original: 'o na ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba ni thabs 'dis 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba ni thabs 'dis 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
translated: But if you say that future life is sought, then you understand future life through positive and negative concomitance, saying, “It comes about through this means, not through another.”

original: gzhan yang tha snyad 'di ni ci ltar rung bar yin no zhes bya ba ci khyed nyid kyi'am 'on te gzhan gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha snyad 'di ni ci ltar rung bar yin no zhes bya ba ci khyed nyid kyi'am 'on te gzhan gyi /
translated: Moreover, how is this conventional expression possible?

original: gal te khyed nyid kyi yin na gnyi ga la grub pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan rtogs /
analyzed: gal te khyed nyid kyi yin na gnyi ga la grub pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan rtogs /
translated: If it is yours, then how do you understand it, since it is not established for both?

original: 'on te gzhan la yang thabs med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la yang thabs med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if there is no other means,

original: de lta yin na gdon mi za bar gzhan gyis sems pa rtogs pas ji ltar 'di rnam pa rung bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na gdon mi za bar gzhan gyis sems pa rtogs pas ji ltar 'di rnam pa rung bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: then, since you must know the thoughts of others, how can you know that this is a valid cognition?

original: 'on te 'di rnams yang ji ltar rung bar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di rnams yang ji ltar rung bar yin no zhe na /
translated: But how can these be valid cognitions?

original: de lta na ni 'o na khyod nyid yid ches pa med par gzhan ji ltar rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na khyod nyid yid ches pa med par gzhan ji ltar rtogs par byed /
translated: If that is so, then how can you, who are yourself unreliable, make others understand?

original: bdag re zhig de ltar yin te gzhan ni ji ltar zhes mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: bdag re zhig de ltar yin te gzhan ni ji ltar zhes mi shes so zhe na /
translated: If you say, “I know that it is so, but I do not know how it is for others,”

original: 'o na ni mi smra ba nyid thob bo //
analyzed: 'o na ni mi smra ba nyid thob bo //
translated: then you should remain silent.

original: gzhan yang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “It is so for others as well,”

original: ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because there is no valid cognition to establish that.

original: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is mere prattle.

original: des na gzhan rtogs pa yod pa des na gzhan gyis kyang rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan rtogs pa yod pa des na gzhan gyis kyang rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Since others do have understanding, others should accept inference.

original: slu med phyir de tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: slu med phyir de tshad ma nyid //
translated: It is valid cognition because it is nondeceptive.

original: gal te la la dag tu ni //
analyzed: gal te la la dag tu ni //
translated: If someone says,

original: 'khrul phyir yid brtan med ce na //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir yid brtan med ce na //
translated: If you say that it is not reliable because it is mistaken,

original: rtags log mthong phyir de de 'dra //
analyzed: rtags log mthong phyir de de 'dra //
translated: then it is like the perception of a false reason.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi slu ba yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi slu ba yin la /
translated: The definition of a valid cognition is that it is non-deceptive.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa la yad pas ni tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa la yad pas ni tshad ma nyid do //
translated: Since inference is non-deceptive, it is a valid cognition.

original: 'on te la lar slu ba yang mthong ba'i phyir bzlog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te la lar slu ba yang mthong ba'i phyir bzlog par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you say that it is reversed because it is sometimes seen to be deceptive,

original: 'di ltar na de'i bu yin pa'i phyir sngo bas ngas so zhes bya bas 'khrul pa dang 'brel pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar na de'i bu yin pa'i phyir sngo bas ngas so zhes bya bas 'khrul pa dang 'brel pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is like saying, He is blue-eyed because he is the son of so-and-so, where there is a connection with error, but it is still inference.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin te 'brel pa med pas rtags ltar snang ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin te 'brel pa med pas rtags ltar snang ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not inference itself, because it arises from a seemingly valid reason due to lack of connection.

original: de'i bu nyid ni sngo bas ngas dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bu nyid ni sngo bas ngas dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: Being the son of so-and-so is not connected with blue eyes.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis @210b na mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis @210b na mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is similar because it depends on the same collection,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no dependence on the same collection.

original: las dang zas dang dus kyi khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang zas dang dus kyi khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are differences in karma, food, and time.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa yin na ni cig car skye bar thal lo //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa yin na ni cig car skye bar thal lo //
translated: If it were dependent on a single collection, it would follow that it would arise simultaneously.

original: des na rtags kyi de kho na'i rang bzhin ma mtshon pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma yin pa la yang gtan tshigs su lhag par sgros btags pa na 'khrul par bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtags kyi de kho na'i rang bzhin ma mtshon pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma yin pa la yang gtan tshigs su lhag par sgros btags pa na 'khrul par bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of reality is not indicated by the reason, it is thought that there is error when a nonreason is imagined to be a reason.

original: ci ste rjes su dpag pa thams cad ni 'di lta bu'i tshul can yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rjes su dpag pa thams cad ni 'di lta bu'i tshul can yin te /
translated: But if you think that all inferences are of this type,

original: khyad par gzhan ni rtogs pa med pas na gang zhig mi 'khrul pa yin snyam na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan ni rtogs pa med pas na gang zhig mi 'khrul pa yin snyam na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: and that since there is no other distinction, there is no error, that is also not correct.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / gang las 'ga' tshe dngos dga' la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang las 'ga' tshe dngos dga' la //
translated: When something is recognized as a thing that is desired at some time,

original: de rtogs pa ni grub gyur pa //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni grub gyur pa //
translated: its realization is established.

original: de ni de las skyes pa'am //
analyzed: de ni de las skyes pa'am //
translated: It is either arisen from that

original: de yi ngo bor gdon mi za //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor gdon mi za //
translated: or it is its nature, without a doubt.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i rtags ni go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i rtags ni go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: A reason that possesses the connection characterized by identity and origination is the means of understanding.

original: gzhan ni de ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang las 'khrul pa med pa bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa de ni nges pa kho nar de las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan ni de ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro // gang las 'khrul pa med pa bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa de ni nges pa kho nar de las skyes pa'am /
translated: because the other appears in that way.

original: de'i rang bzhin du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du nges pa yin no //
translated: That from which one understands the object to be established without error is ascertained to arise from that or to have that as its nature.

original: de lta ma yin na ni 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa mi srid de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa mi srid de /
translated: If it were not so, then understanding without error would be impossible,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absurdity of the consequence that everything would be understood from everything.

original: thams cad las ni thams cad la rtogs pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad las ni thams cad la rtogs pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: But understanding does not arise from everything with regard to everything,

original: res 'ga' ba nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes it is observed that it does not arise.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa 'di ni gdon mi za bar 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i don gyis bskyed pa yin la 'brel pa yang rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa 'di ni gdon mi za bar 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i don gyis bskyed pa yin la 'brel pa yang rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, this understanding is necessarily generated by an object that has a relation, and the relation is only of two kinds.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa la yang brgyud pa de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho nas 'brel pa yin pas de nyid las ma 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa la yang brgyud pa de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho nas 'brel pa yin pas de nyid las ma 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Even in the case of dependence on a single collection, the relation is only the characteristic of arising from that continuum, so there is no error.

original: 'di ltar / rang gi rgyu'am ngo bo dag / med par don ni srid min pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang gi rgyu'am ngo bo dag / med par don ni srid min pa //
translated: An object is not possible without its cause or its nature.

original: de dag rang bzhin mthong gang yin //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin mthong gang yin //
translated: That which is seen as the nature

original: de nyid gzhan du mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du mtshan nyid yin //
translated: of that is the characteristic of something else.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid gzhan du yang mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid gzhan du yang mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That which is seen as the characteristic of a reason of effect or nature is the characteristic of something else.

original: de'i bu la sogs pa nyid la ni de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bu la sogs pa nyid la ni de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it does not exist in the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: des na thams cad la yid brtan du med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad la yid brtan du med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that everything is unreliable.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na ni /
translated: If it were possible to invalidate something that possesses a characteristic,

original: de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba nyid du 'gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba nyid du 'gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the characteristic itself would be refuted, and everything would be unreliable.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: But it is not reasonable to say that it is otherwise.

original: rgyu'am rang gi ngo bo med pa ni 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'am rang gi ngo bo med pa ni 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: An object is not possible without its cause or its nature.

original: de ltar rtogs pa yin na thams cad du tha snyad chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa yin na thams cad du tha snyad chad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understood it in that way, then all conventions would be severed.

original: 'di ni tha @211a * //
analyzed: 'di ni tha @211a * //
translated: This is the case

original: snyad pa'i tshad ma'i skabs yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snyad pa'i tshad ma'i skabs yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: in the context of conventional valid cognition, not in any other context.🔽Therefore, those who are conventionalists must necessarily be engaged in

original: des na tha snyad pa dag gis ni gdon mi za bar rjes su dpag pa don du gnyer bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na tha snyad pa dag gis ni gdon mi za bar rjes su dpag pa don du gnyer bar bya ba yin no //
translated: inferential reasoning.

original: thabs med par ji ltar 'jug ce na /🔽ma yin te /
analyzed: thabs med par ji ltar 'jug ce na / ma yin te /
translated: How can one engage in this without a method?

original: thabs rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par dpyad na 'jig par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: thabs rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro // rnam par dpyad na 'jig par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, because the method is well established.🔽If you say that it is destroyed through analysis, no, because the analysis

original: rnam par dpyod pa yang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa yang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: itself is inferential.

original: de ni lam du 'gro bzhin pa nyid na lam de nyid brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni lam du 'gro bzhin pa nyid na lam de nyid brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is like the case of someone walking along a path who points to it.

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa la 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa la 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the relation between nonperception and the absence of perception?

original: de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is the relation of identity, that is, the relation of origination from it.

original: 'di ltar / bltar rung rang gi ngo bo'am //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bltar rung rang gi ngo bo'am //
translated: Thus:🔽If the perceptible, the essence,

original: rang rgyu mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan dag / yod par snang ba med na ni //
analyzed: rang rgyu mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan dag / yod par snang ba med na ni //
translated: or the cause of the other are not seen,

original: de dang ldan pa'ang ji ltar yod //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'ang ji ltar yod //
translated: How could it exist in that way?

original: gang phyir 'di der 'brel pa de nyid kyi phyir de med pas med par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang phyir 'di der 'brel pa de nyid kyi phyir de med pas med par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Because it is related to that, it is nonexistent when that is nonexistent.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gzhan med pas ji ltar med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan med pas ji ltar med par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be nonexistent when the other is nonexistent?

original: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: In that case, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: / gal te de med na med pa de lta na de 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: / gal te de med na med pa de lta na de 'brel pa yin te /
translated: If it is nonexistent when that is nonexistent, then it is related to that,

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were not so, it would not be related.

original: de'i phyir gang du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu'am khyab par byed pa ma dmigs pa der ni de dag med pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu'am khyab par byed pa ma dmigs pa der ni de dag med pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, when a cause or a pervader is not observed as the characteristic of the observed object, then they are nonexistent there.

original: de dag med pa gang yin pa de na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag kyang mi srid pas na mi dmigs pa yang 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de dag med pa gang yin pa de na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag kyang mi srid pas na mi dmigs pa yang 'khrul pa med do //
translated: And when they are nonexistent there, the effect and the pervaded are also impossible, so the nonobservation is not erroneous.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum char gyi rjes su dpag pa yang yod do zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum char gyi rjes su dpag pa yang yod do zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, inference from the effect, from the nature of things, and from nonobservation are established as existing in all three ways.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: spyi yi blo ni tshad min na //
analyzed: spyi yi blo ni tshad min na //
translated: If the cognition of generality is not valid cognition,

original: med pa thob 'gyur pha rol gyi //🔽dngos gzhan gal te dbang rnams kyis //
analyzed: med pa thob 'gyur pha rol gyi // dngos gzhan gal te dbang rnams kyis //
translated: then one would attain the nonexistent,🔽like the other side.🔽If one cognizes the other side

original: dus gzhan du ni rtogs she na //🔽de min dbang dang nus sogs la //
analyzed: dus gzhan du ni rtogs she na // de min dbang dang nus sogs la //
translated: through the sense faculties at another time,🔽then it is not so,🔽because the sense cognition is impossible

original: dbang po'i blo ni mi srid phyir //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni mi srid phyir //
translated: with regard to the sense faculty, potency, etc.

original: med par rtogs pa yin na ni //
analyzed: med par rtogs pa yin na ni //
translated: If one cognizes the nonexistent,

original: blo dang skye ba rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: blo dang skye ba rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: then cognition and arising would be causeless.

original: gal te spyi'i blo tshad ma ma yin pa nyid na de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya med do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i blo tshad ma ma yin pa nyid na de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya med do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the cognition of generality is not valid cognition, then at that time the object of evaluation called “the hidden” would not exist,

original: 'jig rten pha rol nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the other side of the world.

original: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that all hidden objects do not exist,

original: dbang po rnams kyis rim gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis rim gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are cognized gradually through the sense faculties.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la ni dus gzhan du yang dbang po 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la ni dus gzhan du yang dbang po 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculties do not engage the other side of the world at another time,

original: des na rnam pa de lta bu nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na rnam pa de lta bu nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and therefore it is nonexistent in that way.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe rtogs pa de nyid kyi tshe yod mod sngar yod pa gang gi las sngar yang gzhan @211b gyis rtogs pa des na yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe rtogs pa de nyid kyi tshe yod mod sngar yod pa gang gi las sngar yang gzhan @211b gyis rtogs pa des na yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it exists at the time of its own realization, then it existed previously, and it was realized by another previously.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang sngar gzhan nam rang gis ma rtogs so zhes bya ba ga las yin zhing 'jig rten pha rol las gzhan yang gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes bya ba ga las yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang sngar gzhan nam rang gis ma rtogs so zhes bya ba ga las yin zhing 'jig rten pha rol las gzhan yang gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes bya ba ga las yin /
translated: But how can it be said that the world beyond was not previously realized by another or by itself? And how can it be said that the world beyond is realized by another, since it is different from it?

original: de ltar tha snyad byed pa las so zhe na rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad byed pa las so zhe na rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is so because of the use of expressions, then inference is valid.

original: dbang po'am rung ba nyid la ni rnam grangs kyis dbang po 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'am rung ba nyid la ni rnam grangs kyis dbang po 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: But the functioning of the sense faculties is not by way of a category,

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its realization is by way of inference, which arises from the evidence of effect and nature.

original: de med na ni don rnams kyi skye ba dang blo rgyu mtshan med pa kho nar 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na ni don rnams kyi skye ba dang blo rgyu mtshan med pa kho nar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist, then the arising of objects and the mind would be without a cause.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu mthong ba dang / 'bras bu ldog pas rung ba nyid dang / mig la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas na yod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu mthong ba dang / 'bras bu ldog pas rung ba nyid dang / mig la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas na yod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, since the effect is seen and since the effect is inferred from the cessation of the effect, the eye, etc. exist.

original: de la dbang po'i byed pa ni rnam grangs kyis 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i byed pa ni rnam grangs kyis 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The function of the sense faculty is not a nominal engagement.

original: des na 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang de lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang de lta bu nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the other world, etc. are just like that.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa med par ni spyi mi rtogs so //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa med par ni spyi mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, without inference, the universal is not understood.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / rnam rtog med pa nyid kyis na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam rtog med pa nyid kyis na //
translated: Because of the absence of conceptual thought,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon sum //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon sum //
translated: the specific identity is direct perception.

original: rnam rtog med par spyi 'dzin min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med par spyi 'dzin min //
translated: The universal is not apprehended without conceptual thought.

original: de phyir de la rjes dpag nyid //
analyzed: de phyir de la rjes dpag nyid //
translated: Therefore, it is just inference.

original: spyi nges par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa yang tha snyad kyi rgyu yin na /
analyzed: spyi nges par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa yang tha snyad kyi rgyu yin na /
translated: If the understanding that has the nature of ascertaining the universal is the cause of the conventional,

original: spyi rnam par rtog pa med pas ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi rnam par rtog pa med pas ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: the universal is not apprehended without conceptual thought.

original: mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception is not conceptual thought,

original: rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without analysis.

original: de'i phyir spyi'i yul can ni rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i yul can ni rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is a subsequent consciousness that has a general object.🔽

original: mngon sum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal is the object of inference, not of perception.

original: 'o na kha dog la sogs pa de mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'dzin pa de ji ltar /
analyzed: 'o na kha dog la sogs pa de mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'dzin pa de ji ltar /
translated: But if the universal is the object of inference, how is it that the Sūtra says:🔽“The five groups of consciousness are not mistaken with regard to their object”?

original: 'di ni rang dang spyi'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rang dang spyi'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: This Sūtra does not say that the five groups of consciousness apprehend the specific and general characteristics of their object.

original: khyed ni gzhal bya nges par 'dod pa yin no //🔽gzhal bya nges na kha dog ni //
analyzed: khyed ni gzhal bya nges par 'dod pa yin no // gzhal bya nges na kha dog ni //
translated: You maintain that the object is ascertained.🔽But if the object is ascertained,

original: mi rtag nyid du rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid du rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: color, etc. is not ascertained as impermanent.

original: de blo tshad ma gzhan 'gyur te //
analyzed: de blo tshad ma gzhan 'gyur te //
translated: This is because the cognition of color, etc. is a different valid cognition

original: rtags med par ni yod phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags med par ni yod phyir ro //
translated: because it exists without a reason.

original: gzhal bya nges pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i tshad mas bzung ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhal bya nges pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i tshad mas bzung ba nyid yin na /
translated: The object is ascertained when it is apprehended by a valid cognition that distinguishes the specific and general characteristics.

original: kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dren mar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dren mar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But the cognition of color, etc. as impermanent is a confused cognition,

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag phan tshun 'dres par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag phan tshun 'dres par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends the specific and general characteristics as mixed together.

original: 'dres na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin rtogs pa tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dres na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin rtogs pa tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were mixed, then the realization of the nature of both would be a different valid cognition.

original: rtags med par yang yod pa'i phyir na 'di rjes su dpag pa ma yin la spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags med par yang yod pa'i phyir na 'di rjes su dpag pa ma yin la spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it exists without a reason, it is not inference. Since it apprehends a universal, it is not direct perception.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin pas na 'di ni tshad ma @212a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin pas na 'di ni tshad ma @212a * //
translated: Since it is not inference with regard to its own characteristics, it is not a valid cognition.

original: gzhan nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan nyid de /
translated: It is a different valid cognition.

original: rtags med par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / spyi yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags med par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / spyi yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages without a reason and because a universal appears.

original: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa la yang spyi rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa la yang spyi rtogs pa med de /
translated: Also, with regard to inference that sees a particular, there is no realization of a universal.

original: spyi dang rtags 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang rtags 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the connection between a universal and a reason is not established.

original: de smras pa ni /🔽khyad par mthong la rtags dang ni //
analyzed: de smras pa ni / khyad par mthong la rtags dang ni //
translated: That is stated:🔽Because there is no realization of the connection

original: 'brel par rtogs pa med ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'brel par rtogs pa med ba'i phyir //
translated: between a particular that is seen and a reason,

original: de ni tshad ma gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma gzhan yin no //
translated: that is a different valid cognition.

original: gzhal bya mang phyir tshad ma rnams //
analyzed: gzhal bya mang phyir tshad ma rnams //
translated: Because there are many objects of comprehension,🔽the valid cognitions

original: mang po nyid dam gcig la yang //
analyzed: mang po nyid dam gcig la yang //
translated: are many or even one.

original: du ma nyid ni 'jug phyir te //
analyzed: du ma nyid ni 'jug phyir te //
translated: Because multiplicity engages.

original: gcig gsum grangs kyang sel mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig gsum grangs kyang sel mi 'gyur //
translated: The number one and the number three are not excluded.

original: dper na khyad par mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: dper na khyad par mthong ba bzhin //
translated: For example, it is like seeing a particular.

original: yul nges pa ni med phyir dang // gzhal bya gzhan ni yod phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nges pa ni med phyir dang // gzhal bya gzhan ni yod phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no ascertainment of the object and because another object of comprehension exists.

original: kha dog la sogs pa ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la ni rtags 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la ni rtags 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In this case, “color, etc. are impermanent,” there is no reason at all.

original: de ni mngon sum yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not direct perception,

original: spyi mi rtags pa nyid kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi mi rtags pa nyid kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-permanence of the universal is also understood.

original: khyad par mthong ba la yang khyad par nyid rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba la yang khyad par nyid rtogs pa yin te /
translated: In seeing a particular, it is the particular that is understood,

original: rtags de dang spyi 'brel pa med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags de dang spyi 'brel pa med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the connection between that reason and the universal is understood.

original: des na de ni khyod kyi 'dod pa dang sbyar na tshad ma gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ni khyod kyi 'dod pa dang sbyar na tshad ma gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in accordance with your assertion, it would be another valid cognition.

original: dngos su rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: dngos su rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because there is no direct understanding,

original: mngon sum ma yin /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin /
translated: it is not direct perception.

original: spyi'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not have a universal as its object, it is not inference.

original: gzhan yang spyi dang khyad par dang gnyi ga'i dbye bas gzhal bya mang po yod pa'i phyir tshad ma rnams mang po gnyis pas gsum gyi grangs sel ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi dang khyad par dang gnyi ga'i dbye bas gzhal bya mang po yod pa'i phyir tshad ma rnams mang po gnyis pas gsum gyi grangs sel ba ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, because there are many objects of comprehension by way of the divisions of the general, the particular, and both, the number of valid cognitions is not eliminated by the number two.

original: tshad ma du ma gcig la 'jug pas grangs gcig la sel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma du ma gcig la 'jug pas grangs gcig la sel ba ma yin te /
translated: And because many valid cognitions engage one object, the number one is not eliminated.

original: dper na khyad par mthong ba dang lhan cig mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid gcig la 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khyad par mthong ba dang lhan cig mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid gcig la 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that the perception of a particular and the perception of a universal engage the same intrinsic identity.

original: de bzhin du spyi la yang mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi la yang mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, perception engages a universal.

original: des na gzhal bya gnyis mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na gzhal bya gnyis mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because two objects of comprehension are seen,

original: grangs gcig gsal ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grangs gcig gsal ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa der mi 'gyur te /
translated: it is not the case that the number one is the manifest object, as was said.

original: mngon sum nyid spyi la 'jug pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid spyi la 'jug pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that perception engages a universal.

original: yul nges pa yin na gzhal bya gzhan med pas gsum dang gcig grangs gsal bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: yul nges pa yin na gzhal bya gzhan med pas gsum dang gcig grangs gsal bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the object is ascertained, because there is no other object of comprehension, the number three and the number one would be manifest objects.

original: bshad pa'i tshul gyis na gnyi ga yang yod pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dgos pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshul gyis na gnyi ga yang yod pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dgos pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: In the manner of explanation, both are present, and so the desired purpose is not accomplished.

original: tshad ma ma nges par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / gzhal bya mang ba'i phyir tshad ma mang bas so //
analyzed: tshad ma ma nges par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / gzhal bya mang ba'i phyir tshad ma mang bas so //
translated: Because the valid cognition is not ascertained, it engages, and because the objects of comprehension are many, there are many valid cognitions.

original: gal te don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
analyzed: gal te don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
translated: If you say, “Because of the capacity or incapacity to perform a function,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal bya mang po nyid gsal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal bya mang po nyid gsal ba ma yin nam /
translated: and so on, is it not clear that there are many objects of comprehension?

original: de ji ltar na 'di nye bar 'god ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na 'di nye bar 'god ce na /
translated: How is it that this is presented?

original: bden mod kyi 'di yang mthong ngo zhes nye bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'di yang mthong ngo zhes nye bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is true, but it is also taught that this is seen.

original: yang na pha rol po 'gal @212b ba mi 'khrul ba can nye bar ston par byed pas na skyon med do //
analyzed: yang na pha rol po 'gal @212b ba mi 'khrul ba can nye bar ston par byed pas na skyon med do //
translated: Or, because the opponent is taught to be nonerroneous, there is no fault.

original: tshad ma ma nges par 'jug pa nye bar bstan pa ni 'thad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma nges par 'jug pa nye bar bstan pa ni 'thad pa kho na yin no //
translated: The teaching that the valid cognition engages without being ascertained is completely correct.

original: de'i phyir lkog gyur don thams cad //
analyzed: de'i phyir lkog gyur don thams cad //
translated: Therefore, all hidden objects

original: khyad par du ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par du ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: are not understood in particular.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang ma grub pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang ma grub pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: This also is said to be unestablished.

original: des na gsum dang gcig gi grangs gsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na gsum dang gcig gi grangs gsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the number three and the number one are not clarified.

original: 'di la bshad pa ;
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ;
translated: The response to this is as follows:

original: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: This fault does not arise,

original: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied to the universal of color.

original: kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes kha dog gi spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang 'byor par byed do //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes kha dog gi spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang 'byor par byed do //
translated: It is applied to the universal of color as impermanent, saying “color, etc. are impermanent.”

original: des na spyi'i ngo bo gcig pu nyid gzhal bya yin gyi /
analyzed: des na spyi'i ngo bo gcig pu nyid gzhal bya yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the object of comprehension is the single universal nature.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: Since it is not the nature of both, this fault does not arise.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo yin na ni yul nges pa med pa'i phyir dang gzhal bya gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo yin na ni yul nges pa med pa'i phyir dang gzhal bya gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were the nature of a universal and a particular, this fault would arise: the object would be indefinite and there would be another object of comprehension.

original: spyi gcig pu yin pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi gcig pu yin pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case if it is a single universal.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kha dog gi spyi nyid dang sbyor bar byed na de dngos po'i chos ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kha dog gi spyi nyid dang sbyor bar byed na de dngos po'i chos ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If impermanence were applied to the universal of color alone, it would not be a quality of a thing.

original: chos gang zhig gang la ldan par rtogs pa de ni de nyid kyang chos yin no //
analyzed: chos gang zhig gang la ldan par rtogs pa de ni de nyid kyang chos yin no //
translated: That which is understood to be the possession of a dharma is also a dharma.

original: spyi yang spyi dang ldan pa yin na de'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi yang spyi dang ldan pa yin na de'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: If a universal is the possession of a universal, it is the nature of that universal.

original: dngos po'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the nature of an entity.

original: spyi ni dngos po'i ma yin pa'i phyir de'i chos ni dngos po med pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi ni dngos po'i ma yin pa'i phyir de'i chos ni dngos po med pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since a universal is not an entity, its dharma would be the non-entityness of an entity.

original: de ni ma yin te /🔽'di ltar / dngos med ngo bo min de nyid //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'di ltar / dngos med ngo bo min de nyid //
translated: That is not so.

original: de ltar grub pas sgrub phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar grub pas sgrub phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established in this way:🔽A non-entity is not an entity.🔽Since it is established in that way, it is established as a non-entity.

original: gzhan la gzhan grub min zhe na //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan grub min zhe na //
translated: If you say, “One thing is not established in another,”

original: ma yin de nyid grub phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin de nyid grub phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is established in itself.

original: gal te spyi brtags pas dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi brtags pas dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos ma yin na /
translated: If a universal is not the dharma of an entity because it is not an entity,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa de yang dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa de yang dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: impermanence and so on would also not be entities.

original: gnyi ga yang dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “Neither is an entity,”

original: ma yin te dngos po nyid de ltar grub pas so //
analyzed: ma yin te dngos po nyid de ltar grub pas so //
translated: that is not so, because an entity is established in that way.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la yang yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la yang yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The impermanence, etc. of the color, etc. that appear in conceptual thoughts exists in the specific characteristic itself.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba nyid las 'di'i ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba nyid las 'di'i ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceptual thought of the nature of that arises from the experience of the specific characteristic itself.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid la 'brel pa ma yin na de la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ji ltar de nyid de ltar grub pa yin zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid la 'brel pa ma yin na de la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ji ltar de nyid de ltar grub pa yin zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If the conceptual thought is not related to the specific characteristic, then how is it established as just that, because the specific characteristic does not appear in it?

original: brgyud nas 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyud nas 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is related indirectly.

original: dngos su ma 'brel par yang brgyud nas 'brel pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de nyid ni mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos su ma 'brel par yang brgyud nas 'brel pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de nyid ni mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: Even though it is not related directly, it is related indirectly, and that conceptual thought possesses nondeception.

original: gal te bag chags dang 'brel pa yin na ji ltar dngos po dang 'brel pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bag chags dang 'brel pa yin na ji ltar dngos po dang 'brel pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is related to latent impressions, how is it related to the thing itself?

original: bag chags de dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags de dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that latent impression is related to the thing itself.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dngos gang ji lta bur gyur pa //
analyzed: dngos gang ji lta bur gyur pa //
translated: Whatever is the case with the entity,

original: de 'dra de @213a * //
analyzed: de 'dra de @213a * //
translated: that is the case with the sign🔽of the mind.

original: ni rtags sems kyi //🔽rgyu yin de las de lta yi //
analyzed: ni rtags sems kyi // rgyu yin de las de lta yi //
translated: The mind that has the sign🔽of the entity that produces it in that way

original: dngos la de skyed rtags can blo //🔽bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: dngos la de skyed rtags can blo // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu'am /
translated: is established.

original: khyab par byed pa yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been explained that whatever is the property to be established is the cause of the proof or the pervader.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa yang 'bras bu dang khyab bya'i sems kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa yang 'bras bu dang khyab bya'i sems kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: The cause and the pervader are the cause of the mind that is the effect and the pervaded.

original: sems de las kyang rtags can gyi blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni brgyud nas dngos po la 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: sems de las kyang rtags can gyi blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni brgyud nas dngos po la 'brel pa yin no //
translated: And the mind that has the sign that arises from that is indirectly related to the entity.

original: des na / de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //
analyzed: des na / de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //
translated: Thus, the sign and the mind that has the sign

original: brgyud pa yis ni dngos po la //
analyzed: brgyud pa yis ni dngos po la //
translated: are indirectly related to the entity.

original: 'brel phyir der snang ba yis na //
analyzed: 'brel phyir der snang ba yis na //
translated: Therefore, even though it appears as that,

original: stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
analyzed: stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
translated: it is not deceptive, even though empty.

original: snang ba nyid las dngos po 'thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba nyid las dngos po 'thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The entity is not obtained from mere appearance.

original: lhag par zhen pa las kyang dngos po 'thob pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa las kyang dngos po 'thob pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to obtain an object even from a non-existent object-support.

original: 'jug pas thob pa yin gyi snang ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pas thob pa yin gyi snang ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Obtainment is by way of engagement, not by way of mere appearance.

original: 'jug pa ni lhag par zhen pa las kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni lhag par zhen pa las kyang mthong ste /
translated: And engagement is seen even from a non-existent object-support.

original: de lta ma yin na snang ba las kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na snang ba las kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no engagement even from an existent object-support.

original: dang po lhag par zhen pas 'jug na phyis goms pa las snang bar 'jug par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po lhag par zhen pas 'jug na phyis goms pa las snang bar 'jug par nus pa yin no //
translated: If there is engagement at first by way of a non-existent object-support, later, through familiarity, one is able to engage by way of appearance.

original: des na zhugs shing yod pa nyid na thob pa yin no //
analyzed: des na zhugs shing yod pa nyid na thob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when there is engagement, there is obtainment.

original: ji ltar snang ba yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du snang ba'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa yang yin pas gnyi ga la yang thob pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du snang ba'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa yang yin pas gnyi ga la yang thob pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as there is obtainment of the object-support, so there is also obtainment of the cause of appearance and the pervader.

original: snang ba 'di 'ga' yang thob pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar dpyad pa nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba 'di 'ga' yang thob pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar dpyad pa nyid do //
translated: We have already analyzed this point: “There is no obtainment of any of these appearances.”

original: ji ltar snang ba las yod par shes pa de bzhin du 'brel pa snang ba las kyang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba las yod par shes pa de bzhin du 'brel pa snang ba las kyang yin no //
translated: Just as one knows existence from appearance, so one knows it from the appearance of the connection.

original: gal te thob pa'i yul med pa 'di na ni 'gro ba snang ba tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te thob pa'i yul med pa 'di na ni 'gro ba snang ba tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: If this were not the case, then the world would be mere appearance,

original: 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i dbye ba nges par mi zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i dbye ba nges par mi zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the distinction between error and non-error would not be ascertained.

original: snang ba tsam la ni 'khrul pa dang cig shos kyi dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba tsam la ni 'khrul pa dang cig shos kyi dbye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But mere appearance does not have the distinction of error and non-error.

original: de'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa na 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul ba rnam par gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa na 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul ba rnam par gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges so //
translated: Therefore, when one understands the hidden, error and non-error are established, but not otherwise.

original: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //
analyzed: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //
translated: Thus, the sign and the one who has the sign🔽are related through the mind

original: brgyud pa yis ni dngos po la //🔽'brel phyir der snang ba yis ni //
analyzed: brgyud pa yis ni dngos po la // 'brel phyir der snang ba yis ni //
translated: to the thing.🔽Therefore, even though it is empty, the appearance

original: stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
analyzed: stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
translated: is not deceptive.

original: de yi ngo bos stong de la //
analyzed: de yi ngo bos stong de la //
translated: That is empty of its own nature,🔽because it is conceived to be

original: de yi ngo bor zhen pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor zhen pa'i phyir //
translated: its own nature.

original: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
analyzed: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
translated: Even though it is not deceptive,

original: 'khrul par rnam gzhag byas pa yin //
analyzed: 'khrul par rnam gzhag byas pa yin //
translated: it is established as error.

original: 'di la kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig na re /
translated: In this regard, someone says:

original: du ba la sogs pa rtags can dang 'brel par rtogs pa'i blo ni rtags kyi blo yin no //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa rtags can dang 'brel par rtogs pa'i blo ni rtags kyi blo yin no //
translated: The cognition that understands the connection between the sign and the one possessing the sign is the cognition of the sign.

original: rtags ni dbang po bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rtags ni dbang po bzhin du yod pa tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin la /
translated: The sign is not understood merely by the existence of the sense faculty.

original: rang la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba tsam gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba tsam gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it merely by the appearance in the consciousness that observes itself,

original: de'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa ma mthong bas @213b kyang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
