analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa ma mthong bas @213b kyang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be understood even without seeing the connection with its nature.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni rtags 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni rtags 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, apprehending it as a connection is apprehending the sign.

original: 'brel pa de yang gnyi ga'i rang bzhin la ma reg par ni gzung bar mi nus te gzhan du 'dzin pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa de yang gnyi ga'i rang bzhin la ma reg par ni gzung bar mi nus te gzhan du 'dzin pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that connection cannot be apprehended without touching the nature of both, because apprehending something else is not seen.

original: de la ji ltar rtags can 'dzin pa rtags can gyi yul can yin pa de bzhin du rtags 'dzin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de la ji ltar rtags can 'dzin pa rtags can gyi yul can yin pa de bzhin du rtags 'dzin pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the apprehension of the one possessing the sign is the object of the one possessing the sign, so too is the apprehension of the sign.

original: 'on kyang gtso bo dang cig shos nyid de rtags can 'dzin pa na ni rtags can gtso bo nyid du rtogs la rtags 'dzin pa na ni rtags gtso bo nyid du yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bo dang cig shos nyid de rtags can 'dzin pa na ni rtags can gtso bo nyid du rtogs la rtags 'dzin pa na ni rtags gtso bo nyid du yin no //
translated: However, when the possessor of the reason is apprehended as the principal and the other, then the possessor of the reason is understood as the principal, and when the reason is apprehended, then the reason is the principal.

original: des na ji skad 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa yin pa de yang mi slu ba dang 'khrul par bstan pa'i skabs su rtags rtogs pa'i skabs de ci zhig yod na gang gis de yang dpyod par byed /
analyzed: des na ji skad 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa yin pa de yang mi slu ba dang 'khrul par bstan pa'i skabs su rtags rtogs pa'i skabs de ci zhig yod na gang gis de yang dpyod par byed /
translated: Therefore, when it is said here that inference is the cognition of the possessor of the reason, and that is taught to be non-deceptive and non-erroneous, what occasion is there for analyzing that?

original: ci ste de yang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de yang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that that is also of the nature of inference,

original: de lta na ni rtags can rtogs pa nyid yin pas so sor mi bstan to //
analyzed: de lta na ni rtags can rtogs pa nyid yin pas so sor mi bstan to //
translated: then since the cognition of the possessor of the reason is itself inference, it is not taught separately.

original: gal te rtags rtogs pa mngon sum gyi rang bzhin yin na yang de rtags snang bas stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rtags rtogs pa mngon sum gyi rang bzhin yin na yang de rtags snang bas stong pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if the cognition of the reason is of the nature of perception, it is not empty of the appearance of the reason.

original: rtags can snang bas stong pa nyid yin na yang 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags can snang bas stong pa nyid yin na yang 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if the appearance of the possessor of the reason is empty, it is not erroneous,

original: de ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not an object.

original: bum pa'i rnam pas stong bas ni ka ba'i shes pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i rnam pas stong bas ni ka ba'i shes pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de gsal ba yin te /
translated: But the cognition of a pillar is not mistaken because it is empty of the aspect of a pot.

original: rtags dang rtags can gyi blo dag gi yul ni gcig pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can gyi blo dag gi yul ni gcig pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: This is clear, because the object of the cognition of the sign and the object of the cognition of the sign-bearer are the same, and because it is not direct perception.

original: 'dir brjod pa /🔽gal te rtags 'brel de nyid du //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa / gal te rtags 'brel de nyid du //
translated: Here we say:🔽If the apprehension of the sign itself

original: 'dzin pa rtags kyi blo yin zhing //
analyzed: 'dzin pa rtags kyi blo yin zhing //
translated: is the cognition of the sign,

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyi 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyi 'brel pa ni //
translated: and the relation of the property to be proven

original: rjes su dpag pa las yin na //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las yin na //
translated: is known through inference,

original: de lta yin na zug med 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta yin na zug med 'gyur //
translated: then it would be pointless,

original: de la'ang rjes su dpag pa ni //
analyzed: de la'ang rjes su dpag pa ni //
translated: because the inference

original: gzhan zhig kho nas 'brel shes shing //
analyzed: gzhan zhig kho nas 'brel shes shing //
translated: would be known through another relation,

original: der yang de las gzhan gyis yin //🔽'on te rtags ni mngon sum gyis //
analyzed: der yang de las gzhan gyis yin // 'on te rtags ni mngon sum gyis //
translated: and that would also be through another.🔽But if the sign is cognized as a sign

original: rtags nyid du ni rtogs byed na //🔽de lta yin na der snang bas //
analyzed: rtags nyid du ni rtogs byed na // de lta yin na der snang bas //
translated: by direct perception,🔽then how could that appearance

original: stong pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: be emptiness?

original: ci ste du ba la sogs pa mngon sum gyis gzung yang de'i tshe rtags nyid du dran pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste du ba la sogs pa mngon sum gyis gzung yang de'i tshe rtags nyid du dran pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that although smoke and so on are perceived, at that time it is memory that is the logical reason,

original: de ltar na dran pa tshad ma ma yin pas de mi slu ba nyid du bstan pa la ci bya /
analyzed: de ltar na dran pa tshad ma ma yin pas de mi slu ba nyid du bstan pa la ci bya /
translated: then since memory is not a valid cognition, what is the point of teaching that it is nondeceptive?

original: de ni de la tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de la tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: It is not a valid cognition in regard to that.

original: tshad ma nyid kyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag kho na mi slu ba dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag kho na mi slu ba dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Only direct perception and inference are valid cognitions, because they are related to nondeceptiveness.

original: 'on te brgyud pas 'brel pa'i phyir dran pa yang tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brgyud pas 'brel pa'i phyir dran pa yang tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that memory is a valid cognition because it is related to that indirectly,

original: 'o na ni de nyid rtags can gyi shes pa dang rjes su dpag pa yin pas rtags dang rtags can gyi blo tha dad du bstan pas ci bya ste gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir de tshad ma ma yin par brjod @214a * //🔽do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de nyid rtags can gyi shes pa dang rjes su dpag pa yin pas rtags dang rtags can gyi blo tha dad du bstan pas ci bya ste gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir de tshad ma ma yin par brjod @214a * // do zhe na /
translated: then since it is a cognition that possesses a logical reason and is an inference, what is the point of teaching that the cognition that possesses a logical reason and the cognition that infers are different?🔽It is not a valid cognition because it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: de ltar gyur na sngar zhugs pa'i mngon sum nyid de la tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na sngar zhugs pa'i mngon sum nyid de la tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: If that were so, then direct perception that has already engaged its object would not be a valid cognition in regard to that object.

original: de yang der snang bas stong pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal lo //
analyzed: de yang der snang bas stong pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal lo //
translated: Moreover, it is not contradictory for something to appear as that and yet be empty of that, because it is not contradictory for something to be empty of a nature of being one or many and yet appear as one or many.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, we will explain this point differently.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las skyes pa'i rtags can gyi blo ni rtags kyi blo nyid de la don dam par rtags dang rtags can dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las skyes pa'i rtags can gyi blo ni rtags kyi blo nyid de la don dam par rtags dang rtags can dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition that is produced from a natural reason is a cognition of the reason, because ultimately the reason and the property-possessor are not different.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags kyi rtags can gyi blo'i yul ni rgyu yin pas der tha dad pa'i phyir de'i yul de rtags kyi blo ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags kyi rtags can gyi blo'i yul ni rgyu yin pas der tha dad pa'i phyir de'i yul de rtags kyi blo ma yin no //
translated: The object of the cognition that is the property-possessor of an effect reason is the cause, and because it is different from that, it is not the object of the cognition of the reason.

original: shin tu goms pa las du ba glo bur las rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i du ba'i blo las me'i blo mi skyed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las du ba glo bur las rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i du ba'i blo las me'i blo mi skyed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the cognition of fire is not produced from the cognition of smoke that apprehends the specific characteristics of smoke through complete familiarity with smoke and fire.

original: du ba de nyid du gzung ba kho na 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: du ba de nyid du gzung ba kho na 'brel pa yin la /
translated: It is the mere apprehension of that smoke that is the connection.

original: de nyid kyang ngo shes pa las ngo shes pa yang de'i rang bzhin mthong ba las rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang ngo shes pa las ngo shes pa yang de'i rang bzhin mthong ba las rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no //
translated: Moreover, that mere apprehension is inference from seeing the nature of that smoke.

original: shin tu goms pa las de'i rang bzhin mthong ba ni mngon sum tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las de'i rang bzhin mthong ba ni mngon sum tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: But when one has become very familiar with it, the seeing of its nature is the cause of the conventional direct perception, and therefore there is no infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa kho na rtags rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa kho na rtags rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of its own characteristic is the realization of the reason.

original: de'i me dang 'brel pa nyid gang yin pa de ni spyi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i me dang 'brel pa nyid gang yin pa de ni spyi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: And the mere connection of that with fire is the apprehension of the universal.

original: de'i rang bzhin mthong ba las skyes pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas gzhan du tha snyad mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin mthong ba las skyes pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas gzhan du tha snyad mi bya'o //
translated: But the nature of the cognition of the reason that arises from the seeing of its nature is the nature of inference, and therefore one should not make a convention with regard to anything else.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bya la //🔽khyab byed de yi ngo bo'am //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bya la // khyab byed de yi ngo bo'am //
translated: Therefore, the object to be realized🔽is either the nature of the pervader

original: rgyu dag khyab par bya sems kyi //
analyzed: rgyu dag khyab par bya sems kyi //
translated: or the cause of the pervader.

original: rgyu mtshan de yang de blo yin //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de yang de blo yin //
translated: And that reason is also the cognition of that.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te dngos po dang de dgag pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te dngos po dang de dgag pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of objects to be established: things and their negations.

original: dngos po bsgrub par bya ba la ni khyab par byed pa bsgrub bya yin la /
analyzed: dngos po bsgrub par bya ba la ni khyab par byed pa bsgrub bya yin la /
translated: In the establishment of a thing, the pervader is what is to be established.

original: de yang khyab par bya ba rtags kyi ngo bo'am rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yang khyab par bya ba rtags kyi ngo bo'am rgyu yin no //
translated: Moreover, the pervader is the nature or cause of the evidence.

original: gang gi phyir khyab par byed pa de khyab par bya ba'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyab par byed pa de khyab par bya ba'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: Because the pervader is the reason for the mind that is pervaded.

original: khyab par byed pa de yang khyab par bya ba rtags kyi ngo bo'am rgyu yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa de yang khyab par bya ba rtags kyi ngo bo'am rgyu yin no //
translated: And that pervader is the nature or cause of the evidence that is pervaded.

original: de yang khyab par byed pa'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan yin pas brgyud pas 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang khyab par byed pa'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan yin pas brgyud pas 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: And that is the reason for the mind that pervades. Therefore, because there is an indirect connection, it is a valid cognition.

original: mi dmigs pa ji ltar tshad ma yin pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ji ltar tshad ma yin pa ston pa ni /
translated: How non-observation is a valid cognition is shown:

original: dgag pa nyid ni thams cad du //
analyzed: dgag pa nyid ni thams cad du //
translated: All negations are established

original: mi dmigs pa las 'grub pa yin //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las 'grub pa yin //
translated: from non-observation.

original: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
analyzed: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
translated: For those who speak of establishment by valid cognition,

original: don gyis bzlog pa nyid las yin //
analyzed: don gyis bzlog pa nyid las yin //
translated: it is from the reversal of the object.

original: gang du dgag pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang du dgag pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Wherever it is said that a negation is established, all of that is only non-observation.

original: gang du dngos po sgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma 'jug pa der ni dngos po nyid grub kyang de dgag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du dngos po sgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma 'jug pa der ni dngos po nyid grub kyang de dgag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When a valid cognition is engaged in order to establish an entity, then the entity itself is established, but not its negation.

original: des na bzlog pa nyid kyis dgag pa bsgrub bo //
analyzed: des na bzlog pa nyid kyis dgag pa bsgrub bo //
translated: Therefore, the negation is established by the very reversal of that.

original: 'di ltar dmigs par rigs pa ma dmigs pa na med do @214b zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs par rigs pa ma dmigs pa na med do @214b zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when a non-apprehension of what is possible to apprehend is found, one says, “It does not exist.”

original: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid dgag pa yin pas de'i bdag nyid kho nas 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid dgag pa yin pas de'i bdag nyid kho nas 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Since non-apprehension itself is a negation, it is related to that mere object, and thus it is related to the object by its own nature.

original: 'gal ba yang dngos sam brgyud pas 'brel pas de las kyang dngos po dgag pa grub pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang dngos sam brgyud pas 'brel pas de las kyang dngos po dgag pa grub pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not seen that a negation of an entity is established from a contradiction, whether it is related directly or indirectly?

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, “Here there is no cold touch because there is fire.”

original: 'di la spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dag med de gdung bar byed pa'i phyir bye brag nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'di la spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dag med de gdung bar byed pa'i phyir bye brag nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
translated: Or, “Here there is no goose-flesh, etc., because there is burning,” because the particular is near.

original: de ji ltar mi dmigs pas sgrub bo zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi dmigs pas sgrub bo zhe na /
translated: How is that non-apprehension established?

original: 'di la lan /
analyzed: 'di la lan /
translated: The reply to that is:🔽That is not so.

original: de ni ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni ma yin na /
translated: But rather,🔽That which is seen to state the contradiction

original: 'on kyang / 'gags la de'ang de rgyu dang // 'gal ba brjod pa mthong gang yin //
analyzed: 'on kyang / 'gags la de'ang de rgyu dang // 'gal ba brjod pa mthong gang yin //
translated: Of the ceased and that cause,

original: de yang de yi tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: de yang de yi tshad ma nyid //
translated: That is itself the valid cognition

original: med pa ston par byed pa yin //
analyzed: med pa ston par byed pa yin //
translated: That demonstrates the non-existence.

original: 'gal ba'i don ni de med pa go bar byed pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don ni de med pa go bar byed pa yin na yang /
translated: Even if the meaning of contradiction is to make one understand the non-existence,

original: 'gal ba'i 'brel pa nyid las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'brel pa nyid las ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not due to the connection of contradiction itself.

original: 'gal ba ni 'jal bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni 'jal bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Contradiction is not what is intended to be measured.

original: med pa'i tshul du 'jal bar 'dod pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa'i tshul du 'jal bar 'dod pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is intended to be measured in the manner of non-existence, then it exists.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ni med pa nyid dang 'brel pa nges par bya ba yin na ni de dang lhan cig 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ni med pa nyid dang 'brel pa nges par bya ba yin na ni de dang lhan cig 'gal ba med do //
translated: If it is intended to ascertain the connection with non-existence itself, then there is no contradiction with that.

original: gang na de yod pa der med par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang na de yod pa der med par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Where there is that, there would be non-existence.

original: de ga las de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ga las de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is seen that way because it is seen that way,

original: ci med pa de 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus su dngos por dmigs sam /
analyzed: ci med pa de 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus su dngos por dmigs sam /
translated: is that non-existence, at the time of apprehending contradiction, observed as an existent thing?

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If not,🔽then how is it that it is seen?

original: gal te dmigs na ji ltar med pa yin te ma dmigs na ni mi dmigs pa kho na las dgag pa 'grub bo zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gal te dmigs na ji ltar med pa yin te ma dmigs na ni mi dmigs pa kho na las dgag pa 'grub bo zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: If it is observed, how can it be nonexistent? If it is not observed, then the negation is established by nonobservation alone.

original: gzhan du dngos gcig yod brjod pas //
analyzed: gzhan du dngos gcig yod brjod pas //
translated: If you say that one thing exists,

original: gzhan med de ni gang las rtogs //
analyzed: gzhan med de ni gang las rtogs //
translated: how do you know that another does not?

original: 'gal phyir zhe na de nyid kyang //
analyzed: 'gal phyir zhe na de nyid kyang //
translated: If you say that it is because they are contradictory,🔽how is that established?

original: cis grub lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: cis grub lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
translated: If you say that it is because they do not coexist,

original: zhe na de ni ga las 'dod //
analyzed: zhe na de ni ga las 'dod //
translated: how do you know that?

original: snang ba mthong med phyir zhe na //
analyzed: snang ba mthong med phyir zhe na //
translated: If you say that it is because the appearance is not seen,

original: de ni tshad ma nyid ma yin //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma nyid ma yin //
translated: that is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te gcig yod pas gzhan med na thams cad yod na gzhan 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gcig yod pas gzhan med na thams cad yod na gzhan 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thing exists, another does not exist. If everything exists, the negation of another is established.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa med par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa med par mi rtogs so //
translated: The contradiction of the characteristic of not coexisting is not understood without nonobservation.

original: gal te de lta na mi dmigs pas 'gal bar rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mi dmigs pas 'gal bar rtogs pa yin la /
translated: If that is so, the contradiction is understood by nonobservation.

original: 'gal ba'i rtags de las med pa rtogs pa yin gyi mi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rtags de las med pa rtogs pa yin gyi mi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The nonexistence that is inferred from that contradictory reason is understood, but not by nonobservation.

original: ci ste 'gal ba sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa sngon byung ba de'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i rtags las kyang dngos po med pa rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste 'gal ba sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa sngon byung ba de'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i rtags las kyang dngos po med pa rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that the non-observation of something contradictory to the object of affirmation is the prior non-observation of something contradictory to the object of affirmation, and that the non-existence of the object of affirmation is understood from the evidence of the contradiction,

original: de nyid don dam par med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid don dam par med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then that very non-observation of something contradictory to the object of affirmation is the proof of the non-existence of the object of affirmation in reality.

original: gal te de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni /
translated: If that were so,

original: 'brel pa grub phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa grub phyir /
translated: then because the relation is established,

original: grang ba med pa ni dro ba la gang yin des //
analyzed: grang ba med pa ni dro ba la gang yin des //
translated: the absence of cold is hot.

original: gal te bsgrub @215a * //🔽bya bsgrub 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub @215a * // bya bsgrub 'gyur na //
translated: If the object of affirmation is established,

original: rjes dpag tshad ma ji ltar 'gyur //🔽rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa ni //🔽'dzin pa mngon sum la brten yin /
analyzed: rjes dpag tshad ma ji ltar 'gyur // rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa ni // 'dzin pa mngon sum la brten yin /
translated: how could there be valid inference?🔽The relation of inference🔽depends on the perception that apprehends it.

original: bsgrub bya grub pa'ang de nyid las //
analyzed: bsgrub bya grub pa'ang de nyid las //
translated: And because the establishment of the object of affirmation

original: yin phyir rjes dpag tshad ma min //
analyzed: yin phyir rjes dpag tshad ma min //
translated: depends on that, inference is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum de nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba med grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma gzhan du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum de nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba med grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma gzhan du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the perception that apprehends the relation of inference depends on the establishment of the object of affirmation, how could inference be a valid means of knowledge?

original: ci ste lkog tu gyur pa'i me la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir der rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste lkog tu gyur pa'i me la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir der rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that inference is applied to that fire which is hidden from view because direct perception does not apply to it,

original: lkog tu gyur pa med pa la yang mi dmigs pa ji ltar 'jug /'jug pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa med pa la yang mi dmigs pa ji ltar 'jug /'jug pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then how can non-apprehension apply to what is non-existent and hidden from view? And if it does apply, then it is not non-apprehension which has the characteristic of apprehension.

original: ci ste dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa dran pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa dran pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that non-apprehension which has the characteristic of apprehension is memory,

original: de'i 'di yang gzhung lugs ngan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'di yang gzhung lugs ngan pa yin te /
translated: then this is also a bad theory.

original: gang phyir rjes su dpag pa la'ang //
analyzed: gang phyir rjes su dpag pa la'ang //
translated: Because in inference too

original: mngon sum dran pa med min pas //
analyzed: mngon sum dran pa med min pas //
translated: there is no absence of memory of direct perception.

original: der yang mngon sum 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: der yang mngon sum 'ba' zhig ni //
translated: So in that case too,

original: tshad 'gyur rjes dpag don med do //
analyzed: tshad 'gyur rjes dpag don med do //
translated: only direct perception is valid, and inference is meaningless.

original: de'i phyir 'di la de kho na nyid can gyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la de kho na nyid can gyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of reality:

original: me la grang ba med par ni //
analyzed: me la grang ba med par ni //
translated: That cold is absent in fire

original: sngar ni dmigs pa la brten pa //🔽des ni de yi 'brel grub pas //
analyzed: sngar ni dmigs pa la brten pa // des ni de yi 'brel grub pas //
translated: is established by the prior apprehension🔽of heat, which is related to it.

original: de med par ni sgrub pa yin //
analyzed: de med par ni sgrub pa yin //
translated: So it is established that cold is absent there.

original: med pa de yang mi dmigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: med pa de yang mi dmigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: And this non-existence is just non-apprehension.

original: des na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, non-apprehension established by inference establishes the expression “non-existence.”

original: dper na mngon sum gyis grub pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na mngon sum gyis grub pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like what is established by perception.

original: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni mngon sum rang nyid las grub pa yin zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba ltar 'dir yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs so zhes khong du chud par bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni mngon sum rang nyid las grub pa yin zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba ltar 'dir yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs so zhes khong du chud par bya'o // gang gi tshe /
translated: Thus, this non-apprehension is established by perception itself.

original: spu langs pa med pa sgrub pa de'i tshe mes grang ba mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: spu langs pa med pa sgrub pa de'i tshe mes grang ba mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: When one establishes the absence of horripilation, at that time one does not apprehend cold by fire.

original: de mi dmigs pa de ni spu langs pa med pa yin no ;
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa de ni spu langs pa med pa yin no ;
translated: And this non-apprehension is the absence of horripilation.

original: / tshogs pa gcig la rag las ba me'i gzugs kyis ni dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: / tshogs pa gcig la rag las ba me'i gzugs kyis ni dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa dpog pa yin no //
translated: The form of fire, which is dependent on the same collection, infers the nature of heat.

original: de yang grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de yang grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: And that is the absence of cold.

original: rjes su dpag pas de ni dmigs pa nyid ni grang ba mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas de ni dmigs pa nyid ni grang ba mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: By inference, that is apprehended as the non-apprehension of cold.

original: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa gnyis gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir 'gal ba ni rtags gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa gnyis gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir 'gal ba ni rtags gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the reason of effect and the non-apprehension of cause are both engaged in one, there is no contradiction.

original: des na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, non-apprehension, which is established by inference, is the cause of understanding non-existence.

original: de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is an inference of an inference.

original: gal te de lta na ni rjes su dpag pas mngon sum sgrub cing /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni rjes su dpag pas mngon sum sgrub cing /
translated: If that is so, then inference establishes direct perception,

original: des dngos po yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des dngos po yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and since that is an existent entity,

original: rjes su dpag pa dngos @215b po'i yul can gyi tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dngos @215b po'i yul can gyi tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: inference is not a valid cognition that has an existent entity as its object.

original: de yang gyi na ste /
analyzed: de yang gyi na ste /
translated: That is not a fault.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum nyid dmigs pa'i yod pa yin pa'i phyir te des na rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum nyid dmigs pa'i yod pa yin pa'i phyir te des na rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can yin no //
translated: In this way, direct perception, which has the nature of apprehension, is the existence of apprehension, and therefore inference has an existent entity as its object.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Non-apprehension is non-existence.

original: yin mod ci skyon /
analyzed: yin mod ci skyon /
translated: What is the fault if that is so?

original: mes med par grub kyi mi dmigs pas ma yin pa'i phyir skyon che'o zhe na /
analyzed: mes med par grub kyi mi dmigs pas ma yin pa'i phyir skyon che'o zhe na /
translated: But it is a great error to think that fire is established as the absence of cold by non-apprehension, and not by the absence of fuel.

original: me nyid grang ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: me nyid grang ba med pa yin no //
translated: Fire itself is not cold.

original: de'i phyir de nyid de nyid kyis sgrub par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid de nyid kyis sgrub par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how can it be established by itself?

original: dro bas yul ci tsam khyab pa de tsam du grang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dro bas yul ci tsam khyab pa de tsam du grang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: To the extent that heat pervades, to that extent cold is absent.

original: grang ba med pa ni dro ba las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: grang ba med pa ni dro ba las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The absence of cold is not different from heat.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
translated: This is an inference from nature.

original: mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension is accepted as an inference from nature.

original: des na 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su bstan to //
analyzed: des na 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this is taught as an inference from effect and inference from nature: “Cold touch does not exist there because fire exists.”

original: de phyir rang sgras brjod na yang //
analyzed: de phyir rang sgras brjod na yang //
translated: Therefore, even when expressed by its own word,

original: de nyid med pa'i sgrub byed yin //
analyzed: de nyid med pa'i sgrub byed yin //
translated: it is a proof of the absence of that.

original: gang la de ni tshad min des //
analyzed: gang la de ni tshad min des //
translated: By that which is not a valid means of knowledge regarding that,

original: dgag pa rnam kun brjod bya min //
analyzed: dgag pa rnam kun brjod bya min //
translated: negation is not expressed in any way.

original: me la sogs pa 'gal ba gang zhig rang gi rgyus brjod pa bstan kyang /
analyzed: me la sogs pa 'gal ba gang zhig rang gi rgyus brjod pa bstan kyang /
translated: Although fire and so on are taught to be the cause of the expression of the contradictory,

original: gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa de nyid med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa de nyid med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: non-apprehension, which is the definition of the existence of another, is what establishes the non-existence of that.

original: gang la des tshad ma ma yin pa des ni 'gal ba yod pa la dgag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la des tshad ma ma yin pa des ni 'gal ba yod pa la dgag par mi bya'o //
translated: If that is not a valid means of knowledge, then one should not negate the existence of the contradictory.

original: dgag pa la ni rnam pa gzhan yang srid pa ma yin no //🔽des ni de dang 'gal don gyi //
analyzed: dgag pa la ni rnam pa gzhan yang srid pa ma yin no // des ni de dang 'gal don gyi //
translated: And in negation, another aspect is not possible.🔽By that, the effect of the object that is contradictory with that

original: 'bras bu brjod pa bshad pa yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod pa bshad pa yin //
translated: is said to be expressed.

original: thams cad du ni sbyor nyid du //
analyzed: thams cad du ni sbyor nyid du //
translated: In all cases, it is just the connection

original: tha dad don la tha dad med //
analyzed: tha dad don la tha dad med //
translated: that is non-different from the different objects.

original: dgag par bya ba gang ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba me la sogs pa'i don gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de la yang rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pas tha snyad las dngos po med par sgrub par byed pa yin
analyzed: dgag par bya ba gang ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba me la sogs pa'i don gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de la yang rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pas tha snyad las dngos po med par sgrub par byed pa yin
translated: The effect of the object that is contradictory with the object of negation, such as smoke and so on, is also established as a non-thing from the perspective of convention by the non-apprehension that is established by inference through inference.

original: no // 'di ltar /
analyzed: no // 'di ltar /
translated: In this way,

original: 'bras gyur du bas me grub cing /
analyzed: 'bras gyur du bas me grub cing /
translated: fire is established by smoke as its effect.

original: grang med sngar bshad tshul gyis bsgrub //
analyzed: grang med sngar bshad tshul gyis bsgrub //
translated: The absence of cold is established by the previously explained method.

original: gzhan du grang med me 'grub pas //
analyzed: gzhan du grang med me 'grub pas //
translated: But elsewhere, fire is established as not cold.

original: der yang brgyud nas med par 'gyur //
analyzed: der yang brgyud nas med par 'gyur //
translated: So, in that case, it would indirectly become nonexistent.

original: du ba las ni me yin la /
analyzed: du ba las ni me yin la /
translated: Fire is from smoke,

original: grang ba'i reg pa med pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa las bzlog pa'i me las ni grang ba med pa'i tha snyad yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa med pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa las bzlog pa'i me las ni grang ba med pa'i tha snyad yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the absence of cold is the opposite of the observed nature of fire, because it is the convention of the absence of cold.

original: des na sbyor ba dgod pa'i tshul 'ba' zhig tha dad do //
analyzed: des na sbyor ba dgod pa'i tshul 'ba' zhig tha dad do //
translated: Therefore, only the method of positing the syllogism is different.

original: 'gal dang de ni thabs bcas pa //
analyzed: 'gal dang de ni thabs bcas pa //
translated: The contradiction and its method

original: bsgrubs dang bkag pa med par ni //
analyzed: bsgrubs dang bkag pa med par ni //
translated: are not established without negation.

original: dgag la tshad smra gang yin de //
analyzed: dgag la tshad smra gang yin de //
translated: Those who speak of valid cognition in negation

original: rigs pa'i rjes 'brang can min te //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes 'brang can min te //
translated: are not followers of reasoning.

original: smra la sogs pas kun mkhyen dang // 'jig rten gzhan sogs med bsgrub bzhin //
analyzed: smra la sogs pas kun mkhyen dang // 'jig rten gzhan sogs med bsgrub bzhin //
translated: Like the establishment of omniscience and other worlds by speech and so on,

original: dbang po las 'das don rnams dang// @216a * //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das don rnams dang// @216a * //
translated: the objects beyond the senses

original: 'gal ba grub pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba grub pa med phyir ro //
translated: are not established as contradictory.

original: smra ba ni thams cad shes pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba ni thams cad shes pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Speech is not contradictory to omniscience.

original: dbang po las 'das pa dang ni lhan cig 'gal ba mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa dang ni lhan cig 'gal ba mi 'grub bo //
translated: It is contradictory to establish that which is beyond the senses as simultaneous.

original: tshig ni shes pa nyid las 'jug pa yin na de med par sgrub par ci ltar byed /
analyzed: tshig ni shes pa nyid las 'jug pa yin na de med par sgrub par ci ltar byed /
translated: If the word is the activity of consciousness itself, how can you establish its nonexistence?

original: thams cad shes pa nyid dang ni 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid dang ni 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: It is contradictory to omniscience.

original: gang gis 'gal bar 'dzin /
analyzed: gang gis 'gal bar 'dzin /
translated: By what means is it apprehended as contradictory?

original: gal te shes pa khyad par dang 'phel ba'i rjes su 'gro ba smra ba nyid 'grib par mthong na thams cad legs par 'gyur te thams cad shes pa la smra ba nyid thams cad med pa kho nar 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te shes pa khyad par dang 'phel ba'i rjes su 'gro ba smra ba nyid 'grib par mthong na thams cad legs par 'gyur te thams cad shes pa la smra ba nyid thams cad med pa kho nar 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the word is seen to diminish as consciousness increases, then everything is all right, for the word would be completely absent in omniscience. But that is not the case.

original: gal te smra ba po ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par dmigs so zhe na /🔽smra ba po rmongs par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te smra ba po ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par dmigs so zhe na / smra ba po rmongs par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the speaker is seen to be not omniscient,

original: thams cad rmongs par ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad rmongs par ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: then why is not the hearer also seen to be not omniscient, since he is seen to be confused?

original: smra ba po mkhas pas mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: smra ba po mkhas pas mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the speaker is seen to be learned,

original: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: de yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: then why is not the hearer also seen to be learned, since he is seen to be not confused?

original: 'di ltar / gal te smra po rigs yin na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te smra po rigs yin na //
translated: Thus, if the speaker is a Brahmin,

original: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo gang //
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo gang //
translated: what is the nature of the one who is harmed and the one who harms?

original: de 'dra mi dmigs phyir zhe na //
analyzed: de 'dra mi dmigs phyir zhe na //
translated: If you say it is because of the non-apprehension of such a nature,

original: de nyid sgrub byed yin par 'dod//
analyzed: de nyid sgrub byed yin par 'dod//
translated: that itself is accepted as the proof.

original: dper na rmongs pa smra ba ni //
analyzed: dper na rmongs pa smra ba ni //
translated: For example, when the ignorant speak,

original: mkhas pa'i dus su de med kyang /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dus su de med kyang /
translated: even in the time of the wise,

original: khyad par dang bcas te smra ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas te smra ba de bzhin du /
translated: they speak with distinction.

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas skabs su yang 'gyur na ci 'gal /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas skabs su yang 'gyur na ci 'gal /
translated: Similarly, if it were to occur in the state of omniscience, what contradiction would there be?

original: tshig ni shes pa phul du byung ba dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig ni shes pa phul du byung ba dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: The words are not contradictory to the highest knowledge.

original: shin tu phul du byung bar 'dogs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu phul du byung bar 'dogs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say it contradicts the designation as the highest,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: no, it does not.

original: 'gal ba 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no apprehension of contradiction.

original: de lta bu'i smra ba po la dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni lan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i smra ba po la dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni lan du mi rung ste /
translated: To say it is only observed in such a speaker is not a proper response.

original: mi dmigs pa ni snang ba'i yul tsam nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni snang ba'i yul tsam nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension is understood merely by the appearance of the object.

original: mi dmigs pa ni de lta bu //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni de lta bu //
translated: Non-apprehension is like that.

original: nges 'byed min par rab tu brjod //
analyzed: nges 'byed min par rab tu brjod //
translated: It is well-known as not being a factor of definite discrimination.

original: de phyir shin tu lkog tu gyur la //
analyzed: de phyir shin tu lkog tu gyur la //
translated: Therefore, it is extremely hidden.🔽

original: yod med nges pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: yod med nges pa yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to ascertain existence or nonexistence with regard to what is extremely obscure.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'jig rten pha rol med pa la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa ni mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'jig rten pha rol med pa la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa ni mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the mere nonapprehension of what is extremely obscure, such as omniscience and the world beyond, it is not possible to ascertain their nonexistence.

original: 'on te yang thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul pa dang bral ba tshig ga las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on te yang thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul pa dang bral ba tshig ga las 'byung ste /
translated: But how could an omniscient being, who is free from error, come into existence?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma ste brjod par 'dod pa'i 'khrul pa skyes na ni tshig la 'jug par byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma ste brjod par 'dod pa'i 'khrul pa skyes na ni tshig la 'jug par byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If the error of the one who wishes to speak arises, either previously or subsequently, then he would engage in speech.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /🔽don kun gsal ba nyid du ni //
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te / don kun gsal ba nyid du ni //
translated: But that is not correct.🔽Even though he knows all objects clearly,

original: shes kyang brjod 'dod 'jug 'gyur te //
analyzed: shes kyang brjod 'dod 'jug 'gyur te //
translated: he would engage in speech because of the desire to speak.

original: goms phyir de la brjod pa ni //
analyzed: goms phyir de la brjod pa ni //
translated: But because of habituation, he would speak

original: gang las med par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: gang las med par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: from which there would be no nonexistence.

original: bsgoms pa la brten nas don dpag tu med par shin tu gsal bar mthong ba dang dus mnyam par goms pa las brjod par 'dod pa mi 'byung @216b ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa la brten nas don dpag tu med par shin tu gsal bar mthong ba dang dus mnyam par goms pa las brjod par 'dod pa mi 'byung @216b ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that the desire to speak does not occur simultaneously with the very clear perception of the limitless meaning that is based on meditation.

original: brjod par 'dod pa med kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa las tshig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa med kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa las tshig 'byung ngo //
translated: Even without the desire to speak, the words come forth from the impetus of the past.

original: nye bar gnas pa'i brjod par 'dod pa nyid ni tshig gi rgyu ma yin te yid gzhan du yengs kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa las tshigs dang ngag ma 'dres par 'don par mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar goms par bya ba du ma rtsom pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa'i brjod par 'dod pa nyid ni tshig gi rgyu ma yin te yid gzhan du yengs kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa las tshigs dang ngag ma 'dres par 'don par mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar goms par bya ba du ma rtsom pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The desire to speak that is present does not cause the words, because we see that the words and speech come forth from the impetus of the past, even when the mind is distracted elsewhere, and because we see that many things that were previously practiced are begun without any desire to speak.

original: 'dis ni snga ma dang phyi mar 'dzin pa med kyang rtogs pa po nye bar gnas pa la ji ltar brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni snga ma dang phyi mar 'dzin pa med kyang rtogs pa po nye bar gnas pa la ji ltar brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang gsal ba yin te /
translated: This also clarifies the point that even without the apprehension of the prior and subsequent parts, the speaker is still present when the understanding occurs.

original: dgra ni nye ba rtsom nyid las //
analyzed: dgra ni nye ba rtsom nyid las //
translated: The enemy is begun just by being present.

original: rtogs pa med par dang po nyid //
analyzed: rtogs pa med par dang po nyid //
translated: Without understanding, in the beginning.

original: khro ba yis ni kun bslang ba //
analyzed: khro ba yis ni kun bslang ba //
translated: Anger is the cause of all of them.

original: de bzlog pa la 'jug par rtsom //🔽dper na sngar goms pa las /
analyzed: de bzlog pa la 'jug par rtsom // dper na sngar goms pa las /
translated: I will explain the method for overcoming it.

original: gnyid sad ma thag tu mtshon 'byin pa la sogs pa dag la brdeg pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid rtsom pa /
analyzed: gnyid sad ma thag tu mtshon 'byin pa la sogs pa dag la brdeg pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid rtsom pa /
translated: For example, immediately upon awakening from sleep, a person who is accustomed to drawing a bow will begin to draw it even though he is not conscious of any enemy.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yang thams cad mdzad pas mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yang thams cad mdzad pas mi 'gal lo //
translated: In the same way, the Omniscient One, who is accustomed to acting for the benefit of all sentient beings, will begin to act for their benefit even though he is not conscious of any sentient being.🔽Therefore, the Omniscient One acts for the benefit of sentient beings without contradiction.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba nyid las 'gal ba med par nges pa yin no //🔽'gal te chos ni tha dad dam //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba nyid las 'gal ba med par nges pa yin no // 'gal te chos ni tha dad dam //
translated: Thus, the absence of contradiction is established on the basis of contradiction.🔽If there is contradiction, it is either between two different things

original: tha dad med la rab sbyor te //🔽kha ba med par bsgrub pa la //
analyzed: tha dad med la rab sbyor te // kha ba med par bsgrub pa la //
translated: or between two non-different things.

original: me dang skye la yod gnod bzhin //
analyzed: me dang skye la yod gnod bzhin //
translated: Just as heat and cold are contradictory,🔽because they are mutually exclusive,🔽existence and arising are contradictory,🔽because they are mutually exclusive.

original: grang ba dang dro ba dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Heat and cold are contradictory because they are mutually exclusive, i.e., they cannot occur together.

original: yod pa dang skye ba dag ni phan tshun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang skye ba dag ni phan tshun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Existence and arising are contradictory because they are mutually exclusive, i.e., they are not non-different.

original: skye ba ni yod pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni yod pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa la yang yin no //
translated: But it is not different from existence.

original: yod pa nyid ni skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Existence is not origination,

original: cha med par thams cad yod pa ni skye ba don med do //
analyzed: cha med par thams cad yod pa ni skye ba don med do //
translated: because if everything exists without distinction, origination is meaningless.

original: tha dad pa med pa dag phan tshun 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa dag phan tshun 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can non-difference and mutual exclusion be contradictory?

original: gzhan gyis tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: We say this because others accept non-difference.

original: gal te 'gal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zlog par byed pa dang bzlog par bya ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na zlog par byed pa dang bzlog par bya ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: If you ask, “What is this so-called contradiction?” it is the nature of the reversal and what is to be reversed.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / ma tshang med rgyu can gcig de las gzhan //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ma tshang med rgyu can gcig de las gzhan //
translated: If the cause is not incomplete,

original: yod na gang tshe 'byung ba med 'gyur ba //
analyzed: yod na gang tshe 'byung ba med 'gyur ba //
translated: then when it exists, origination is not tenable.

original: de gnyis 'gal ba nyid ni yin pa de //
analyzed: de gnyis 'gal ba nyid ni yin pa de //
translated: These two are contradictory,

original: me dang grang ba'i bdag nyid ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: me dang grang ba'i bdag nyid ma mthong ngo //
translated: like the nature of fire and cold.

original: gal te gzhan gyis gzhan med par byed pa de mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis gzhan med par byed pa de mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that it is not untenable for one thing to make another nonexistent,

original: med pa la ni 'bras bu nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa la ni 'bras bu nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not so, because an effect does not exist in a nonexistent cause.

original: de ste mi byed na ni de'i tshe rang nyid 'jig pas gzhan dang 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: de ste mi byed na ni de'i tshe rang nyid 'jig pas gzhan dang 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: If it does not do so, then at that time it would be destroyed itself. What contradiction is there with another?

original: skad cig ni gzhan gyis 'jig par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ni gzhan gyis 'jig par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A moment is not destroyed by another,

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag las mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag las mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable in the context of either that which has arisen or that which has not arisen.

original: ma skyes pa ni med pas gang zhig 'gal ba'am 'jig pa yin /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni med pas gang zhig 'gal ba'am 'jig pa yin /
translated: That which has not arisen does not exist. What is it that is contradictory or destroyed?

original: skyes pa yang rang gi dus su 'jig par mi nus te /🔽skad cig la 'gyur ba @217a * //
analyzed: skyes pa yang rang gi dus su 'jig par mi nus te / skad cig la 'gyur ba @217a * //
translated: That which has arisen cannot be destroyed at its own time,

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no change in a moment.

original: gzhan gyi dus su ni de nyid med pas gang zhig 'jig pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus su ni de nyid med pas gang zhig 'jig pa yin /
translated: At another time, it does not exist. What is it that is destroyed?

original: rgyun 'jig go zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun 'jig go zhe na /
translated: If you say that the continuum is destroyed,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: de las tha dad pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no continuum that is different from it.

original: gal te phyi ma'i skad cig ma brgyud mar 'byung ba gegs byas pa gang yin pa de nyid rgyun 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi ma'i skad cig ma brgyud mar 'byung ba gegs byas pa gang yin pa de nyid rgyun 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the destruction of the continuum is the prevention of the arising of the subsequent moments of the continuum,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: that is not correct,

original: gal te rgyu yod gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te rgyu yod gyur na ni //
translated: because if the cause exists,

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar gegs byed 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar gegs byed 'gyur //
translated: how could another prevent it?

original: de ste rgyu ni med na yang //
analyzed: de ste rgyu ni med na yang //
translated: But if it has no cause,

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar gegs byed 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar gegs byed 'gyur //
translated: How could it obstruct another?

original: gal te phyi ma'i skad cig phyi ma skye ba la rgyu yod na ji ltar gegs byed /
analyzed: gal te phyi ma'i skad cig phyi ma skye ba la rgyu yod na ji ltar gegs byed /
translated: If the later moment has a cause for the arising of the later moment, how could it obstruct another?

original: de ste rgyu med na rang nyid 'gyur bas bya ci dgos /
analyzed: de ste rgyu med na rang nyid 'gyur bas bya ci dgos /
translated: But if it has no cause, it would arise by itself, so what need is there for it to obstruct another?

original: ci ste 'gal bas rgyu ma tshang ba nyid byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'gal bas rgyu ma tshang ba nyid byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it obstructs because the cause is incomplete due to the presence of an opposing factor,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽gal te med pa ma tshang bar //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / gal te med pa ma tshang bar //
translated: Because:🔽If the incomplete causes

original: byed na don med 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: byed na don med 'gyur ba yin //
translated: The nonexistent, it would be purposeless.

original: rang gi ngo bos yong pa yang //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos yong pa yang //
translated: And if it is complete by its very essence,

original: ma tshang bar ni ji ltar byed //
analyzed: ma tshang bar ni ji ltar byed //
translated: How could it make the incomplete?

original: gal te de la ma tshang med //
analyzed: gal te de la ma tshang med //
translated: If it is not incomplete,

original: rgyu yod ci ste de med 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu yod ci ste de med 'gyur //
translated: Why would the cause not exist?

original: 'on te ma tshang med byed med //
analyzed: 'on te ma tshang med byed med //
translated: But if it is not incomplete, it would not make.

original: de ni rang nyid ma tshang 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid ma tshang 'gyur //
translated: It would be incomplete by itself.

original: ma tshang med rgyu yod na ni //
analyzed: ma tshang med rgyu yod na ni //
translated: If the incomplete cause exists,

original: rgyu yang ma tshang bar byed mi nus la /
analyzed: rgyu yang ma tshang bar byed mi nus la /
translated: the cause would not be able to make the incomplete.

original: de'i rgyu med na ni rang nyid ma tshang bar 'gyur bas de la 'gal bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu med na ni rang nyid ma tshang bar 'gyur bas de la 'gal bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it does not have a cause, then it would be incomplete. What would be the contradiction in that?

original: 'di la lan ni /🔽mes ni lhan cig byed med pa'i //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni / mes ni lhan cig byed med pa'i //
translated: The answer to that is:🔽Fire does not generate another cold

original: grang bas grang ba gzhan skyed 'gyur //
analyzed: grang bas grang ba gzhan skyed 'gyur //
translated: due to the absence of a simultaneous cause.

original: lhan cig byed dang phrad na ni //
analyzed: lhan cig byed dang phrad na ni //
translated: When it encounters a simultaneous cause,

original: de ni grang ba'i rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: de ni grang ba'i rgyu ma yin //
translated: it is not a cause of cold.🔽The previous cold contact does not generate another cold, more and more cold, etc., because the simultaneous cause of fire is near.🔽It is not the case that the previous cold contact generates another cold,

original: de ni grang ba'i reg pa snga ma ni me'i lhan cig byed pa nye ba'i phyir gzhan pa dang ches gzhan pa la sogs pa'i grang ba'i reg pa skyed par byed pa nas ji srid du grang ba'i reg pa grang ba gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin🔽pa'i bar du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni grang ba'i reg pa snga ma ni me'i lhan cig byed pa nye ba'i phyir gzhan pa dang ches gzhan pa la sogs pa'i grang ba'i reg pa skyed par byed pa nas ji srid du grang ba'i reg pa grang ba gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin🔽pa'i bar du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: up to the point where it generates a cold that generates another cold.

original: de rang nyid ldog pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis grang ba'i rgyu nus pa med pa skyed nas rgyu med pas gzhan yang mi skye ba'i phyir na ma ni grang ba bzlog par byed par yin no zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de rang nyid ldog pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis grang ba'i rgyu nus pa med pa skyed nas rgyu med pas gzhan yang mi skye ba'i phyir na ma ni grang ba bzlog par byed par yin no zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it stops itself and because it generates the cause of cold that is not a cause of heat through its own function, and because another is not generated in the absence of a cause, it is said conventionally that fire stops cold.

original: de byas pa de'i rgyu ma tshang ba skye ba'i phyir de'i snga na med pa'i mtshan nyid de las skye ba med pa nyid ni ldog pa yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de byas pa de'i rgyu ma tshang ba skye ba'i phyir de'i snga na med pa'i mtshan nyid de las skye ba med pa nyid ni ldog pa yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Because the cause of that is incomplete, it is said conventionally that the nonexistence of that prior to it is its arising from that, and that its nonarising is its stopping.

original: rgyu'i byed pa ni skye ba la 'jug pa yin gyi ldog pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa ni skye ba la 'jug pa yin gyi ldog pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The function of a cause is to make something arise, not to make it stop.

original: yang na grang ba'i rang bzhin 'di ni rang gi rgyu las nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na grang ba'i rang bzhin 'di ni rang gi rgyu las nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, the nature of cold is definite from its own cause.

original: gang gis me nye na rang gi 'bras bu grang ba'i skad cig gzhan mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis me nye na rang gi 'bras bu grang ba'i skad cig gzhan mi skye ba ste /
translated: When fire is nearby, another moment of cold does not arise from it.

original: dngos po rnams kyis nus pa ni so song nges pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis nus pa ni so song nges pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the potency of things is individually ascertained.

original: 'gal bas gnyis gzhi gcig la ji ltar 'tshog ce na /
analyzed: 'gal bas gnyis gzhi gcig la ji ltar 'tshog ce na /
translated: How can two contradictory things be combined in one basis?

original: de ltar yin pa nyid @217b kyis 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin pa nyid @217b kyis 'gal ba yin te /
translated: They are contradictory because they are not so.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that they are other.

original: skad cig gnyis ni 'gal ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyun gnyis so //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis ni 'gal ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyun gnyis so //
translated: Two moments are not contradictory, but rather two continuities.

original: me nyams su myong yang da rung grang ba dang ma bral lo zhes rigs pa 'di ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: me nyams su myong yang da rung grang ba dang ma bral lo zhes rigs pa 'di ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: This is seen in the case of the statement, “Although I experience fire, I am not yet free from cold.”

original: mun pa shin tu dangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mun pa shin tu dangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same in the case of the statement, “The darkness is not very clear.”

original: shin tu gsal ba'i snang ba yod na skad cig de nyid la med par 'gyur ro zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i snang ba yod na skad cig de nyid la med par 'gyur ro zhen ma yin te /
translated: If there is very clear light, it is not the case that darkness does not exist at that moment.

original: de la yang de dang lhan cig pa'i rgyu mun pa skyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir snang ba nyid skye ba yin gyi mun pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang de dang lhan cig pa'i rgyu mun pa skyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir snang ba nyid skye ba yin gyi mun pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because in that case, the cause of darkness does not have the power to generate darkness simultaneously with light; light is generated, but not darkness.

original: de nyid kyis zhig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is destroyed by that very light,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bos skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bos skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is generated by the nature of its own entity.

original: rang bzhin gang gis skyes par gyur //🔽de nyid kyis 'jig ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis skyes par gyur // de nyid kyis 'jig ma yin no //
translated: But it is not destroyed by that very nature by which it was produced.

original: rang bzhin gang du de ma skyes //🔽de ltar yang ni 'jig ma yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang du de ma skyes // de ltar yang ni 'jig ma yin //
translated: It is not destroyed by that very nature by which it was not produced.

original: de'i phyir de nyid ni bshig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid ni bshig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not destroyed by that very nature by which it was produced.

original: gal te ma mthong ba nyid zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba nyid zhig pa yin la /
translated: If non-apprehension itself is destruction,

original: de nyid kyang phyis ma mthong ba des na de nyid bshig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang phyis ma mthong ba des na de nyid bshig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and that is not apprehended later, then it is destroyed by that.

original: zhig pa'i gnas skabs su ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar de nyid ces rtogs /
analyzed: zhig pa'i gnas skabs su ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar de nyid ces rtogs /
translated: But how can it be understood that it is that very thing, since the state of destruction is not understood?

original: gang gi tshe rtogs pa de'i tshe ni ma zhig la gang gi tshe zhig pa de'i tshe yang zhig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtogs pa de'i tshe ni ma zhig la gang gi tshe zhig pa de'i tshe yang zhig pa ma yin no //
translated: When it is understood, it is not destroyed. When it is destroyed, it is not understood.

original: gang gi phyir ma rtogs pa de nyid kyis na de zhig pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rtogs pa de nyid kyis na de zhig pa yin te /
translated: But because it is not understood, it is destroyed by that very thing.

original: de lta ma yin te rtogs na zhig pa'i don gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te rtogs na zhig pa'i don gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If it were not so, what would be the meaning of destruction when it is understood?

original: gal te ma dmigs pa zhig pa yin nas phyogs na bum pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir de yang zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs pa zhig pa yin nas phyogs na bum pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir de yang zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If non-apprehension is destruction, then because the pot is not apprehended in one place, it would be destroyed there.

original: gang zhig sngar mthong ba mi dmigs pa de zhig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig sngar mthong ba mi dmigs pa de zhig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the non-apprehension of what was previously seen is its destruction,

original: de yang sngar mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang sngar mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: then that also was only previously seen.

original: gang du mthong ba der de nyid kyi tshe ma dmigs pa ni zhig pa yin no zhe na /🔽de nyid kyi tshe dmigs la de nyid kyi tshe ma dmigs zhes bya ba 'di 'gal lo //
analyzed: gang du mthong ba der de nyid kyi tshe ma dmigs pa ni zhig pa yin no zhe na / de nyid kyi tshe dmigs la de nyid kyi tshe ma dmigs zhes bya ba 'di 'gal lo //
translated: If you say that it is the non-apprehension of it at that time when it was seen,🔽then it is contradictory to say that it is apprehended at that time and not apprehended at that time.

original: de ma thag pa'i dus gzhan du ma dmigs pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i dus gzhan du ma dmigs pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: If you say that it is not apprehended at another time immediately after,

original: bar du mchod pa'i yul gzhan du ma dmigs pa ji ltar zhig pa ma yin /
analyzed: bar du mchod pa'i yul gzhan du ma dmigs pa ji ltar zhig pa ma yin /
translated: then how is it that the object of offering, which is not apprehended at another place, not destroyed?

original: dus gzhan ma mthong ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: dus gzhan ma mthong ba zhig yin na /
translated: If it is not seen at another time,

original: dngos po nyid du dran par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du dran par byed pa yin no //
translated: it is remembered as an entity.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tha snyad tsam kho na sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tha snyad tsam kho na sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, inference establishes only a mere convention,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but not anything else.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las me la sogs pa dngos po ma grub pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin gyi tha snyad tsam ni ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las me la sogs pa dngos po ma grub pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin gyi tha snyad tsam ni ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it the case that the argument from effect establishes that fire and so on are established as things, and not merely as conventions?

original: de yang mi 'thad de /🔽gal te de yang rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de / gal te de yang rjes dpag gis //
translated: That is also untenable.

original: dngos por rab tu sgrub byed na //
analyzed: dngos por rab tu sgrub byed na //
translated: If you establish things as things🔽Through inference,

original: rnam kun grub 'gyur de nyid la //
analyzed: rnam kun grub 'gyur de nyid la //
translated: Then in every way, things would be established

original: tshad mas gzhan dag 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: tshad mas gzhan dag 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: And valid cognitions would not engage other things.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas me la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid grub na /🔽de'i @218a * //🔽tshe de la me 'di ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes nang tshan gyi khyad par shes par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas me la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid grub na / de'i @218a * // tshe de la me 'di ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes nang tshan gyi khyad par shes par 'dod pa na /
translated: If you establish the thingness of fire and so on through inference,🔽then at that time, when you desire to know the specific features of that thing,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: such as “What is the nature of this fire?” valid cognitions such as direct perception will not engage other things.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis de'i rnam pa thams cad sngar grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis de'i rnam pa thams cad sngar grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because inference itself would have already established all of its aspects.

original: gal te srid pa dang / mi srid pa dang / tshad ma dang 'gal ba ste rnam pa gsum yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te srid pa dang / mi srid pa dang / tshad ma dang 'gal ba ste rnam pa gsum yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the three kinds of invalid cognition nonapprehension, impossibility, and contradiction with perception?

original: rung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa'o //
translated: The statement “An effect arises from a suitable cause” is a possibility.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: The statement “If there is no cause, there is no effect” is an impossibility.

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba yang me grang po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba yang me grang po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The statement “Fire is cold” is a contradiction with perception.

original: de la mngon sum gyis rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa yin la /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa yin la /
translated: The statement “Perception apprehends all aspects” is a possibility.

original: rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa ni mi srid pa dang / tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa ni mi srid pa dang / tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan 'jug go zhe na /
translated: The statement “Inference apprehends” is an impossibility and a contradiction with valid cognition, and therefore another valid cognition is applied.

original: 'di ni rmongs pa'i spyod pa'i tshul te /🔽'di ltar / mi srid pa dang 'gal ba ni //
analyzed: 'di ni rmongs pa'i spyod pa'i tshul te / 'di ltar / mi srid pa dang 'gal ba ni //
translated: This is the method of the conduct of the ignorant.🔽Thus:🔽From what apprehension of an entity

original: dngos po 'dzin pa gang las yin //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa gang las yin //
translated: Is an impossibility and a contradiction?

original: dngos po 'dzin pa yin na ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa yin na ni //
translated: If it is the apprehension of an entity,

original: 'di gnyis rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: These two are not reasonable.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa 'dor na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa 'dor na ni /
translated: If you reject the aspect that is not different from that consciousness because it is impossible for it to apprehend all aspects and because it is contradictory for another valid cognition to engage it,

original: de'i tshe dngos po 'dzin pa nyid kyang ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po 'dzin pa nyid kyang ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time it would not even be the apprehension of an entity.

original: de nyid kyi tshe de nyid bzung ba dang ma bzung bar ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe de nyid bzung ba dang ma bzung bar ni mi rigs so //
translated: At that time, it is illogical for it to be both apprehended and not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du shes pa gang de 'dzin pa rang yin la mi 'dzin pa'ang yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang mi srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa gang de 'dzin pa rang yin la mi 'dzin pa'ang yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang mi srid pa kho na'o //
translated: In the same way, it is impossible for any consciousness to be both the apprehender and the nonapprehender.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du /🔽'khrul phyir rtags ni rnam pa kun //
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du / 'khrul phyir rtags ni rnam pa kun //
translated: But if you think,🔽The reason is not the cause of the apprehension of all aspects

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin //🔽spyi la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin // spyi la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of error,

original: khyad par rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: The particular would not be established,🔽Because there is no error regarding the universal.

original: gsal ba thams cad thun mong du bzung ba'i rtags ni so sor nges pa'i gsal ba la ma nges pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gsal ba thams cad thun mong du bzung ba'i rtags ni so sor nges pa'i gsal ba la ma nges pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the reason that apprehends all instances of the particular in common is not ascertained with regard to the particular that is distinct from it,

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: then if that were so,

original: gtan tshigs nyid ni ma nges phyir //🔽rtags kyi stobs las khyad par ni //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ni ma nges phyir // rtags kyi stobs las khyad par ni //
translated: Because the reason itself is not ascertained.

original: 'dzin par srid pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'dzin par srid pa ma yin na //
translated: The distinction is not apprehended by the power of the reason.

original: ji ltar dngos po 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po 'dzin pa yin //
translated: How is the thing apprehended?

original: 'di na me gang yod ni mi shes kyi sngar me du ma mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: 'di na me gang yod ni mi shes kyi sngar me du ma mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Here, one does not know that there is fire, but following the previous perception of many fires,

original: 'di na me 'ga' zhig yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di na me 'ga' zhig yod do zhe na /
translated: one says that there is some fire here.

original: me tsam 'ba' zhig shes pa 'di ni rtogs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: me tsam 'ba' zhig shes pa 'di ni rtogs pa kho na ste /
translated: This mere knowledge of fire is only an understanding,

original: 'on kyang dngos po dngos po la reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po dngos po la reg pa ni ma yin no //
